loans.name: Srey Mom

texts.en: Mrs. Srey Mom M. is a villager in Chheu Teal Phluoh village in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy six more pigs and pig food for her current breeding. Mrs. Srey Mom M. is a widow with two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the youngest one attends the local school.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy six more pigs and pig food.

loans.name: Sreypich

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreypich T., 27, and her husband, Mr. Sokhai Khoem, 24, were married in 2008 and have just had a young daughter. The family lives in a small village along National Road Number Two about 13 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Sreypich has been a farmer since she was young, while her husband has been a policeman for five years. She is asking for her first loan of $600 to purchase seeds, pesticide, and fertilizer and to pay the plowing fee.

loans.use: To buy seeds, pesticides & fertilizer and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Evejella

texts.en:
Evejella Q. is from the village of Batangan, Valencia City. She is 48 years old. Evejella is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Evejella owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling firewood in the local community. Evejella has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Evejella joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evejella is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Evejella from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Celestino

texts.es:
Celestino es un hombre trabajador de 47 años, vive junto a su esposa Dominga, de 38 años, y sus dos hijos: Noemí de 17 y Raquel de 15 años, en su casa propia.
Está muy orgulloso de ser agricultor desde hace 20 años, teniendo el apoyo de su esposa, quien es la que le da ideas para progresar. Con esfuerzo y dedicación en lo que mejor sabe hacer desea brindarles una adecuada calidad de vida a su familia, ya que con las ganancias que obtuvo de la agricultura pudo comprar su casa y amoblarla, también pudo comprar terrenos fértiles donde cosecha gran cantidad de papa, arveja, maíz y flores (gladiolos).
Para más adelante, planea comprar terrenos productivos en una zona cafetalera de la selva central del Perú.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y como la primera vez, demostrará que es responsable en sus acciones. Asimismo asegura que está contento de pertenecer a un banco comunal muy organizado. Con el monto que ahora solicita comprará tres sacos de fertilizantes y dos botellas de insecticida para proteger sus sembríos, y también pretende cubrir el pago de los operarios que contratará.
texts.en:
Celestino is a hard-working, 47 year old man. He lives with his wife, 38 year old Dominga, and his two children, 17 year old Noemí and 15 year old Raquel. They live in their own house. He is very proud to have been a farmer for 20 years. He has his wife’s support; she gave him the ideas to progress. With effort and dedication in what he knows how to do best, he wants to give his family a good quality of life. With the income from the farming he was able to buy a house and furnish it. He was also able to buy fertile land where he harvests a great quantity of potatoes, peas, corn, and flowers (gladiolas). Later on he plans to buy fertile land in a coffee growing area in the central jungle of Perú. This is the second loan he has had with MFP. Like the first time, he will show that he is responsible in his actions. He affirms that he is happy to belong to such an organized communal bank. With the amount that he is now requesting he will buy three sacks of fertilizer and two bottles of insecticide to protect the plants in his fields. He also intends to pay the workmen he will hire.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Kiyunga Development Group, Lugazi

texts.en:
N. Alice (shown inset top left as well as in the main photograph) is the leader of her lending group in Lugazi. She is a determined lady who is married with two children, aged three and five, both of whom are in nursery as she takes care of her parents. 
Alice is a businesswoman involved in the sale of agricultural produce, fruits and vegetables, from Katoogo trading center. She says that her previous loan, which was her first ever, helped her to increase her stock and the quality of what she sells. In the future, she hopes to become a wholesaler supplying to other traders in the market and in other markets. Alice is requesting a loan to stock more produce for resale.

loans.use: To buy more produce for resale

loans.name: José Juan

texts.es:
Este será su tercer crédito con Kiva y está muy agradecido por su cooperación ya que le han ayudad a mejorar su taller y dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. 
Esta nuevamente solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar una maquinaria que le está haciendo falta. 
 Pagar el crédito con una parte de sus ganancias del taller, ya que tiene bajo su responsabilidad a sus dos hijos adolescentes y desea que tenga un buen estudio.
texts.en:
This will be his third loan with Kiva and he is very thankful for their cooperation since they have helped him to improve his shop and give better service to his customers. He is requesting another loan to be able to buy machinery that he is lacking. He will pay the loan with a part of his shop's earnings since he has under his responsibility his two adolescent children and he wishes that they get a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a machine and a manometer.

loans.name: Balvina

texts.es: Doña Balvina es casada tiene 5 hijos.  Doña Balvina es comerciante desde hace 15 años tiene una venta en el mercado municipal de Antigua Guatemala los dias martes y jueves, y durante los dias viernes y domingos vende en el mercado municipal de San Martin Jilotepeque; en los dos puestos vende artículos de consumo diarío y en su tiempo libre teje güipiles, Doña Balvina solicita el crédito para invertir en la venta de artículos de consumo diario que tiene, comprar material para la elaboración de güipiles y gallinas.
texts.en:
Balvina is married and has five children. She has been a merchant for the past 15 years with a sales post at the municipal market of Antigua Guatemala from Monday through Thursday, and on Fridays and Sundays she sells at the municipal market of San Martin Jilotepeque. She sells grocery items at her posts, and in her free time she weaves traditional garments. Balvina is requesting the loan to invest in her business and also purchase chickens and weaving materials to make her garments.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her sales posts and also purchase chickens and weaving materials.

loans.name: Uyanga

texts.en:
Uyanga E. is a 39-year-old woman.  She lives in the town of Ulaanbaatar.  She is married and does not have any children.  To make a living, Uyanga owns and operates a jewelry business.  Uyanga has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,150,000 Tugrug a month.

Uyanga joined Credit Mongol LLC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She is requesting a loan of 1,700,000 Tugrug.  This loan, her first from Credit Mongol LLC, will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings.  Uyanga plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her jewelry business.

About Credit Mongol:
Credit Mongol’s mission is to contribute to the prosperity of Mongols by providing diversified financial services to micro and SME clients and to become the best performing company in micro and SME financing in Mongolia.

loans.use: To expand her jewelry business

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: La Sra. Cristina tiene un consultorio donde brinda servicios de enfermería, tales como toma de presión arterial, curaciones, test de embarazos, inyecciones, etc.; tiene un año aproximadamente en esta actividad ya que el año pasado terminó su carrera de enfermería, anteriormente tenía una fotocopiadora, pero su sueño siempre fue tener su propio consultorio. Tiene un hijo que está en edad escolar, ella sola se dedica a su manutención, vive en la zona de Pampahasi, y es muy conocida por la zona. el crédito será invertido en completar el saldo que le falta para tomar el local en anticrético, ya que le está yendo bien, es una persona responsable y trabajadora con ganas de superacion desea mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Sra. Cristina operates a clinic where she offers her services as a nurse, which include blood pressure checks, first aid, pregnancy tests, injections, etc. She started this business a year ago shortly after finishing her nursing degree. Cristina previously managed a photocopy shop, but her dream had always been to establish her own clinic. She has a son who is of school age and is dedicated to supporting him. Cristina lives in the Pamphasi district and is well-known in the area.

Her loan will be used to cover the remaining balance that is required to enter into an “anticrético” lease agreement so that she can secure the location for her clinic. (In an “anticrético” arrangement, the owner leases property for a lump sum deposit in lieu of monthly rent. At the end of the lease period, the money is returned to the renter. If the owner fails to repay the money, the renter gets to keep the property.) Cristina’s business is doing well. She is a responsible and hardworking person who desires to improve herself and provide a better quality of life for her entire family.

Cristina is extremely grateful to Emprender and Kiva for their confidence in her by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in an “anticrético” lease agreement to secure the location for her clinic

loans.name: Isaiah Otieno

texts.en:
Isaiah Otieno O. has a chain of motorcycles that operate as taxis in Migori. He started this business in 2009, after quitting selling clothes, to generate enough income to be able to support his family. He is 40 years old, married, and is the father of five children.

Isaiah would like to add another motorcycle that will ensure an increased income as he works towards achieving his dream of owning a vehicle for a matatu (minibus) business. But to achieve this, he needs a loan of Ksh 50,000.

loans.use: To add another motorcycle to his business

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. Chea V. is 32 years old and a resident of Kompong Tom Province, where she operates a small business raising a few pigs for income. Beyond this, she has a life partner in her husband, who is hired by people to plow farmland for a fee. She was married many years, but has no children yet. Chea V. is a hard-working woman who never wastes time in order to earn money to ensure that the family has a better life. Chea V. is taking out her first loan to support her pig raising activity.

loans.use: To support her pig raising activity.

loans.name: Roger

texts.es:
Roger tiene 32 años de edad, es soltero y vive con su madre en el caserío Valle San Juan del distrito de Tambogrande de la provincia de Piura, sus actividades económicas principales son la agricultura y la ganadería, se encuentra ubicado en la región Piura, a mas de tres horas de camino de la ciudad de  Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabaja como ganadero desde hace siete años, el cría vacas en un corral cercano a su vivienda y diariamente extrae la leche que estas producen y la ofrece en venta en la ciudad de Sullana. Este negocio es su principal fuente de ingreso por lo que siempre trata de darle a sus animales un buen cuidado y alimentación para que estos tengan una buena producción.

Roger desea mejorar la producción de su ganado brindándole una mejor alimentación, por ello desea adquirir alimento balanceado y pastos naturales con los cuales sus vacas producirán mas leche y aumentara sus ventas y ganancias, para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Roger es una persona trabajadora y entregada a su familia, su mayor anhelo es poder brindarle a su madre una mejor calidad de evida. En la zona donde vive el es bastante conocido y estimado por sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Roger is 32 years old. He is single and lives with his mother in the community of Valle San Juan of the district of Tambogrande of the province of Piura. Its main economic activities are agriculture and cattle. It is located in the Piura region, more than three hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region. He has worked with cattle for more than seven years. He raises cows in a corral close to his residence and every day extracts the milk that they produce and offers it for sale in the city of Sullana. This business is the main source of income so he always tries to give good care and feed to his animals so they will always have good production. Roger wants to improve his cattle's production by offering them better feed. That is why he wants to acquire balanced feed and natural grasses with which his cows will produce more milk and his sales and earnings will increase. To acheive this goal, he has asked Edpyme Alternativa for the first time for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles. Roger is a hardworking person who is dedicated to his family. His greatest wish is to offer his mother a better quality of life. In the area where he lives, he is very well known and esteemed by his neighbors.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase balanced feed and natural grasses to improve the feed and production of his dairy cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchase high-quality cosmetics and furniture for her salon

loans.name: God Help Group

texts.en:
Freeman B., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called God Help. He is 56 years old, is married, and has seven children who range in age from 21 to 33. He was only able to attend school through 11th grade due to lack of financial support.  

For 22 years, he has been selling charcoal in Nezoe Community Market outside of Monrovia, Liberia.

He plans to use his 6,000 Liberian dollars portion of this 26,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more bags of charcoal. He describes himself as a loving person.

His goal is to improve his business and build a warehouse.

In the photo, Martha is inset at the lower right because she was absent when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: To buy charcoal.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es: Haydee, de 35 años, es una mujer muy sincera y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Elmer de 40 años y sus 2 queridos hijos Emerson de 9 y Medali de 2 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. La bodega de Haydee es la primera en abrirse en su Pueblo, desde las 6 de la mañana sus puertas ya están listas para recibir a sus madrugadores compradores, quienes sabiendo de la variedad de la mercadería que tiene en su bodega, no dudan en comprarle, ya que tienen la seguridad de que van a encontrar las cosas que necesitan. Lleva 9 años en este negocio y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes. Con el tiempo, anhela hacer crecer su negocio y brindarles a sus clientes un mejor servicio. Este es el décimo crédito con MFP y espera poder pagar a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarles problemas a las compañeras de su grupo comunal, en donde es muy respetada debido al orden que le pone al grupo. Con los tres mil soles que solicita, comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Haydee is 35 years old. She is a sincere and cheerful woman and she lives in her own home with her husband Elmer, 40, and their two beloved children, Emerson, 9 and Medali, 2. They are the reason for all of their hard work. Haydee's convenience store is the first one to open in her town. Her doors are open at 6 am ready to welcome her early rising customers. They know the variety of her store's merchandise and they trust her because they know taht they are going to find what they need. She has been in this business for 9 years and what she likes the most about the work is talking to her customers. In time, she hopes to grow her business and offer her customers a better service. This is her tenth loan with MFP and she expects to be able to make the payments on time, since she doesn't want to cause problems for the other group members. She s very respected in the group and she is very respected there and brings order to the group. With the three thousand soles that she is asking for, she will buy more products to outfit her grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more products to outfit her store.

loans.name: G. S. La Nueva Vida En Cristo Group

texts.es: La señora María R. Hernández tiene 48 años de edad, es casada con tres, hijos los cuales ya dos son mayores de edad y una hija de 13 años. La señora se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, los cuales distribuye en el mercado el mayoreo. Este negocio surgió desde hace 9 años, dio inicio ante la falta de trabajo que aqueja el país, además de la necesidad de un ingreso fijo. Este negocio lo aprendió de su mama. Ella solicita este crédito con el objetivo de poder invertir en el negocio y de esta manera poder salir adelante. Otro integrante de este grupo es don José Santiago el cual tiene 51 años de edad, Su esposa es ama de casa y solamente le ayuda a preparar la mercadería. El señor se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, el tiene un pequeño tramo localizado en el mercado. El último integrante del grupo es don José Luis, es casado y tiene una hija de 5 años de edad. Su esposa se dedica al comercio de frutas, por lo que le ayuda en su negocio. El señor se dedica al comercio de frutas y verduras, el cual vende en el mercado. Este negocio ya tiene 5 años de estar funcionando, dio inicio ante la necesidad de mantener a su hija, después vio que era rentable y decidieron establecerse en un local. Por lo que juntos han decido mejorar sus negocios por medio de los financiamientos.
texts.en:
Ms. María R. Hernández is a 48-year-old married mother with three children, two of whom are grown, and one daughter is 13. Ms. R. sells fruits and vegetables at the wholesale market for a living. She started this business 9 years ago because of the high unemployment rate in the country at that time. Furthermore, she needed to have a steady income. She learned this trade from her mother. She is requesting this loan with the goal of investing it in her business so that she can get ahead. Another member of the group is Mr. José Santiago, age 51, whose wife is a homemaker and helps him prepare the merchandise. He also sells fruits and vegetables at his small stand in the market. The last group member is Mr. José Luis, who is married and has a 5-year-old daughter. His wife sells fruits, and he helps her out. He sells fruits and vegetables at the market. He has been in business for 5 years. He launched the business because he needed to support his daughter. He later realized how lucrative it was and decided to establish himself in a business space. They have all decided to improve their businesses via these loans.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.es:
Sebastiana es socia del Banco comunal “Chojchoni” desde hace cinco años atrás, pertenece al distrito de Copani, provincia Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 37 años de edad, de estado civil casada, grado de instrucción primaria completa, tiene tres hijos de: 16, 12 y 7 años de edad.
Sebastiana se dedica a la venta de frazadas, esta actividad la realiza de lunes a sábado en La Paz - Bolivia. Con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/.300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/.300.00 nuevos soles, para aumentar un poco más de mercadería, comprará frazadas al por mayor.
Su visión es crecer en su negocio y llevar a otros departamentos de Bolivia. Lo que más le gusta de su Banquito Comunal son las ganancias que genera sus ahorro.
texts.en:
Sebastiana has been a member of the “”Chojchoni” communal bank for five years. She is from the Copani district, located in the Yunguyo province, and Puno department. She is 37 years old, married, and has three children, ages 16, 12, and 7. She has an elementary school education. Sebastiana sells blankets from Monday through Saturday in La Paz, Bolivia. Her first loan of 300 PEN, through “Movimiento Manuela Ramos” allowed her to increase her working capital. She is asking for this loan of 300 PEN ($125) so that she can increase her inventory a bit by buying blankets in bulk. Her vision is to grow her business and sell her merchandise in more Bolivian departments. The things she likes most about her communal bank are the earnings that her savings generate.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Blankets

loans.name: Kafui Yolande

texts.fr: kafui a ouvert en 2000 sa propre boutique dans laquelle elle vend des fournitures de bureau, elle s'approvisionne à Lomé et exerce son commerce dans son quartier de résidence "ablogamé" qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé. sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. elle  sollicite son deuxième crédit de WAGES pour s'acheter 100 cartons  de papiers rame, des sous mains et des chemises et divers autres fournitures. c'est avec le revenu de ce commerce qu'elle subvient à ses propres charges.
texts.en:
In 2000, Kafui opened a shop where she sells office supplies. Her business is located in her home district of Ablogamé, a suburb of the city of Lomé. Her clientele includes people of all walks of life. She buys her supplies in Lomé. She is requesting her second loan from WAGES to buy 100 boxes of paper reams, desk blotters, folders and other supplies. She has been able to support herself with the income from her business.

Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of office supplies

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita R. is from the village of San Antonio, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 53 years old. Merlita is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Merlita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Merlita has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Merlita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Merlita is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Merlita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia E. is from the village of Ricoro, Gingoog City. She is 60 years old. Lucia is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Lucia owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & snacks in the local community. Lucia has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lucia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Lucia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Lucia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Koim

texts.en: Koim S., 28, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean Temples. S. is employed at a factory, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker in the city, earning an income of about USD 5 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family has to spend USD 50 on food, USD 5 on electricity supply, and USD 33 on other necessary expenses every month. S. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. S.'s husband appears in the photograph because S. is not available.

loans.use: Buy a motorbike for her husband to commute to work.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is engaged in running a grocery store, particularly selling basic items, as her source of income. She has been in this business for 10 years and earns a monthly income of 3,000 PHP from this activity. Flora M. is from the village of Salimpuno, Sapang Dalaga. She is 56 years old, married, and is blessed with 4 adult children.

In 2005, Flora joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Flora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase new stock to sell. Flora is requesting her 10th loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used as additional working capital for the business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional working capital.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald D. is from the village of Pana-on Misamis Occidental. He is 25 years old. Ronald is single. To make a living, Ronald owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating transportation services. Ronald has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ronald joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ronald has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Ronald is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to repair existing vehicle to provide better service. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Ronald from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Ferdinand

texts.en:
Ferdinand B. C. is a 55 year old man who is married to Clerice Mbodza (a business woman) and they are blessed with three children. Ferdinand has operated his hotel business for the last six years. With his business he has been able to cater for all his family’s needs and, for this, he is grateful to God.

This will be his first loan from KADET LTS and he plans to purchase more items of cutlery for the hotel. He knows that, especially in the festive season, he will get a large number of customers and he does not want to suffer the embarrassment of not having enough cutlery to serve his customers. He hopes to use the profits to pay school fees for his grandchild’s education.

He hopes that his business will grow to become great.

loans.use: To purchase cutlery for the hotel

loans.name: Celinda Ines

texts.es:
Celinda Ines Y. G. tiene 42 años, es soltera y vive con sus padres en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. 

Celinda Ines es miembro de la ventanilla rural Unidos Somos Más. Esta nueva ventanilla hace parte de la comunidad Matilde Esther en la provincia de Guayas. Esta comunidad esta ubicada a 2 horas de la oficina de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. El grupo cuenta con 23 socios y se dedican a diferentes actividades como agricultura, cría de ganados y pequeños restaurantes y comedores.   

Celinda Ines cría chanchos y ella tiene este negocio desde hace unos 3 años.  Ella solicita el crédito para ampliar la cría de chanchos. Ella compra y vende los chanchos en Matilde Esther. Gracias al crédito ella podrá mejorar su servicio.

En el futuro ella desea tener una finca y una casa propia. Su meta es mejorar su trabajo y superar en la venta de chanchos. 

Los desafíos que ella enfrenta son problemas de salud y una bajada de ventas en la época de invierno.
texts.en:
Celinda Ines Y. G. is 42 years old.  She is single and lives with her parents in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.

Celinda Ines is a member of the 'Unidos Somos Más' (United We Are Stronger) rural loan group.  This new group is located in the community of Matilde Esther, in Guayas province, 2 hours from our Chillanes office in Bolívar province.  The group has 23 members who work in different business activities such as farming, livestock raising and running small restaurants and eateries.

Celinda Ines raises pigs and she has had her business for 3 years.  She is requesting this loan to expand her pig raising business.  She buys and sells her pigs in Matilde Esther.  This loan will enable her to improve her service.  In the future, she would like to own a farm and her own home.  Her goal is to improve her work and improve her pig sales.  The challenges she faces in her business are health problems and a lowering of sales during the winter season.

loans.use: To expand her pig raising business

loans.name: Benon

texts.en: Benon is a fifty-nine-year-old married man with four children living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has been selling maize for over twenty years and with this business he has been able to educate his children. His hardship is the seasonal nature of the business and his dream is to have at least a hundred sacks of maize. Benon needs the loan to purchase sacks of maize.

loans.use: Purchasing sacks of maize

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a 55-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a business buying and selling rice. She lives in Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2010 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 4,200.

Erlinda is borrowing PHP 12,000 in order to purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 3rd loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 7,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Erlinda hopes to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to purchase more rice to sell

loans.name: Juan  Pablo

texts.es:
Juan tiene 51 años y es casado. Vive con su esposa en su casa propia en el caserío Hualcatal Chico en el distrito de Olmos que es conocido como la capital del limón. Este se ubica en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Actualmente, Juan y su esposo no cuentan con servicios de agua y luz. 

Se dedica a la crianza de ganado ovino y caprino en un corral en su propio domicilio. El cría animales menores y cuando ya han alcanzado el tamaño y peso ideal los ofrece en venta a algunos negociantes y al público en general en los mercados locales en Olmos y en Chiclayo. Cuenta con una clientela establecida y fidelizada. 

Juan desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales y alimentos balanceados. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2,000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Juan is 51 years old and married.  He lives with his wife in their own house in the Hualcatal Chico hamlet in the Olmos district, which is known as the lemon capital.  This district is located in the province of Lambayeque, more than two hours from the city of Chiclayo.  Currently, Juan and his wife do not have running water or electricity.

He raises sheep and goats in a corral at his house.  He raises young animals, and when they have reached the ideal size and weight he sells them to businesspeople and to the general public at the local markets in Olmos and in Chiclayo.  He has an established and loyal customer base.  

Juan wants to expand his business with the purchase of more animals and balanced animal feed.  Therefore, he has decided to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles.

loans.use: To acquire more livestock and balanced animal feed

loans.name: Hy

texts.en:
Hy S. earns a living by selling vegetables in the local market in Kompong Cham province. She always buys vegetables in bulk from her regular supplier, and then sells them for a profit. She also depends on her husband who works in the construction field, making an average profit of $2.50 a day to share responsibility with Hy S. for the daily expenses. 

The family’s situation is not comfortable as their house doesn’t have its own deep well. They always go to take water from their neighbors’ well when they need to use water. To solve this situation, Hy S. is asking for her loan to dig a well for the whole family to use. With the remaining cash, she will purchase dirt to fill under her house. 

Hy S. and her husband appear in the picture.

loans.use: To dig a well

loans.name: Abdukholik

texts.en:
Abdukholik is married and has three children. He sells food products in the market. Abdukholik knows his customers’ preferences and always offers them only good quality items. He has been in the food market trade for about 5 years. His business has been marked with consistent stability. 

Abdukholik is hoping to invest a loan of $2,300 USD in additional merchandise, which will help him eventually increase his turnover capital. He has a vision for the expansion of his business and we believe this loan will be helpful to his entrepreneurial endeavors. It will help Abdukholik to persist, taking small steps at a time to achieve success, which we think will be absolutely inevitable.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase more foodstuffs to increase the range of goods for sale.

loans.name: Teola

texts.en:
Teola R. is from the village of Villaramos. She is 45 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children.

Teola owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Teola joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to do business. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC.

Teola is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase fresh fish to sell; some will also be used to purchase groceries for her sari-sari store. This loan will be her sixth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish for sale and groceries for sari-sari store

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
Rafael tiene 24 años de edad, es soltero y vive con sus padres en el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.  Tambogrande es un lugar que se caracteriza por sus deseos de superarse 


Rafael  dedica al servicio de mototaxi, que es un vehículo que consiste en una moto y una cabina para transportar personas.  Su unidad está en buen estado y operativa, pero es necesario hacerle mantenimiento para mantener esta operatividad. Con los ingresos que percibe cubre sus gastos personales y los de sus padres.

Rafael necesita darle mantenimiento a su unidad móvil, es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles en Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Rafael, 24, is single living with his parents in the farming Tambogrande District, a farming area located in Piura Region over four hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque Region’s capital.  Tambogrande is a place that’s noted for their desire to improve.

Rafael provides mototaxi transport services; this is a vehicle consisting of a motorcycle with an attached passenger transport cabin.  His vehicle is in good working order but to keep it this way maintenance is required.  Income he earns cover his personal expenses as well as his parents’.

Rafael needs to provide maintenance for his vehicle and this is why he’s asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1500 new sol loan.

loans.use: to provive vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 40. She is a married woman with seven children. The oldest child is 14. Her husband works as a farmer. 

She is a farmer working in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. She has been farming for two years. She earns 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month doing this farming. 

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizer and seeds. In the future, she hopes to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru: Ширинова Дилором проживает в городе Худжанд. Возраст, 31 год. Замужем, имеет троих детей. Ее муж занимается бизнесом. Сама она уже год как занимается торговлей. В основном она покупает по низкой цене макулатуру и продает ее по более выгодной цене. Кредит берет для покупки макулатуры.
texts.en: Dilorom S. lives in the city of Khujand. She is 31 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband works in business. She has been working in trade for a year. Basically she buys paper for recycling for a low price and resells it for a higher price. She is taking out a loan to buy paper for recycling.

loans.use: to buy paper for recycling

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Wanting to assist her husband provide their family needs, Melanie is also doing her best managing their farming business. At the age of 46, she now has two school-aged children. With that, Melanie's determination to improve their living standard increased.

To have a large crop of rice, Melanie is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides. She knows that with this loan, she will have a bountiful harvest. At present, Melanie is earning PHP 25,000 per harvest. In the future, Melanie wants to double her income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Kollitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KOLLITAS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Panamericana, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Lidia. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercio, producción, cultivo y servicios.
 
La señora Lidia,  indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer  y que ingreso por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa de bebe, que viene trabajando hace cinco meses atrás, el cual inicio con la ayuda de su cuñada.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para surtir su mercadería (compra de ropa de bebe), este material lo compra de la C. Tumusla y lo venderá en la feria16 de julio (lugar comercial de la ciudad de El Alto). Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el consultorio.
texts.en:
The Kollitas Community Association will start its first loan cycle with Kiva partner Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Panamericana. It is comprised of seven members and is run by a board of directors headed by Lidia. The businesses that the members of the community association run are varied. Among them we have sales, production, farming, and services.

Lidia states that this is her first time working with Pro Mujer, and she joined at the invitation of a promoter. She has a business selling baby clothes, which she has been running for five years, and which she started with the help of her sister-in-law.

The loan she will take is to invest in merchandise (buying baby clothes). She will purchase these items on Tumusla street and will sell them at the 16 de Julio Market (a commercial zone in the city of El Alto). This work allows her to generate revenue to support her family. She is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said that she likes the training and consulting.

loans.use: to purchase baby clothes

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a mason. Nana has completed junior high school. She cooks food such as banku and rice, which she sells in Abura. Banku is a staple made from corn and it is normally eaten with okra stew. Nana serves the rice with tomato sauce.

Nana uses her income to assist her husband in the education of her children. She will use this loan to purchase bags of rice, tomatoes, fresh pepper, corn and other items to cook. With the new profits from her expanded business, Nana plans to build a restaurant. In the picture above, she is at the kitchen where she prepares the food before going to sell. At the time of the visit, she had finished selling for the day and so she demonstrated how the banku is prepared.

loans.use: to purchase rice, tomatoes, fresh pepper, corn and other items to cook.

loans.name: Noupagagnon Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe NOUPAGAGNON III sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38ans, 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à  TAMBA, un des villages de la commune de NANTIEN dans la préfecture de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont : l’arachide et le pois sucré avec MARIAM 2ème à gauche position debout de la photo.
 Avec son prêt, elle compte payer les frais de labour, acheter des intrants et les semences pour entretenir : 0.5 hectare. 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du village et au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 35.00FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
Elle souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’ exploiter au mieux son espace cultural pour en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
The ten members of the NOUPAGAGNON III group are married women who are on   average 38 years old and have four children each. Most of them live in polygamous families in Tamba, a village in the municipality of NANTIEN, in the prefecture of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.

They have partnered with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their fifth loan with the MFI, and all previous loans were correctly repaid.

They grow groundnuts and sweet peas. MARIAM, standing in the photo second from the left, will use her loan to buy inputs and seeds, and to pay for the plowing of about 0.5 hectare.

After harvest, the crops are sold in the village and at the Sikasso market to a clientele composed of both men and women. Mariam expects to earn on average 35,000 FCFA per season.

This revenue will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the daily expenses. She hopes to maintain this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso in order to make the most of her farming land and bolster her profits.

loans.use: to buy inputs and seeds, and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Arlyn has a retail shop that sells fish like tamban, kotob & tabas. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy fish to sell.

Arlyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Arlyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Prisca

texts.es: La señora Prisca trabaja como costurera en un taller de costura de su propiedad y su esposo trabaja como carpintero. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de materia prima como ser: telas, cierres, forros y otros insumos para su taller. Vive en casa de sus padres  la misma queda ubicada en la zona Ernesto Torres en la ciudad de La Paz; es casada y tiene un hijo. Esta es la segunda vez que su crédito es canalizado a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Prisca works as a seamstress in her own sewing workshop.  Her husband works as a carpenter.  

She needs the loan to buy basic supplies like fabric, zippers, lining, and other supplies for her workshop.

She lives in her parents’ house, which is located in the Ernesto Torre zone in the city of La Paz.  She is married and has a son.  

This is the second time that she has requested a loan through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy fabric, zippers, lining, and other supplies for her sewing workshop.

loans.name: Sokhorn

texts.en:
Sokhorn, age 45, is a fish farmer. She and her husband raise fish to offer for sale, and their income is $4 per day. They have three children: one is studying in school, and the other two are employed in a factory and earn $4 per day each. 

Every month, Sokhorn has to spend $51 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on school fees, and $10 on household expenses. 

She would like to request a loan in the amount of $500 in order to buy a pumping machine and additional fish. In the future, she hopes to send her youngest child to university when he finishes high school.

loans.use: to buy a pumping machine and additional fish to raise and offer for sale

loans.name: Kwamenkuruma Group

texts.en:
Ibrahim, who is in his late 20s, is single with one small son. He has been running a retail shop for two and half years now.  He works from 6 am to 10 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.
 
This will be his first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which he wants to use to increase the shop's inventory. His dream is to one day be able to build his own house. 

He will share this loan with his loan group "Kwamenkuruma", which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase the shop inventory.

loans.name: Dewi Fortuna Group

texts.en:
The Dewi Fortuna group is getting their third loan from MUK. There are 11 members in the group and the total loan is Rp 22,000,000. The loan will be used to buy piglets and repair their cages.

Jero Pudak, as the head of the group, is using the loan to buy three piglets of a superior species. The price for superior pig species is currently very expensive, ranging from Rp 400,000 - Rp 500,000. These pigs will be maintained for five months for fattening. Jero Pudak expects during the loan period that the pigs will be able to develop properly, without being attacked by disease. With this effort, she dreams of fixing her house.

loans.use: to buy three piglets

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia, a hardworking 42-year-old businesswoman who is married and blessed with four children, has been selling cereals for the last year to earn a living. She is also employed as a teacher. Lucia, who has grown her business with her previous loan from Faulu Kenya, is now requesting  a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy beans and peas. In the next five years, she wants to expand her enterprise.

loans.use: to buy beans and peas.

loans.name: José Rufino

texts.es:
José es un comerciante informal de artesanías de 30 años de edad quien vive con su mamá y dos hermanas.

 Él tiene diez años de trabajar en las ferias, él se desplaza de pueblo en pueblo en las fecha festivas para vender los productos artesanales que compra por mayoreo y algunos los elabora personalmente, este oficio lo aprendió de unos amigos y luego decidió establecer su propio negocio. Él es originario de Morazán, no obstante por su negocio el recorre toda la zona oriental del país y ya tiene dos locales donde vende sus artesanías. 

José es una persona muy alegre y trabajadora. El señor se levanta todas la mañanas a instalar su venta a razón de que las personas que visitan las ferias puedan apreciar sus productos y adquirirlos a precios accesibles. Para él es un poco difícil estar separado tantos días de su familia pero también reconoce que la vida esta difícil y es necesario hacer sacrificios para tener un mejor porvenir.

El cliente solicita un crédito en Fundación Campo, por que actualmente tiene un inventario pequeño y quiere aumentarlo por que ya se avecinan las festividades de fin de año, periodo en el que las ventas se incrementan por ser varios pueblos los que celebran sus fiestas patronales. José tiene el plan de comprar productos por mayoreo y con ello obtener un buen porcentaje de ganancias y ayudar a su mamá con los gastos del hogar.  A futuro José quiere tener varios puestos de artesanías y a medida aumenten sus ingresos, él tiene planeado mejorar su casa y estar pendiente de cualquier necesidad que se presente en su familia.
texts.en:
José is an informal crafts merchant.  He’s 30 years old and lives with his mother and sisters.  He’s been working at the markets for ten years.  He goes from town to town during festive occasions to sell the crafts he buys at wholesale and some that he makes himself.  He learned this occupation from some friends and then decided to set up his own business.  He is from Morazán but due to his work he travels throughout the eastern part of the country and already has two locales where he sells his crafts.

José is a very cheerful, hardworking person.  He rises every morning to set up his stand so that people visiting the market can admire his products and buy them at affordable prices.  For him, it’s a bit difficult to be separated from his family for so many days but he recognizes that life is difficult and sacrifices have to be made to have a better future.

The client has asked Fundación Campo for a loan because his stock inventory is currently small and he wants to increase it because the end of year festivities are approaching and this is a time when sales increase because several towns celebrate their patron saints days.  José plans to buy products at wholesale so that he can earn a good profit percentage and help his mother with household expenses.  In the future, José would like to have several crafts stands and as his income improves he plans to make home improvements and to be able to take care of any need his family might have.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to increase his stock inventory.

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es: Roberto de 31 años es casado y tiene 1 hijo su esposa se dedica a las labores del hogar como lo son lavar, planchar, cocinar, atender a los niños etc., mientras el trabaja como taxista ruletero en la ciudad su trabajo consta de andar de calle en calle buscando pasajeros para trasladarlos al lugar que ellos le indiquen con esta actividad el tiene poco menos del año y es propietario del carro con el cual el trabaja. El y su esposa tienen 7 años viviendo en su domicilio, la casa en la que ellos viven fue una donación por parte del gobierno y cuando estas se las entregaron era solo un pie de casa Roberto ha ido haciéndole mejoras a su casa ya que el sabe que si algún día el llegara a faltar su familia tendrían un techo seguro. Ahora quiere construir un cuarto en la planta baja de su casa para extender la sala comedor y así tener mas espacio para esto quiere comprar material como lo es cemento, arena, varilla y pagar el albañil.
texts.en:
31-year-old Roberto is married and has one child.  His wife takes care of the household chores such as washing, ironing, cooking, looking after the children, etc. while he works as a taxi driver in town.  Roberto's job is to go from street to street looking for passengers.  He then transports them to wherever they want to go.  He has been working in this job for just under a year and he owns the car in which he works.

Roberto and his wife have been living in their home for seven years.  They received their house from the government and when they got it, it was very small and basic.  Roberto has been improving the house as, in this way, he knows that if some day he were to be parted from his family, they would have a safe home in which to live.  He would now like to build a room on the lower floor of his house in order to extend his living room / dining room and thereby have more space.  In order to do this, he would like to buy materials such as cement, sand and metal rods, and pay a builder.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand, and to pay labor costs

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. Josefina has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. Josefina has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: José Leonardo

texts.es:
El señor José tiene 40 años de edad, es casado con tres hijos.

Él  tiene 12 años de experiencia en su taller de reparación de bicicletas, él aprendió el oficio de tanto reparar su bicicleta y hoy en día atiende su negocio junto a sus hijos.

Don José aborda un vehiculo (pick up) en su comunidad y viaja durante cuarenta y cinco minutos hasta llegar a la ciudad donde compra los repuestos.

Don José esta solicitando un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar repuestos como: llantas, tubos, simples, centros, válvulas, entre otros. En mayor cantidad y lograr precios más bajos, para obtener un margen de ganancia mayor. Él tiene una gran demanda y con la inversión tendrá disponible los repuestos que más buscan sus clientes y que estos se sientan satisfechos con el servicio brindado por José. A la vez que se estaría ahorrando tiempo y dinero, ya que el viaje es bastante largo hasta llegar donde compra los repuestos.

José espera ampliar su negocio, para asegurar que sus hijos sean profesionales cuando sean grandes.
texts.en:
José is 40 years old, married and has three children.  He has 12 years’ experience with his bicycle repair shop.  He learned this occupation from repairing his own bicycle so much and today he tends to his business alongside his children.

José boards his vehicle (pick-up truck) and drives forty minutes from his community to the city where he buys spare parts.  José is asking Fundación Campo for a loan to buy spare parts like: tires, inner tubes, axels, cores and valves, among others in larger amounts so that he can qualify for lower prices and earn higher profits.  

He has high demand and the investment will make it possible for him to have the spare parts his customers most want on hand and they will feel satisfied with the service José’s provides.  He would also save time and money because the trip to buy the parts is quite long.  José hopes to expand the business to insure that his children become professionals when they grow up.

loans.use: to buy bicycle spare parts.

loans.name: Exito En Cristo 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Eugenia is the coordinator of her group, Exito Con Cristo 3 & 4. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her parents. She is a young hardworking woman. She says that her most difficult challenge is to study and become a professional.

Eugenia is excited to be taking her fifth loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for almost two years, starting with her first Esperanza loan. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying jeans, shirts, shoes, etc. 

She enjoys doing business and reinvests most of her profits because she wants to have a big store in the future.She joined this Esperanza association because she needed to start a business to get enough income to pay her school expenses. 

Eugenia’s group is located in San Pedro D. Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and sugar cane industries. The main economic activities are the free trading zone, a cement factory, and others. 

Eugenia is very excited to receive this loan and start selling.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Letuaina

texts.en:
Letuaina is a 56-year-old woman living in the town of Iva. She is married and has seven adult children. To make a living, Letuaina owns and operates a fishing business. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business is the harvesting of ocean-caught fish, which are sold in the local community. Letuaina has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 800 WST per month from these activities.

In 2010, Letuaina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation her and ability to engage in business activities.  Letuaina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1000 WST from SPBD, which she used to purchase a canoe. She is now requesting her second loan of 1500 WST to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets.  Letuaina plans to use the additional revenue generate  to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is 41 and is married with five children. Two of her children attend school and three are still too young for school. Pauline owns a house that has electricity but no running water and her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For the past nine years, she has operated a hardware shop, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Her major business challenge is the high cost of transportation. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Pauline is requesting a 70,000 KES loan to purchase logs and timber for her hardware shop. In the future, she dreams of expanding her business to meet her customer needs.

loans.use: to purchase wood and timber

loans.name: Bette

texts.en:
Bette,  27 years old, is married to Jared.  They are blessed with one child who is three years old. Bette sells clothes and has been doing this for two years. The business earns her a monthly income of Kes.6,000.

This is her first loan term with KADET.  She will use the funds to buy more clothes for sale. Bette hopes to open a boutique in future.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Jeniffer is 37 years old, married to Joseph and blessed with four children.  She operates a charcoal retail business in Kapsabet town, which has been in operation for a period of ten years, earning a monthly income of KES 15,000.

She is requesting her first loan loan of KES 30,000 from KADET Ltd.   She will use this amount to purchase more bags of charcoal for resale.  The profits will be used to pay the school fees for her children and also improve the stock of her business. 

Her dream is to prosper in business and educate her children to greater levels.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Maria Leticia

texts.es:
María, tiene 24 años de edad, vive con su esposo y una hija que tiene 3 años de edad, ella administra una granja de cerdos de engorde, tiene tres años de estar en ella, trabaja a tiempo completo al mismo tiempo que las atenciones para su hogar.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de 4 cerdos, para añadirlos a la granja, esta inversión le ayudara para incrementar el negocio y que sus ingresos sean mejores a futuro, ya que sus ventas según la disponibilidad de cerdos así es de favorable.
La aspiración de María es que esta granja la pueda mantener a largo tiempo, tambien que su familia cuente con su apoyo y mejorar cada día para ofrecerle una mejor condición.
texts.en:
María is 24 years old. She lives with her husband and daughter, who is 3 years old. She manages a pig farm. She has been doing this for three years. She works full time in addition to running her household.

She is asking for a loan to buy 4 pigs, to add them to the farm. This investment will help her grow her business and improve her income in the future, since her sales depend on the availability of pigs, so it's beneficial.

Maia aspires to having this farm support her long term, also for her family to have her support and to improve every day to be able to offer them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy four pigs for the farm.

loans.name: Benkadi V Group

texts.fr:
Les  04 membres du groupe  BENKADI V  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FIGURACORO, un des villages de KANGABA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est   l’arachide et riz  avec   KADIATOU, 1ère personne assise de la  droite vers la   gauche de la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau de KANGARE, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 60.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aider  aussi son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Frais de labour, achat d’intrants et  de semence

loans.name: Essenam

texts.fr: Essenam est une femme mariée qui vit à Adidogomé et qui a deux enfants à charge. Agée de 31 ans, Essenam est une revendeuse des mèches, des articles de mercerie et des pagnes qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend dans sa boutique à domicile. Essenam désire ce prêt pour acheter des douzaines de mèches et des rouleaux de doublures en vue d’en tirer un maximum de profit et d’amélioré les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Acheter 06 douzaines de mèches et 10 rouleaux de doublures.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Alice wants to invest in shares on the stock market.

loans.name: Zarmina

texts.en: Zarmina, daughter of Juma K., was born in 1989 and now lives in District 2 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is married to Mohammad Gul and has 9 family members. She buys fruits and vegetables from the market and sells them. She has finished 4 cycles and is now trying to take a 5th loan cycle. During the Taliban Government she had less opportunity to work but now she is able to assist her family in solving their financial problems. She is very happy with her loans and wants to go ahead with them to secure a better future.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Ndumi

texts.en:
Ndumi M. is a 43-year-old lady, and married with three children. She lives in Kitengela township near Athi - River one of the peri-urban towns of Nairobi. Ndumi also takes care of her younger sister aged 30 years who is HIV positive and is on anti-retroviral treatment. Ndumi also takes care of another sister who is asthmatic, and therefore cannot work effectively. Ndumi is also responsible for the upkeep of her sisters’ children. True to her Christian calling, Ndumi devotes some of her free time visiting people who are HIV positive and the disadvantaged people in Kitengela Township. During such visits, she takes to them foodstuff and clothes. 

Ndumi started her tailoring business in the year 1997. This was after she finished her tailoring course, which was conducted by the Singer company. Before that, she used to sell vegetables while at the same time making mandazi (a doughnut-like bun). Her mandazi’s were well sought after because they were delicious and she cooked them in a clean environment. Through the sale of mandazi and vegetables she managed to raise Ksh 32,000 (USD 490). 

With this money Ndumi bought a sewing machine and various types of tailoring materials. She then rented a stall in Kitengela where she is operating today. Due to the growing number of school-going children as a result of the government’s offer of free P]primary education, Ndumi is always busy trying to keep up with the high demand of school uniforms.            

Ndumi is therefore kindly requesting for a loan of USD 775. Given this loan in kind in the form of cloth materials for her tailoring stall, Ndumi will be able to add on to her stock of school uniforms, sweaters, ties, socks, and badges of different primary schools that have given her a two year contract to supply school uniforms. Ndumi intends to repay the loan within 8-12 months.

loans.use: Purchase of sewing fabric

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en: Sergei earns a living by driving a taxi around the city of Ivano-Frankovsk in western Ukraine. He has been in business for about seven years and makes about 150-170 Ukrainian Hrivna, or around $30-35 per day. Sergei rents his car and works with a taxi dispatching company that radios taxi requests to affiliated drivers. He tries to rent a newer car every year which helps him provide a better experience for his customers. Sergei is married and has one daughter who is fourteen. His earnings provide the main income for his family. Sergei has requested a short term loan to help cover the expense of some routine maintenance on his car. Sergei’s good reputation among fellow taxi drivers and his dedication to his business give us confidence that he will be able to successfully repay this loan.

loans.use: Taxi repair

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria is 33 years old. She is married and has three children - all young boys. She is part of the Communal Bank Alto Mayo. She sells fresh vegetables in the Grau market, in the district of Rioja in San Martin. She has had this business for 6 years. To be able to offer the fresh vegetables she goes every dawn to a place in Cajamarca to purchase them, she also counts on a refrigerator to keep them fresh. Maria has always worried about the wellbeing of her family, and this motivated her to develop an activity that would give her income to support her home. She is characterized by her dedication, perseverence and optimism. With the recent loan received by Manuela Ramos for $160, she will buy more vegetables in cases, for example tomatoes, onions, potatoes, as well as lettuce, cilantro and other fresh vegetables by the kilo

La señora Maria tiene 33 años, casada, tiene 3 hijos varones (todos menores de edad), pertenece al Banco Comunal El Alto Mayo. Se dedica a la venta de verduras fresca en el Mercado Grau del Distrito de Rioja, en el Departamento de San Martín. Se dedica a este negocio hace seis años. Para poder ofertar las verduras frescas se traslada a comprar todas las madrugadas a la localidad de nuevo Cajamarca, además cuenta con una refrigeradora que le permite mantener frescas las verduras. Siempre se ha preocupado por el bienestar familiar y eso la impulsó a desarrollar una actividad que le permita tener ingresos para aportar en su hogar. Se caracteriza por ser dedicada, perseverante y optimista. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/ 500.00 (US$ 160.00 aprox.), comprará más verduras en cajas como por ejemplo tomates (01 caja diaria), cebollas, papas, betarraga, zanahoria en sacos de 50 Kg. (1 a 2 sacos diarios aproximadamente), además de lechuga, culantro, repollo y otras verduras frescas por kilos.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Buy vegetables wholesale

loans.name: Thi Than

texts.vi:
Ms Thân is 54 years old. Her main occupation is retails and poultry raising in her home. She wishes to obtain a loan to buy more poultry thus raising her family income.

Translated frm Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Cô Thân năm nay 54 tuổi, nghề nghiệp chính của gia đình cô là đi chợ buôn bán nhỏ lẻ và chăn nuôi gia cầm tại gia đình. Cô mong muốn đựợc có thêm nguồn vốn để có thể tăng thêm số lượng đàn gia cầm của gia đình mình, cũng như thu nhập của gia đình ở một mức cao hơn.

loans.use: having loans for buying foods for chickens

loans.name: Zainiddin

texts.en: Zainiddin B. lives in Mastchoh; he is married and has 4 children. He has been a client of MicroInvest since 2007. He is a serious and strongly motivated borrower. He is eligible for an increased loan amount because of the stability of his business and its increasing profits. He breeds and sells livestock and operates a dairy. He would like to purchase a pedigreed bull for breeding purposes and a cow for the dairy.  He plans to expand the assortment of products he sells: pasteurized milk, buttermilk, sour cream, cottage cheese, and so on. He is asking for a loan of $525 to buy this livestock, which will allow him to expand his product line and increase the family's income. He also intends to branch out into the business of selling beef.

loans.use: To buy a bull and a dairy cow

loans.name: New Kabale I (A) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year. Jesca (group leader) is a 48 year old widow with 14 children. She has a taxi business. With the extra profits, she intends to pay school fees for the children and start up a poultry business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To take her taxi to the garage for servicing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Farming/agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Khai

texts.en:
Mrs. Khai P. and her husband married in 1993. They have three children: two sons and one daughter. Two of their children study in primary school and the youngest one stays at home. The family lives about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Khai has been selling Tape (a Cambodian dessert made from sticky rice) and growing rice for eight years. She sells the dessert around her village. Her husband has been growing rice and fishing for ten years.

Mrs. Khai is requesting a loan for the first time in the amount of $800 to purchase one boat machine for her husband’s business and to pay the plowing fee for growing rice.

loans.use: For purchasing one boat machine and to pay a plowing fee

loans.name: Josefa Seneyda

texts.es:
The business of making and selling tortillas is a tough job that requires much dedication because one works in high temperatures which can, to a certain point, damage one’s health. Nevertheless, Josefa makes tortillas all day, every day in order to sell them from her home.

Josefa’s immediate need is to urgently acquire basic ingredients, like corn and firewood to make the tortillas. For this reason, she is asking for support from Ceprodel to obtain the necessary credit that will allow her to acquire these ingredients, so she can sell her tortillas without any problems.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio de la elaboración y venta de tortillas es una labor muy fuerte que requiere de mucha dedicación por el motivo de que se trabaja a altas temperaturas que hasta cierto punto daña la salud de algunas personas. No obstante, la señora Josefa se dedica a este negocio elaborando tortillas todos los días con el propósito de comercializarlas en su casa de habitación.

La necesidad que hoy en día atraviesa la señora Josefa es la urgencia de adquirir su materia prima para la elaboración de las tortillas como lo es el maíz y la leña. Por esta razón es que ella acuda a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario que le permita adquirir sus productos para así comercializarlos sin ningún problema.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for tortillas.

loans.name: Vun

texts.en:
Vun Y. (pictured with her daughter), 44, and her husband were married when she was 17 years old and have six children, three sons and three daughters. Two of her children are married, one of whom weaves silk at home, two of her daughters have full time employment in Phnom Penh, and the other two are in school. Her husband is a wooden house repairer and does fishing. The family lives on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Vun has been a weaver since 1980. It’s skill she learned from her sister. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village who  sells them in Phnom Penh. Besides weaving, she also sells fish in the village.
