Vun is requesting a loan of US$350 to purchase silk material for her daughter (pictured with her) to weave silk and to buy planks to repair the wall of her house.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her daughter’s weaving and buy planks to repair the wall of her house.

loans.name: Laura Dilia

texts.es:
In the municipality of Condega of the city of Esteli is where a farming business exists that provides the living for Mrs. Laura T.. She grows basic grains and handles livestock as a small producer. She is the mother of two school age children. She continually is looking for ways to be able to provide for their studies and the conditions necessary for their development.

Currently she is seeking the support of Ceprodel in obtaining a loan that will allow her to buy livestock, get the most benefit from it and then sell it in her community. She is confidently hoping that her loan is granted and she can continue to support her home in the municipality of Condega.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

El municipio de Condega en la ciudad de Estelí es un lugar donde existe el negocio agropecuario que es la labor a la que se dedica la señora Laura T.. Ella se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos y manejo de ganado desempeñándose como pequeño productor. Es madre de dos hijos en edades escolares los cuales busca la manera posible de mantener sus estudios brindándoles las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo.

Hoy en día ella ha buscado apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito que le permita la compra del ganado para desarrollarlo y sacarle el máximo provecho para luego venderlo en su comunidad. Muy confiadamente espera que su crédito le sea otorgado y de esta manera continuar con el sustento de su hogar de habitación en el municipio de Condega.

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Jorge Willan

texts.es:
Jorge has a family that is made up of his son of one year old, both reside in his parents' house. Jorge works as an electrician in a sugar refinery, as well as receiving daily income from rental of a motorcycle, both of which he has been doing for a number of years. There is competition in public transport but not in his permanent job as he has held it for so long. His current loan is to purchase a plot of land. Jorge has very good credit references in the financial system.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne, Kiva volunteer.

Jorge tiene una familia que está conformada por su hijo de un añito de edad, ambos residen en la casa de sus padres. Jorge presta servicios como electricista en un ingenio azucarero, por otra parte renta una moto por la cual recibe un ingreso diario, ambas actividades desde hace varios años atrás. En el transporte público tiene competencia pero no así en el lugar de trabajo fijo debido a su antiguedad. La presente solicitud es para la compra de un lote de terreno. Jorge tiene muy buenas referencias creditias en el sistema financiero.

loans.use: Purchase a plot of land.

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr:
Kodjo S., age 34, is married and the father of 3 school-attending children. He lives in Avetonou, a village located approximately 100 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. With this loan, he'd like to outfit his workshop and to buy work tools to improve the performance of his business. In doing so, he will have more customers and therefore he will increase his profits to improve the living conditions of his family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer.

Kodjo S. est âgé de 34 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants tous à l’école. Il réside à Avetonou, un village situé à environ 100 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il souhaite par ce crédit aménager son atelier et aussi acheter des outils de travail pour rendre plus performant son activité. Ceci lui fera avoir plus de clients et par conséquent tirer plus de profits pour l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To outfit his workshop and buy work tools

loans.name: Yenny Judith

texts.es:
Yenny es maestra de secundaria pero como en un principio no le alcanzaba con su sueldo, decidió vender cosméticos y zapatos por catalogo en la escuela entre los mismos maestros. Ahora ya es muy conocida entre los maestros y los mismos alumnos que también le compran, y sus ventas han ido incrementando cada día más.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para tener más mercancía para ofrecerles a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Yenny is a high school teacher. When she first started working her income was not sufficient to pay her expenses so she supplemented her income by selling cosmetics and shoes by catalog to her co-workers. Her business is now well known among the teachers and students and her sales have been increasing each day.

Yenny needs a $250 loan to purchase more merchandise to offer to her clients. She will repay this loan in three months.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Koessan

texts.fr: A. Koessan est un homme dynamique  âgé de 32 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. Il exploite un magasin de lavage à sec et boutique de prêt à porter dans un  quartier très commercial de Lomé la capitale Togolaise. Il veut contribuer à la prospérité de son affaire en gagnant la confiance de ses clients  et désire par ce troisième crédit renforcer son  fond de roulement . Avec cette chance de Kiva, il pourrait désormais faire face à une clientèle exigeante en tissus de marque, gagner plus d’argent et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Koessan A. is an energetic man, 32 years old, married, and the father of two. He runs a dry-cleaning store and a shop of ready-to-wear clothing in a highly commercial district in Lomé, the Togolese capital. He wants to add to the prosperity of his business by winning the trust of his customers and wishes to use this third loan to bolster his working capital. With this Kiva opportunity, he would then be able to address his customers who demand name-brand fabrics, to earn more money, and to improve his family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a washing machine

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Mr. Ly K. was born in 1973 and now lives in Krang Roung village in Takeo Province. He is an ice cream seller. His wife, Mrs. Ton Na, is a farmer and she owns a small plot of land where she cultivates rice to earn an income. Even though they have different careers, they do not make enough money to support their living conditions. Therefore Mr. Ly K. decided to ask for a loan to purchase more ingredients to make ice cream to sell in the local village. He hopes to increase his income and improve his living situation with this loan. He is the father of three children who are attending the local school. His wife is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make ice cream to sell in the local village.

loans.name: Alba Maria

texts.es:
La Señora Alba Maria V. tiene la edad de 46 años, su estado civil es soltera, tiene 2 hijos a su cargo su hijo mayor tiene la edad 20 años que labora como comerciante y su otra hija tiene la edad de 16 años que cursa recientemente el 2 año de secundaria, sus propósitos son de mantener su negocio activo por lo que la situación esta muy difícil en sus deseos esta le gustaría obtener una casa propia ya que necesita dejarle a sus hijas su propia casa ya que para ella es muy importante, además quiere que sus hijas logren tener éxito en los estudios para que no tengan dificultades para el día de mañana.


Su actividad económica es una pulpería donde vende productos como: golosinas, colas, granos básicos y otras cosas, el tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 6 años, ella inicia este negocio por la idea de una amiga quien le dijo que instalara una pulpería en su casa de habitación y empieza con los productos de pan y golosinas y mas tarde al notar que obtuvo afluencia de clientes decide incrementar mas en su negocio para obtener lo que actualmente tiene, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo que será utilizado para la compra de juguetes debido a la temporada festiva y también en la compra de ropa para niños y caramelos por lo que se acerca la celebración de la purisima y sus clientes buscan los lugares mas favorables.
texts.en:
Alba Maria V. is 46 years old, is single and has two children. Her son is 20 years old and works as a salesman, and her daughter is 16 years old and recently enrolled in the second year of secondary school. Her goal is to overcome difficulties and keep her business active. She hopes to be able to obtain her own house which she will be able to leave to her children, which is very important to her. Additionally she hopes that her children will have success in their studies so that they don't encounter difficulties in the future. Alba runs a small store where she sells products such as snacks, candy, soda, basic supplies and other things. She started the business 6 years ago when a friend suggested that she open a store in her home. She started selling bread and snacks, and later as she built her customer base she expanded her business. The loan is for working capital to be used to buy toys, children's clothes and candy to sell during the holiday season, when her customers look for the most favourable places to buy gifts.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sambou

texts.en:
Mrs. Sambou P. is 37 years old and she lives in Lvea Sor Kraum village in Kandal province. She sells bananas in the local market. She is a widow with three children, one of whom sells groceries for the owner of a grocery store;  the others are enrolled in the local school. 

Although Mrs. Sambou P. tries to work hard, she still earns less income than she needs to support her family, and her family members still live in an old house. In order to improve her living conditions, Mrs. Sambou P. has decided to ask for a loan. She will use the loan money, along with her savings, to buy steel and timber to build a new house for her family.

loans.use: To buy steel and timber to build a new house for her family

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: K. Koffi est un commerçant dynamique  âgé de 32 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. Il exploite une boutique des vernis de peinture dans un  quartier de Lomé la capitale Togolaise. Il veut contribuer à la prospérité de son affaire en gagnant la confiance de ses clients  et désire par ce troisième crédit renforcer son  fond de roulement .Mr Koffi ne sous-estime pas la valeur d’un service prompt et efficace, d’un produit de qualité, qui permet au consommateur d’en avoir pour son argent, et des relations aimables et honnêtes avec les clients. Avec cette chance de Kiva, il pourrait désormais faire face à une clientèle exigeante, gagner plus d’argent et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
Koffi K., age 32, is an energetic merchant, married, and the father of two. He has a shop for glazes and varnishes in his district in Lomé, the capital of Togo. He wants to improve the prosperity of his business by earning the trust of his customers. And so he would like to use this loan to bolster his working capital. He doesn’t underestimate the value of prompt and effective service and a quality product, which allow consumers to get their money’s worth and to have good and honest customer relations. With this Kiva opportunity, he would be able to address a demanding customer base, to earn more money, and to improve his family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply his store

loans.name: 29- Nam Ngạn Group

texts.vi:
Thanh hóa là một tỉnh nghèo nhất cả nước,cách Hà Nội 156 km về phía Nam.Phố Tân Nam II ,Phường nam Ngạn Thành Phố Thanh Hóa,là một phố có đông dân cư , họ sống chủ yếu dựa vào nghề sản xuất và buôn bán.Nhóm 29 phố Tân Sơn Thành Phố thanh Hóa gồm 5 thành viên .Họ đều vay ở mức 1.963.500 VND (112USD),chu kỳ II.
* Chị N. Thị H.,38 tuổi,chồng chị là anh N.  Văn Khánh ,Anh ở nhà phụ giúp vợ bán bún chả và chả tôm. Anh chị có 2 con. Con gái đầu của chị đang học C. đẳng kế toán ở trường đại học Hồng Đức. Con trai út của chị đang học lớp 7. Chu kỳ trước chị vay vốn để bán bún chả và chị đã dùng lợi nhuận thu được để mua tủ lạnh để đựng tôm làm hàng. Chu kỳ nay chị vay  vốn về để đầu tư thêm vào việc bán chả tôm.
*Chị P. Thị T.nh 30 tuổi chị vay vốn  đầu tư thêm vào cửa hàng điện thoại
* Chị C. thị Duyên 45 Tuổi, chị vay vốn bán hoa quả 
* Chị N. Thị Phượng chị vay vốn để làm bún
* Chị N. Thị Tuyết, chị vay vốn để bán thuốc thú y
texts.en:
Thanh Hoa, 156km south of Ha Noi, is one of the poorest province in the country. Tan Nam 2 Street in Nam Ngan Commune, Thanh Hoa Province is a street with high population density. The inhabitants make a living by trading and manufacturing business. Group "29 Tan Son Street, Thanh Hoa Province" has five members. They wish to borrow VND1,963,500 (USD112) for each member in this second loan cycle. * Mrs Nguyen Thi Huong, 38 years old. Her husband is Mr. Nguyen Van Khanh. The husband stays at home to help his wife to sell grilled chopped meat and vermicelli and grilled chopped shrimp. They have two children. The daughter is studying accounting at Hong Duc university. And the son is studying at Grade 7. In the previous loan cycle, she borrowed money to start selling grilled chopped meat/shrimp and vermicelli. She used the profits to buy a freezer to store shrimp. In this loan cycle, she borrows money to invest further in selling grilled chopped meat/shrimp and vermicelli. * Mrs. Pham Thi Thinh, 30 years old. She borrows money to invest further in the phone shop. * Mrs. C. Thi Duyen, 45 years old. She borrows money to buy and resell fruits * Mrs. Nguyen Thi Phuong. She borrows money to make vermicelli * Mrs. Nguyen Thi Tuyet. she borrow money to buy and resell veterinary medicine.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in selling grilled chopped meat/shrimp and vermicelli.

loans.name: Kimlang

texts.en: Mrs. Kimlang C. is a villager in the Srae Boeng Village in the Takeo Province. She is a rice soup seller who earns an insufficient income. Her husband, Mr. Em Sovan, is a laborer, and he is also a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. On his plantation, he faces a problem because he does not have enough money for his production. Thus, Mrs. Kimlang C. decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, and fuel in order to support the field to make the crops more productive. She is 42 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is a farmer who helps with the father’s plantation while the other is attending the local school. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, and fuel

loans.name: Mrs. Chan Khat Village Bank Group

texts.en:
TwenT.-fO. people living in Preak Ta Thok village in Kandal province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes.

Mrs. Chan K. is a 47-year-old village bank president. She is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Ur Thy, is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare (2.5 acre) field of land on which to cultivate rice. Aside from those careers, they use the rice to make wine to sell. In this business, they face an obstacle because they do not have enough money to buy rice to make wine in order to do well. Thus, Mrs. Chan K. decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice to make wine for her business. She has two children, one of whom stays at home to do housework and the other is attending the local school.

Mr. Soklorn M. did not come to get his loan but his wife did, so she is presented in the picture instead.

While most of the members in this group loan have monthly-payment loans, nine members have end-of-term loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more rice to make wine for her business

loans.name: Talaleu

texts.en: Talaleu S. is forty-two years old and married with five children.  She has five years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the public four days a week. She has no previous loans with SPBD, a Kiva field partner.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be about $43.  SPBD loans are Talaleu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy pesticides, herbicides, fertilizer, water storage containers, bushknives and spade.

loans.name: Sou

texts.en:
Sou Y. started her business a long time ago. She is a grocery seller. She is 56 years old and a widow who has five children, four of whom are married and employed at different jobs, whilst the other one is a student. She currently sells her items, such as cooking ingredients and sweets for kids, to the villagers and passers-by.

Y. requested a loan to purchase grocery inventory to sell. She is a person living in a rural area of Kompong Tom province.

loans.use: To purchase grocery inventory to sell

loans.name: Michelle Ann

texts.en:
Michelle Ann A. is already married, has one child at her young age of 21. Her family is happily and peacefully living in the village of Cambong in Lallo, Cagayan. The couple maintains a hog raising business in their simple village which served as their sole source of income in the village. Their hog raising also produces piglets which they usually sells after two months of giving birth to little some villagers who also wanted to raise hogs like them. For further sustenance of hog feeds and vaccines for piglets Michelle plans to borrow loan from the lenders amounting to PHP4,000. 

When she was young, Michelle also used to sell vegetables in their village to earn a daily income for her family. She isn't hesitant in selling like other mothers at young ages do, because according to her, she wants her family to live a progressive way of living in the future.  She is trying to work hard to achieve her dreams someday. She is happy having earned PHP500 daily gross income from her business as this already lessens their financial difficulties.

loans.use: To buy hog feeds and vaccines

loans.name: Trần Thị

texts.en:
T. Trần Thị (832011183) is a 65-year-old woman living in the town of Ý Yên. She is married and has 3 adult children. To making a living, T. owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising cattle for sale. T. has been engaged in this business for over 9 years and earns approximately 4,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2000, T. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to build shelter for her livestock. T. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in further expanding the business. This will be the 8th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business

loans.use: invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis tiene 41 años, está casado hace 17 años, es padre de 5 hijos con los que vive. La agricultura es una de las actividades heredadas por su padre, lo que siembra generalmente son frutos cítricos (naranjas, mandarinas) y son los meses de enero a marzo los más rentables, por ser época de verano en la ciudad de Lima, a donde envía sus productos. Actualmente está preparando nuevas chacras para renovar sus cítricos y asegurarse buenas cosechas posteriores. Pero no todo es bueno, ya que en ciertas temporadas tiene que enfrentarse a los mosquitos que afectan mucho a sus plantas y él trata de contrarrestar con funguicidas y pesticidas. A Luis le gusta labrar la tierra y cuidar de cada una de sus plantaciones, mas aún se siente muy feliz cuando sus frutas obtienen un buen precio. Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP, donde ha demostrado responsabilidad en cada uno de sus pagos y para este crédito reitera su responsabilidad en sus cuotas. Con el dinero solicitado mandará a limpiar de las malezas de chacras, eso le costará la suma de 500 a 700 soles, el resto de dinero lo invertirá en la compra de plantas para renovar sus cultivos de cítricos.
texts.en:
Luis is 41 years old, has been married for 17 years, and is the father of 5 children, with whom he lives. Agriculture is an activity inherited from his father. He generally plants citrus fruits (oranges, mandarins). The most profitable months are from January to March, because this is the summer season in the city of Lima, where he sends his products. But not everything is good, because in certain periods he has to confront the mosquitoes that greatly affect his plants, and he tries to counteract them with fungicides and pesticides. Luis likes to work the earth and take care of each one of his plantations, and he feels even more happy when the fruit fetch a very good price. This is his fifth loan with MFP, where he has demonstrated responsibility in each of his payments and with this loan reiterates his responsibility with his payments. With the money he is seeking he will remove the weeds from his farms, which will cost him the sum of between 500 and 700 soles, and he will invest the rest of the money in the purchase of plants to renew his citrus cultivations.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clean the weeds from farms

loans.name: Vũ Thị

texts.en:
K. Vũ Thị (443001441) is a 44-year-old woman living in the town of Kim Động. She is married and has two school-aged children.

K. owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over nine years and earns approximately 2,500,000 VND a month.

In 2000, K. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to pay for services to increase crop yield.

K. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding her business. The loan will be her 9th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Lilliam Del Carmen

texts.es: Lilliam del Carmen Martínez tiene 36 años. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es ofrecer los servicios de barbería. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella inicio este negocio con muy poco capital, lo que ha ayudado a su negocio es la buena administración. Lilliam es una mujer muy trabajadora disfruta de este negocio, pues la mayoría de sus clientes siempre acuden a su negocio. El destino del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo y así comprar herramientas para su barbería y además comprar una silla de barbería. Su deseo es acondicionar su negocio para brindarles un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lilliam del Carmen Martínez is 36 years old. She works as a barber to earn a living. She has worked at this business for more than seven years. She began her business with very few resources but good management has helped the business. She is a very hard-working woman and enjoys her work because most of her customers always return to the business. The loan will be used for working capital so she can buy tools for her barbershop as well as a barber’s chair. She wants to fix up her business so she can provide excellent service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Erali

texts.en:
Born in Istaravshan town in 1979, Erali now lives with his wife and their two children. They are also responsible for caring of his old parents. Erali is a farmer. Recognized by the people of the neighborhood as a serious man, Erali would like to expand his crop into a viable source of income. In order to do that, he needs a loan of 3000 Somoni to buy seeds and fertilizer so as to expand his crop. The income from it will then help him to cope with the needs of his large family and educate all his children. Erali is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to achieve his dreams with this loan.  
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing the seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou N. est une jeune femme de 35 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle fait un petit commerce de légumes et de poissons. Cette activité lui permet de participer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie, de santé et de scolarité de sa famille.

loans.use: Commerce de légumes et de poissons

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en: Marianita C. is a married woman, and has three children. She is a rice farmer. Harvest time is almost near but Marianita’s farm is still in need of additional farm inputs. She is a new member of CEVI. She is satisfied with its program. Now she applied for a loan of Php6, 000 in order for her to acquire the additional farm inputs that she needs.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Seydou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Seydou S. est âgé  de 35 ans, sans enfant, il vit avec sa femme dans un foyer monogame  dans la  quartier Hèrèmakono Nord de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Suite à la pauvreté de ses parents, il décida d’abandonner l’école pour entreprendre des activités génératrices de revenus auprès de son oncle qui lui appris  le commerce d’articles divers de boutique.  Avec une expérience de 6 ans, Monsieur Seydou S. maîtrise son activité et est très sollicité.
Pour obtenir un fonds de roulement considérable, il décida de collaborer  avec Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier prêt individuel.
Il compte acheter  avec ce prêt une importante quantité d’articles divers pour sa boutique.  
Il ’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) auprès des grossistes et effectue sa vente, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée de toute la population locale.
 Avec ce prêt, il espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 49 500 FCFA. Avec ce bénéfice il envisage agrandir sa boutique et payer les intérêts du prêt.

loans.use: Achat d’articles divers  de  boutique.

loans.name: Emargelyn

texts.en: Emargelyn A. is from the village of Barangay 17, Gundaya, Gingoog City. She is 38 years old, is married, and has five school-aged children. Emargelyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both vegetables from her garden and other products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Emargelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding her business. Emargelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. Emargelyn plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children, to supplement the family income, and to reinvest in the business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

location.town: Barangay 17, Gundaya, Gingoog City, Misamis Orient

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is 31 years old. He is married and has two sons. He has a retail shop and has been in business for three years. He is requesting a loan of Kes. 20,000 to buy milk, omo (soap powder), salt, Royco food items, cooking fat, and other items.

Martin says that, although he is a new Faulu client, he is determined to improve his business with this loan. In the future, he would like to be a supplier of shop items and have a supermarket. He dreams of becoming a prosperous businessman who is able to meet the needs of his customers and his family. He describes himself as very hardworking. He wants to improve his own life and the lives of the people around him.

loans.use: To buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Leah Wambui

texts.en:
Leah K. is married to Stanley and they have no children yet. They live within Nairobi city.

Leah has been selling rice for five years. Her business is in a semi-rural area with a large population. Her other source of income is dairy farming, and she intends to use her loan, along with her own savings, to buy a dairy cow thus diversifying her income base. With the extra profits from her business, she will add more stocks of rice. Leah was introduced to Kiva partner KADET through existing clients and she is requesting her third loan.

Leah's future hope is to own several dairy cows. She believes that she is focused on her goals.

About KADET
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Percita

texts.en: Percita S. is from the village of San Isidro, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old, is married, and has five school-aged children. Percita sells ready-to-wear clothes to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Percita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Percita is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Khy

texts.en: Mrs. Khy Y. is a villager in Smaong village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice to earn a living. She is a widow with two children who are all attending the local school. Although Mrs. Khy Y. tries to work hard she still earns less income so she decided to ask for a loan to buy 10-piglet and pig food to start breeding pig.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy 10-piglet and pig food to start breeding pig.

loans.name: Mae

texts.en:
Mae L. is from the village of Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 26 years old, is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Mae owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling different kinds of clothes in the local community. Mae is just starting this business.

In 2009, Mae joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. Mae is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional goods for sale. This loan will be the second loan she has taken out from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods for sale

loans.name: Chori

texts.ru: Хакимов Чори проживает в районе Джиликул. Возраст, 48 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Хакимов Чори имеет среднее Техническое образование по специальности "Бухгалтер". В области животноводства работает более 10 лет. Он откармливает и продает скот. Целью кредита является закуп крупно- рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Chori H. lives in the Jilikul district. He is 48 years old, married and has 3 children. Chori has a secondary technical education as an accountant. He has been working in the animal husbandry field for over 10 years. He raises and sells livestock. The goal of this loan is a purchase of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es un hombre de 54 años, está casado con el amor de su vida, Dionisia. Esta pareja tiene 6 hijos, pero sólo viven con los dos últimos; Edgar de 7 y Diego de 6 años.   

Gracias a sus labores agrícolas, en compañía de su esposa, consiguió terrenos productivos que le generan buenas cosechas de maíz, papa y arvejas desde hace 30 años. Estos productos los comercializa a los mayoristas del mercado de su ciudad, quienes después de todo este tiempo lo conocen, así como también conocen la calidad de sus siembras.
Lo que más le gusta a él, es cosechar y comercializar la mercadería porque recibe la recompensa de varios días de sacrificio. En un principio todas las ganancias eran para solventar la educación de sus hijos, sin embargo ahora las utilidades que consigue las invierte en cubrir las necesidades domésticas y en ahorrar para más adelante poder convertirse en negociante de tubérculos y arvejas, productos muy solicitados. Además como sembrará en mayor cantidad se proyecta obtener más ingresos que le permita brindar una adecuada calidad de vida a su familia.               

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y sabe que si desea seguir accediendo a más créditos debe ser puntual en cada pago. A su vez, le agrada trabajar en su banco comunal porque los integrantes son exigentes y siempre le recomiendan no mal gastar el dinero. Con el dinero que solicita tiene pensado comprar una bolsa se semilla de arveja, abono orgánico, fertilizantes y insecticidas.
texts.en:
Manuel is a 54 year-old man who is married to the love of his life, Dionisia. This couple has 6 children, but only the 2 youngest live with them: Edgar, who is 7, and Diego, who is 6 years old. Thanks to his agricultural work, accompanied by his wife, he was able to get some productive land where he has been getting good harvests of corn, potatoes and peas for 30 years. He sells these products to the wholesale traders in the market in his city, who after all this time know him and know the quality of his products. What he enjoys most is to harvest and market the merchandise, because he gets rewarded for all of his days of sacrifice. At first all of his earnings went to pay for the education of his children. However, now the profits he earns are used to cover domestic necessities and to save so that in the future he can convert his business to the production of root vegetables and peas, products that are in high demand. In addition, he will cultivate in greater quantity so that he can have a higher income, which will allow him to provide an adequate quality of life for his family. This is his 2nd loan with MFP, and he knows that if he wants to continue to access credit he must be on time with every payment. At the same time, he is pleased to work with his communal bank because the members are demanding and always recommend that the money be spent wisely. With the money that he requests he will buy a sack of pea seeds, organic fertilizers, chemical fertilizers, and insecticides.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticides and fertilizers

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en:
Cristy S., 22 years old, is a young operator of a boat in Talibon, Bohol. She provides transportation in the city, especially to people who wish to go to the island. She has one child who is seven years old.

Now it will be her third loan from CEVI. The loan of Php 10,000, which she hopes to receive, will go far in paying the repair bill for her boat.

loans.use: To repair her pumpboat

loans.name: Marta

texts.en:
Marta is a 61-year-old single mother who lives with her son and sister in Las Magnolias, La Uruca, located in the central valley of Costa Rica.

Marta has a business making and selling decorative bags made out of durable fabric. She plans to use this loan to invest in raw materials necessary for bag making. Her goal is to produce and sell as many bags as she can. Marta dedicates the hours from 2 to 9 p.m. to her productive activity.

This will be Marta’s sixth loan with Fundación Mujer. The loan consultant who has been working with Marta over the past months describes her as a hardworking entrepreneur with a fighting spirit who produces all her products in her house. Marta is applying for this loan to assist her in selling products at an upcoming fair.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for making bags

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
Elva tiene 30 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos en edad escolar. Reside en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, en la localidad de “Quimbiri”, donde tiene su casa propia.

Desde muy joven se dedicó a la actividad agrícola, específicamente al cultivo de la hoja de coca. Ella siempre trata de que su parcela tenga una buena producción, ya que posee una tierra excelente para la siembra de su producto; para ello cuenta con su esposo y los trabajadores que contrata para la siembra y cosecha. Por lo general su producto lo vende en los centros de acopio de su localidad a un precio que le permita cubrir las necesidades familiares. 
Para el futuro piensa seguir invirtiendo en la agricultura, comprando más terrenos con la finalidad de cultivar su producto tradicional y a la vez empezar con la producción de piña.

Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP y asegura cumplir fielmente el pago de todas sus cuotas; además se siente contento con su banco comunal, ya que le brinda apoyo ante cualquier circunstancia. Con el dinero solicitado hará el mantenimiento de sus tierras de cultivo, para que no existan contratiempos en el futuro.
texts.en:
Elva is 30 years old. She is married and has three school-aged children. She lives in Quimbiri, where she has her own home. She has been farming since she was very young, specifically coca leaves. She always tries to make her parcel produce a good harvest, now that she has good land for cultivating. Her husband and hired hands help with the planting and harvest. For the most part she sells her harvest in gathering places in her area, at prices that allow her to cover her family expenses. In the future she would like to buy more land in order to continue farming her traditional crop and also begin growing pineapple. This will be her first loan through MFP and she promises that she will make all of her payments on schedule. She is very happy with her communal bank, because it provides support for her under any circumstance. She will use the money from this loan to provide maintenance on her land to avoid future complications.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Farmland Maintenance

loans.name: Tuan

texts.en: Tuan D. N. is 29-years old and married with two young children. He has been a carpenter for the past five years. In this line of work, he earns approximately 4,000,000 Vietnamese Dong (VND) per month. Tuan has participated in SEDA's microfinancing program since 2008. In the last term, he borrowed 4,704,000 VND and has completely repaid this amount. In this loan cycle, Tuan would like to borrow 8,288,000 VND in order to purchase additional wood supplies in order to manufacture his furniture products.

loans.use: to purchase wood to manufacture his furniture products.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
Gerardo A. S., tiene la edad de 57 años, está casado, y vive con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos los cuales tienen 18, 15, 16 y 9 años de edad, que son su prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar algunas plantas de café para la siembra, además, del abono y el fertilizante. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Gerardo también trabaja desde hace muchos años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor. 
About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Gerardo A. S. is 57, married, and lives with his wife and four children: 18, 15, 16 and 9. The family is his priority. The loan that he is asking for is to help his farm, specifically in the cultivation of coffee. The idea is to buy some coffee plants to sow, as well as fertilizer and manure. He intends to give good care to the coffee so that he can have better quality and thus get the most profit possible during harvest time. This is the first time he is asking for a loan from FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the facilities offered him. Don Gerardo also has worked for many years in farming. He hopes to offer a better quality of life to his family and more economic stability, and to continue growing as a person and producer. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Help cultivating coffee

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To restock his business with coffee berries from suppliers

loans.name: Sreipov

texts.en: Mrs. Sreipov L. is 37 years old and lives in Boeng K’aek village in Kandal province.She earns a small income to support her family by selling fried bananas and potatoes. Mrs. Sreipov L. is requesting a loan to purchase a motorbike to transport her products for resale. She is a widow with two children; they are both students in the local school and support their mother with her business.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to transport her products for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to remodel porch and put wrought-iron bars on windows.

loans.name: Ainura's Group

texts.en: Ainura B. is the leader of this group. She is 32 and married. She has two daughters; both of them study at school. Ainura owns a shop where she sells convenience goods, and her husband works as a taxi-driver. Ainura and her husband also breed cattle to make more money. They have been in the business for twelve years. They sell animals after fattening them at a higher price. Ainura makes 10,000 soms per month. With money received from this loan, she wants to purchase five sheep for breeding (one sheep costs 3,000 soms). Archagul E., 42, is married. She has a daughter and two sons. The daughter studies at university and the sons are at school. Six years ago, with an initial investment of 2000 soms, Archagul began to sew Kyrgyz national cloth and dressmaking supplies. In this way, she makes 3,000 soms per month. Archagul applied for a loan because she needs money to pay for her husband’s medical services (he is a handicapped person). Saparbek A., 31, is married. A year ago, with an initial investment of 20,000 soms, he started to sell convenience goods in his village. In this way, he makes 10,000 soms per month. The profit made it possible for him to purchase a vehicle. And now Saparbek has applied for a loan because he needs money to purchase building materials to start repairing his house. In the future, he plans to find a permanent job with a high salary. Aida A. is the treasurer of the group. She is 46 and married. She has a daughter and two sons. The daughter is married and works as a nurse. The first son studies at university and the second is at school. Aida’s husband is an artist (he prepares monuments) and she helps him with that activity. With money received from the loan, Aida wants to purchase materials which are needed for making monuments. In the future, she plans to build a house in Bishkek. ====================================== Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). Mol Bulak is the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase five sheep for breeding

loans.name: Group Of Faith

texts.en:
Mark S., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Group of Faith. He is 31 years old, single and has one child who is 6 years old. He is a sophomore university student.  

For 13 years, he has been selling tablets (medication) on the street in the Redlight Market outside Monrovia, Liberia.

He plans to use his 6,000-Liberian-Dollar portion of this 30,000-Liberian-Dollars group loan to buy more tablets (medication). He describes himself as an easy-going person.

His goal is to grow his business and build a pharmacy.

loans.use: To buy more tablets (medication)

loans.name: Bok Xalaat Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité BOKK KHALAAT est créé le depuis 6 mois. Il est composé de 12 femmes issues du même quartier. Et appartenant au même Banc Villageois SANTHIABA COKI2.

Madame Fatou D. debout à droite de la photo de grand boubou blanc vêtue, emmitouflée avec une écharpe rouge est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 45 ans. Elle veuve et mère de 2 enfants en charge. Elle a aussi la charge d’un enfant qui lui est confié et celle de sa grand-mère. 

Elle fait un commerce de tissus. Elle s’approvisionne en Mauritanie pour revendre dans son quartier à COKI.

Avec son crédit elle va acheter des tissus wax et Khartoum pour revendre dans son quartier. 

Son objectif est d’assurer la santé, la nourriture et le payement de la scolarité de ses enfants et de sa grand-mère.
texts.en:
The BOKK KHALAAT solidarity group was created six months ago. It consists of 12 women from the same neighborhood and members of the Banc Villageois of SANTHIABA COKI2. The head of the group is Mrs. Fatou D., standing at the far right of the photo, wearing a large white caftan and wrapped in a red scarf. She is 45 years old, a widow and mother of two dependent children. She also supports another child entrusted to her, and her grandmother. She sells fabrics. She gets her stocks in Mauritania for resale around her neighborhood in Coki. She plans to use her loan to buy wax cloth and Khartoum fabrics. Her goal is to provide her children and her grandmother with food and healthcare, and pay for the children’s tuition.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wax and Khartoum fabrics

loans.name: Alia Saturnina

texts.es: Alia Saturnina tiene 44 años, tiene 1 hijo a su cargo. La señora se dedica al negocio de la compra y venta de ropa y a la elaboración de tortillas, las cuales comercializa de forma ambulante, pese a que también las personas que ya la conocen llegan a su casa a comprar sus productos, sus inicios se dan hace 6 años, esto fue producto de la falta de trabajo y necesitaba una fuente de ingresos para mantener a sus hijos, que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado mantener. Este crédito será para la compra de  compra de maíz  y ropa para mantener a sus clientes. Su sueño siempre ha sido, que con las utilidades obtenidas del negocio poder obtener su propia tienda de ropa.
texts.en:
Alia Saturnina, 44, has a son under her care. She is an itinerant clothing and tortilla merchant although some of her customers who know her come by her house to buy her products. She started 6 years ago due to the lack of employment opportunities and her need to have a source of income to support her children. With much effort she has managed to survive. This loan will be used to buy corn and clothes to keep her customers happy. Her dream has always been to use profits from the business to obtain her own clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn and clothing.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina es socia del Banco comunal “Chojchoni” desde hace cinco años, pertenece al distrito de Copani, provincia Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 64 años de edad, de estado civil casada, no tiene estudios (analfabeta).  Josefina tiene diez hijos, de los cuales dos dependen de ella y un nieto.
Josefina, de todo corazón, agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por haberle otorgado el crédito de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, el cual le permitió empezar con el negocio de la venta de llicllas, por que anteriormente solo vendía pescados por falta de capital, ahora vende frazadas y llicllas los días sábados y domingos en La Paz -Bolivia, eso le permite cubrir de alguna forma las necesidades básicas de sus dos hijos y de su nieto de siete años.
Ella solicitará un nuevo crédito de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, para comprar más llicllas.
Su visión es seguir adelante con su negocio de llicllas. Lo que más le gusta de su Banquito Comunal son los ahorros y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Josefina has been a member of the Community Bank "Chojchoni" for the past five years. She lives in the district of Copani in Yunguyo, Puno. She is 64 years old and she is married. She has never attended school and she is illiterate. Josefina has ten children, all of whom depend on her. She also has a grandson that depends on her. With all of her heart Josefina is grateful to the Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) movement for having granted her a past loan of 500 nuevos soles. With it she was able to start a business selling women's wraps. Previously she only sold fish for lack of capital. But now she sells blankets and wraps every Saturday and Sunday in the city of La Paz, Bolivia. She is able to, in part, cover her children's and grandson's basic needs. Her grand son is seven years old. She requests a new loan in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles to purchase more pashmina wraps. Her vision is to keep advancing in her business selling pashmina wraps. What she most enjoys about the community bank is saving and the meetings with the other members.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase women's wraps.

loans.name: Gregoria Eugenia

texts.es:
Gregoria de 64 años, es empleada domestica en una casa ya hace mucho tiempo para poder solventar sus gastos, vive en una zona urbana caracterizada porque la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales. 

Trabaja lavando, cocinando y planchando ropa en una casa donde es empleada domestica, trabaja la mayoría de días. Quiere en un futuro tener su negocio para poder descansar mas y asegurar su vejez. Con el préstamo quiere construir mejor su casa porque una parte del techo esta dañado y tiene miedo que le ingrese agua. 

En el futuro quiere seguir trabajando y poder cambiar el estilo de vida que tiene para que su vejez sea mejor.
texts.en:
Gregoria is 64 years old. She has worked as a domestic employee in a home for quite a while, in order to cover her expenses. She lives in an urban area where most of the inhabitants work as informal traders. She works washing, cooking and ironing clothes in a house where she is a domestic employee. She works on most days during the week. Sometime in the future, she would like to have a business of her own so she can take more time off and be secure in her old age. With the loan, she would like to improve her house, because part of the roof is damaged and she is afraid that water will come in. In the future, she would like to continue working and change her current lifestyle, so that her older years will be better.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Roofing, paint and cement

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a 50-year-old widow with three children aged 27, 22, and 6 years old. She has three dependents and lives in her own house. Her family goal is to have wealthy and educated children. Her address is Masindi, Uganda.

She has a retail shop and has been in the business for nine years. She started with only a little capital which has now grown but says she faces a challenge of high electricity and water bills.  She intends to use the loan to purchase sugar, soap, cooking oil, bread, rice for reselling in her shop.

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, soap, cooking oil, bread, rice for resale

loans.name: Jared

texts.en: Jared is 29 years old. He distributes bread to earn a living. He is a married man who has two children who are in school. He has been in the business for six years and has one employee. He hopes to open a supermarket in the future. He has requested for KES 50,000 to open a barber shop.

loans.use: To open a barber shop.

loans.name: Melanio

texts.en:
Melanio E., age 36, buys and sells bananas and coconuts in his local store. Melanio has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. He is unmarried and resides in the village of Igpit, Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. 
  
In 2008, Melanio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. He hoped to help improve his living situation and increase his ability to engage in business activities. Melanio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional coconuts and bananas to buy and sell. Melanio is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and employed as working capital. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Melanio from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches to the poor households of northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and employ as working capital

loans.name: Nop

texts.en: Nop K., 32, is married with two young children living at home in Takeo province. To earn living, she sells cakes and desserts, making US$3 per day. Her husband is a car driver at a private company. He makes US$5 every day. Nop K. would like to take out a loan of US$1000 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Ou's Group

texts.en:
This loan group consists of five people who live in Kaev Chamraeun Village in Takeo Province. Mrs. Ou K. was selected by the other members to be the group leader. Each member will use their portion of the loan for a different purpose, but all hope to improve their family's living conditions.

Mrs. Ou K. is a farmer who owns a 0.50-hectare (~1.2-acre) plot of land where she grows rice that she sells to support her family. She is also a weaver. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Mrs. Ou K. is asking for a loan to buy more silk to weave silk cloth.   

She was born in 1957. She is a widow with four children, one of whom is a weaver. Another one of her children sells groceries but earns only a small salary. Her other children are studying in the local school.

loans.use: To buy more silk to weave silk cloth

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Long S. is a 34-year-old farmer and mother. She was blessed with six kids, two are unmarried and the other four are married. Her husband, Bun Heang, works in the farming business. Long S. inherited the farmland from her grandmother, and she grows different kinds of crops on it. She and her husband always use their plowing machine to help them in the farming business. Presently, Long S. is applying for this loan to buy gasoline for putting in her plowing machine in order to continue plowing, and the rest of fund use for purchasing a few fertilizers for her crop growing well.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and fuel for putting in plowing machine.

loans.name: Lenet

texts.en: Lenet is a member of Achievers group in Faulu Kenya. She runs a grocery shop in the Kawangare open-air market in Nairobi West. She is married and has a 12-year-old child. Through Faulu Kenya, she has managed to transform her business into wholesale. She dreams of becoming a big supplier in the future. She has requested a 60,000 KES loan to buy mangoes for resale.

loans.use: to buy mangoes

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is married with grown children. He is a small business entrepreneur from Kahovka. Alexander sells women’s footwear in the local marketplace. He was forced to launch his own venture due to financial hardships in the family. Alexander has been in this trade for 14 years. Presently, his turnover capital amounts to 28,000 Grivnyas. His net profit is 7,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Alexander is requesting a loan of 20,000 Grivnyas to increase his working capital. He is hopeful that with hard work, determination, and financial assistance, his business will continue to be successful and provide himself and his family with a stable, long-term income.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Nazila

texts.ru:
Nazila G. rodilas v 1962 qodu. Ona zamujem i imeyet 4 detey. Nazila yavlyayetsya IDP personom ona pereselenec iz Djabrail regiona i seychas projivayet v Absheron regione. Yeyo deti umnie i ochen poslushniye oni ochen lubat pomoqat svoyey mame po rabote i doma. Nazila uje 10 let kak imeyet etoto maqazin dlya prodaji produktov. 
Nazila seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi uvelichit pomesheniye dlya razvitiya svoyeqo biznessa.
texts.en: Nazila G. was born in 1962.  She is married and has 4 children.  Nazila is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  She moved from the Djabrail region and now lives in the Absheron region.  Her children are smart and well behaved, and love to help their mother with work and at home.  Nazila has owned her store, where she sells products, for 10 years.  Currently, Nazila needs 2000 AZN in order to expand her store space and grow her business.

loans.use: Expansion of store space

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.en: Cesar is from the highland region of Totonicapan, Guatemala. He is 50 years old and married. He has three children and all are in school. Cesar is retired from the health services industry, but he has started a business with his wife raising and selling poultry. They have been in business for four years, and are requesting a loan to purchase working capital. In the future, Cesar hopes that his business will continue to grow and help support his family.

loans.use: Working capital for poultry business.

loans.name: Lindor Stanley

texts.es: Lindor Stanley P. S. de 46 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Soyapango, en el departamento de San Salvador, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposa, sus padres y dos hijos menores de edad. Lindor  posee su propia panadería, en la cual se encarga de elaborar el pan y posteriormente comercializarlo  tanto en su casa, lugar en el cual está ubicada la panadería, como a sus clientes, a los cuales debe ir a repartir el pan. Cuenta con el beneficio de poseer muchos clientes los que hacen pedido en grandes cantidades y que son fieles a su negocio. Lindor solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar harina por mayor para poder obtenerla más barata, así como también manteca, azúcar, miel, levadura y otros productos más los cuales son muy importantes para la realización del pan. A pesar que salir adelante con su negocio ha sido bastante difícil, él ha sabido mantenerse firme con el deseo de crecer como micro empresario  y así brindarle un mejor futuro a su familia.
texts.en: Lindor is 46 years old and lives in the municipality of Soyapango, department of San Salvador, along with his wife, his parents and two young children. Lindor has his own bakery where he is in charge of baking the bread and later selling it, as much out of his home, where his bakery is located, as to the customers to whom he makes deliveries. He benefits from having a lot of customers who make orders in large quantities and are loyal to his business. Lindor is requesting the loan so he can purchase flour at wholesale so he can get it cheaper, as well as purchase lard, sugar, honey, yeast and other products that are very important to making bread. Although making headway with the business has been rather difficult, he has held firm in the desire to grow as a small businessman and thus provide his family with a better future.

loans.use: Purchase flour at wholesale

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en: Gayane S. lives with two children in Shake village, Syunik region. She is a refugee, and raised her children all by herself. Although Gayane works as a waitress it is absolutely impossible to survive on that small salary. With high unemployment in the village, and her son just back from the army, Gayane would like to purchase potato seeds, saplings, fertilizer and fuel. Gayane’s son will work rolling his sleeves up to help his mother. The additional income will actually be the main income to cover the family’s costs, the young daughter’s education needs, and hopefully will serve as an investment for future expansion.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds, saplings, fertilizer and fuel.

loans.name: Letitia

texts.en: Letitia is 22 years old.   She has one child who is 6 months old.  She is married to a businessman.  Leatitia owns a store in which she sells sugar and rice.  She has done this for 4 years.   She finds this business very useful to her because it enables her to provide for her family and meet their needs.  With the profits from her business, she hopes to renovate her house.

loans.use: buy sugar and rice to sell

loans.name: Rowena's Group

texts.en:
Rowena N. is from the village of San Pedro. She is 24 years old. Rowena is the leader of a seven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Rowena N. Group.

Rowena is married and has two infant children. To make a living, Rowena prepares and sells barbecue pork and chicken. Rowena has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Rowena joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Rowena is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the first loan taken out by Rowena from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Shovkat

texts.en: Shovkat A. is married and has two children. She is dedicated to improving her quality of life and does not regret any efforts to achieve this. She has been working for five years raising young cattle. Shovkat built a small stable in her house in order to do this, and her earnings represent her long-term efforts to care for these animals. She is very enthusiastic about continuing to raise animals since this will permit her to improve her living conditions. Shovkat has asked for a loan of 1,000 AZN to purchase young cattle to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase young cattle.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace currently sells beans. She is 32 years old, married, with 3 children and all of them go to school. Grace borrowed a loan to stock more beans to sell. With the extra profits from her business, she hopes to pay her children's school fees in the future.

loans.use: to stock more beans to sell

loans.name: Remy

texts.en:
Remy is 44 years old and married. Her family is residing in the village of Villa Norte Maddela Quirino. Remy has three children who are already married.

Remy is engaged in a manicure and pedicure business where she earns PHP 1,500 per month. Aside from this, she also sells food snacks in their village where she generates at least PHP 3,000 a month. According to Remy, those businesses have been very beneficial to supporting her family's expenditures.

Though her businesses are running smoothly, Remy still aims to improve it. Thus, she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase nail polish and other materials needed in her manicure and pedicure business.

loans.use: to purchase nail polish and other materials needed in her manicure and pedicure business

loans.name: Diog Liggeey Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 07 juin 2011. Il est compsé de trente femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Khady qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 62 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de six enfants. Elle a aussi en charge deux autres enfants confiés par ses proches.

Elle s’active dans la vente de pâte d'arachide. 

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital pour acheter plus d'arachides afin d'augmenter sa production de pâte.

Les profits lui permettront de soutenir son mari pour l’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was established on June 7, 2011.  It is made up of thirty women who live in the same neighborhood.  Their main business if petty trading.  Madam Khady who is to the right of the photo, raising her hand, is the leader of the group.  She is 62 years old.  She is married and the mother of six children.  She also cares for two children of close relatives.  She stays busy selling peanut butter.  

This loan will allow her to strengthen her capital in order to purchase peanuts in order to increase her production of peanut butter.  The profits will allow her to support her husband in improving the quality of life (health, nutrition, clothing, etc...) of her family and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en: Cynthia sells gari and oranges in Abura. She has received a junior-high education. She is married and has two children. Her spouse is a security man. Cynthia has been selling gari and oranges for just two years. She responsibly supports her husband to take care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more fruit to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards the university education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Nguitte Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 19 mai 2007. Il est  constitué de treize femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Pauline qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main et le responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 49 ans. Elle est veuve et mère de trois enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge un autre enfant confié par un parent.

Elle s’active dans la vente de légume et de fruit. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, car étant pratiquer depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.
Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (scolarité etc.…)
texts.en:
This solidarity group was formed on May 19, 2007.  It is made up of 13 women, all living in the same neighborhood.  Their main business is small-scale sales.
Pauline, who is raising her hand at right in the photo, is the group leader.  She is 49 years old, and a widowed mother of three.  She also has one additional child entrusted to her care by a relative.
She works selling fruits and vegetables.  She has considerable experience in this field, having worked in it for several years.
This loan will enable her to increase her operating funds and to expand her business.   The profits will enable her to improve her family’s living conditions (cost of education, etc.).

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Bayarsanaa

texts.en: Bayarsanaa lives with his wife and two daughters, age 5 and 7, in a ger (a Mongolian yurt). They live in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His older daughter goes to a secondary school. He manages a shoe-making business with the help of his wife. They started their business in 2007 and gained much experience. At first they had only one sewing machine in their possession. Since then they have been able to stabilize and expand their business. Now they employ four more workers and are planning to employ more in the future. All their customers are happy with their service and like to buy shoes regularly. He says, "We want to renew and buy more equipment in order to expand our business operation. Then we can have an opportunity to employ more people." He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase materials to make shoes.

loans.use: To purchase materials.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Adjo est une femme âgée de 35ans.Elle est célibataire avec un enfant en charge.
Adjo travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2008.Elle revend des produits d’alimentation générale à la déventure de sa maison.Elle achète au marché d’Adawlato.Elle gère seule son activité.
Adjo a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des cartons de tomates en conserve,des sacs de riz,des cartons de sardines et bien d’autres produits rentrant dans l’alimentation.
texts.en:
Adjo is a single woman aged 35. She is single and raising one child. 

Adjo has been working as a small-scale food retailer since 2008. She sells groceries in front of her house. She buys her goods at the market of Adawlato. She manages her little business alone. 

Adjo requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy cartons of tomato paste, sacks of rice, cartons of sardines, and various other grocery products.

loans.use: to buy various foodstuffs for resale.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is married and has 4 children. She is 59 years old and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.

Carmen sells noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, etc. to earn a living and has had this business for 30 years. Each month, she earns PHP 1,500 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP14,900 to purchase more grocery goods to sell.

Carmen has been a member of PMPC for  6 years. In the future, Carmen hope to improve their house.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Moreen

texts.en:
Moreen is 26 years old and lives in the town of Kinubi in the Mbarara region of Uganda.  She is married and has 1 child. Her child is not currently in school.  Moreen has a business of selling clothes, which she has had for 3 years.         

To help expand her business, Moreen has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase clothes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Moreen hopes to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for herself.  In the future, Moreen hopes to expand her business. Moreen is a member of BRAC’s Small enterprise (SEP) program which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anara's Group

texts.en:
Anara is the leader of this group. She is 55 and married to an auto crane driver. Together with her husband, she has raised two daughters and two sons. The daughters are married and live separately with their families. The older son engages in trade in Kazakhstan, and the younger son works in Karabalta (a small town near Bishkek, the capital of Kyrgyzstan). 

Three years ago, with an initial investment of 500 soms, Anara started to breed poultry. She earns about 4000 soms per month selling the eggs and chickens. With the profits gained from this activity, she purchased five sheep for breeding, fattening, and further reselling.  With this loan, Anara wants to purchase chickens and turkeys for breeding. She will use some part of the loan to purchase feed for poultry. In the future, she wishes to purchase a piece of land to start building a new house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (staying environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and to view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team, Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and turkeys.

loans.name: Aidah

texts.en:
