*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

location.town: Brgy. Bonfal East, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Rentsenpurev

texts.en: Rentsenpurev H. is 28 years old and lives with his wife and infant son in the Hovd province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. His wife works in the local factory to supplement their family income. Rentsenpurev operates a used consumer goods trading business in his town. He started his business in April, 2010 after moving to his current town. In a short time, he has made much progress in growing his business. He hopes to grow his business further and purchase more products to sell for a profit. For the future, Rentsenpurev says, "My goal is to buy a house and fence for my family." He is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan to purchase more winter clothes for his second hand products trading business.

loans.use: To purchase more winter clothes

loans.name: Yves

texts.en:
Yves is 36 years old, married and has two children who are one and three years old. He makes a living by running a shop which he also owns called Camera and Photo Designs. He makes a living by charging customers for the use of cameras and printing equipment. He currently has two employees.

He plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to expand his business by buying more cameras.

loans.use: To expand his business by buying more cameras

loans.name: Ciudad Real Group

texts.es: Rufino Martínez tiene 45 años de edad y vive en el distrito de Santa Anita tiene un hijo de 18 años de edad el cual aun esta a su cuidado y le brinda los pagos para sus estudios, Rufino cada día se dedica al manejo de transporte público hace mas de 12 años y comenzó  a ráiz de que un familiar le propuso comprar una pequeña movilidad a un bajo precio ya que era un vehículo usado. Es así como comienza en este trabajo de chofer de su propio vehículo el cual le a dado muchas satisfacciones económicas y poder sustentar su hogar y darle estudios a su hijo que prontamente entrara  a la universidad, en el futuro le gustaría dejar este trabajo y poner una carnicería. Con el reciente préstamo lo invertirá en pintar su vehículo y pasar unas revisiones técnicas. Como el señor Rufino Martínez cada integrante de esta agrupación tiene una meta a futuro y un gran deseo por salir adelante y poder dar a sus hogares la mejor estabilidad económica posible.
texts.en:
Rufino Martínez is 45 years old and lives in Santa Anita district.  He has an 18 year-old son who is still in his care and he pays for his studies.  Rufino works as a public transport driver every day.  He has been in this work for more than 12 years.  He started his business when a family member suggested he buy a small vehicle which was available at a low price as it was a used vehicle.  This is how he started his work driving his own vehicle.  This business has been very rewarding financially and has enabled him to support his household and educate his son who will soon start university.  In the future, he would like to leave this business and set up a butcher's shop.

Rufino will use this loan to invest in having his vehicle painted and having some technical checks done on it.  Just like Rufino Martínez, each member of this group has a future goal and a great desire to get ahead and provide their households with the best financial stability possible.

loans.use: To have his vehicle painted and to have some technical checks done on it

loans.name: Just Try Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Just Try” group. They are small businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Musu Tailor, who is pictured in the back row on the left.  Musu is thirty-two-years old.  She was born in Solima, in southern Sierra Leone. Musu is currently residing in Makeni with her husband and three children. 

For fifteen years,  Musu has been selling palm oil, rice, cigarette, matches, mints, biscuits, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above mentioned items at wholesale to add to her inventory.

loans.use: To buy palm oil, rice, cigarette, matches, mints, biscuits, etc. at wholesale

loans.name: Damira's Group

texts.en:
Damira K. is the leader of this group. She is 35 years old, married, and has two sons and a daughter. Her sons are students and her daughter is of  pre-school age (under seven). 

Damira works as a teacher at a school.  Her husband earns money by breeding livestock animals. By reselling livestock after fattening them, he adds 1500 soms to their family budget. With the money received from this loan, Damira wants to increase their number of livestock. In the future, she will make efforts to build a house for her children.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Tsedendamba

texts.en:
Tsedendamba, 41, is married and lives with his wife and three children in Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on land that his parents owned for 40 years. His wife is unemployed and his son works at a local police station.

Tsedendamba has been operating his ironsmith business at his home consistently since 1991. Now he is popular in his area and people come to his shop to place orders. In addition to his ironsmith business, he operates a welding service too. His business is the main source of his family's income. Now he is building a house and will use one room as a workshop. Tsedendamba is a hardworking and kind person who says, "Operating the business at home is difficult and I want to have my own workshop." He is requesting a loan of 350,000 MNT to purchase more materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more materials.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mr. Heng B. is 41 years old, and his wife, Mrs. Kong Run, is 40 years old. They live in a village about twenty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have four children - one son and three daughters.   

Mr. Heng B. is a construction worker and farmer. He also raises chickens at home. His wife is a garment factory worker. He is asking for his first loan of $250 to purchase more chickens to raise.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens to raise.

loans.name: C4706 Tuzamuranetwese Group

texts.en:
Chantal is 36 years old and married with two children. She owns a business selling foodstuffs such as sugar, rice, and salt. Chantal is the leader of the group which is called "Tuzamuranetwese" in the local language. This group contains five members: three women and two men. Chantal is in the middle raising her hand.

Chantal and her group have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand their businesses through purchasing more products such as sugar, bananas, rice and salt. Through this expansion, Chantal will be able to earn more profit which will be used to pay school fees for her children and save for her future.

loans.use: to purchase more goods such as sugar, rice and bananas

loans.name: Junelyn

texts.en:
Junelyn is a mother to 2 young children ages 4 and 9 months. She is 22 years old and married. Junelyn is engaged in farming. She helps her husband, who is a farmer, maintain their rice farm. She helps in keeping the farm free of weeds and pests. Junelyn does her best to help provide for her family. She also takes good care of her children.

Junelyn's loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes for their harvest to increase.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: This is 24 year-old Mohamed Alieu S..  He is married, and has 1 7 year old child aged. In 2008, Mohamed Alieu S. established his essential drugs business. He began his business because he wants to generate income and support his child.  Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Mohamed requires a loan in order to buy more essential drugs stock for business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Mohamed plans to educate his child, establish savings and hire workers to run the shop. He is very serious and dedicated.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more essential drugs for his pharmacy

loans.name: Nigar

texts.en:
Nigar K., age 42, is engaged in vegetable farming, a traditional occupation for many people living in the southern part of Azerbaijan. She and her husband have two children. She chose to enter this kind of work because neither she nor her husband have been able to find steady employment, so they decided to make use of the fairly large amount of land surrounding their house. In this way, they manage to support the family. 

Nigar has garnered a good amount of experience growing and selling produce, and she wants to grow more vegebles so as to generate more income for her family. She is requesting a loan to buy mineral fertilizer and seeds so she can expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: El señor Carlos tiene un sistema de amplificación con el que ofrece servicios de D.J. en recepciones sociales. El crédito lo requiere para comprar un equipo de mayor poder amplificador, así podrá  aumentar su capital de trabajo y ofrecer mejor servicio a sus clientes. Vive en alquiler en una casa ubicada en la zona de Miraflores de la ciudad de La Paz;  es separado  y tiene cinco hijos. Es la primera vez que obtiene un crédito con IMPRO.
texts.en: Carlos provides DJ services with his amplification equipment at social events and receptions.  He needs a loan to buy a more powerful amplifier.  In this way he can increase his working capital and offer better service to his customers.  He lives in a rented home located in the Miraflores neighborhood of the city of La Paz.  He is separated and has 5 children.  This is the first time he has taken a loan from IMPRO.

loans.use: to buy a more powerful amplifier for his DJ business

loans.name: Kondoa Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is in her early 30s, single, and has two children, both of whom attend school. She has been a food vendor for 10 years. She works form 6.00 pm to 11.00 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Elizabeth's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase her food stock and for household expenses and has repaid all her loans successfully.  She is requesting a new loan to increase her food stock. Her dream is to one day buy some land.

Elizabeth will share this loan with her loan group, "Kondoa," which has 15 members who hold each other accountable in repaying the loan.

loans.use: To increase her food stock.

loans.name: Mayra Soledad

texts.es:
La Señorita. Mayra es socia del banco comunal Renacientes, vive por el sector del Vergel en la ciudad de Cuenca, a esta ciudad le hace hermosa su gente, su cultura, tradiciones, la belleza de su naturaleza y arquitectura, también es conocida como cuna de grandes deportistas, tiene una variada  gastronomía que cautiva a propios y extraños.
 
La Señorita. Mayra es soltera tiene 20 años de edad, vive en casa de sus padres a quienes les ayuda con  los gastos del hogar, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Nuestra socia labora como empleada domestica, trabaja de lunes a viernes solo medio día y el resto de su tiempo lo dedica a trabajar en el negocio familiar que es la fabricación artículos de hierro forjado.
 
Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de de materia prima como hierro, sueldas, pinturas, etc. para la fabricación de artículos en  hierro forjado.
 
Su meta es  tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Srta. Mayra is a member of the Communal Bank “Renacientes” (The Resurgents). She lives in the Vergel sector of the city of Cuenca. This city is beautiful because of its people, its culture, its tradition, its natural settings, and its architecture. It is also the birthplace of great athletes and has a variety of cuisines that captivates the palates of locals and foreigners.

Srta. Mayra is 20 years old and single. She lives at home with her parents and helps them with the household expenses. They live in a rental property since they do not own a home.

Mayra works as a housekeeper Monday through Friday, but only for half a day. She spends the rest of the time working at the family business which manufactures products made of forged iron.

Mayra is requesting her second loan from the Communal Bank. She will invest the funds in the purchase of raw materials such as iron, welding equipment, paints, and other items for making forged iron products. Her goal is to have a house of her own.

loans.use: to purchase iron, welding equipment, paints, and other items.

loans.name: Victoire Pétrina

texts.fr:
Victoire Petrina est une femme âgée de 46 ans. Elle est veuve avec un enfant.
Victorie Petrina a travaillé comme revendeuse depuis 2000. Elle vend des habits et chaussures de friperie au marché du Sanguera. Elle achète les produits au marché de Hédzranawoé.
Victorie Petrina a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter 2 balles d'habits de friperie et 6 douzaine de pairs de chaussures.
texts.en:
Victoire Petrina is a 46 years old woman. She is a widow with one child.
Victorie Petrina has been working as a retailer since 2000. She sells second-hand clothing and shoes at the market in Sanguera. She purchases products from the Hédzranawoé market.
Victorie Petrina requested her third loan from WAGES to purchase two bundles of second-hand clothing and six dozen pairs of shoes.

loans.use: to buy clothing bundles.

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
Binti is a married woman with 7 children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a vegetable stall business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of establishing a food stall in the future.

With the 10,000 KES, she wants to purchase bundles of mangoes, cassavas and green vegetables. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of mangoes, cassavas and green vegetables

loans.name: Mogina

texts.en:
Mogina is 51 years old and is a married woman with 6 children. Her eldest child is 25 years old, and the youngest is 9. 

She is a farmer. She and her husband own and till land in Veruela, Agusan Del Sur. Rice is the main crop that they grow and sell. She does her best to support her family and send her children to school.

She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and fuel for the tractor. Mogina is hopeful that this loan will help them achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and fuel for the tractor.

loans.name: Mabomba Mengi Group

texts.en:
Balozi, who is in his early forties, is married with three children, two of whom go to school. He has had a tailoring business since 1988. He works from 8am to 6pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit. 

This will be his fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy sewing materials and household expenses and has paid back all his loans successfully. He hopes for a loan to buy an overlocking machine. His dream is to own more sewing machines so that he can win big government tenders.

He will share this loan with his loan group, "Mabomba Mengi", which has a total of 18 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy an overlocking machine.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is 23 years old and married woman with one child. Her child is still too young for school. She has a business selling drugs in a clinic in Jigomoni Branch in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years.

Charity requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase more drugs to sell in her clinic

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 42 years old and the wife of a farmer. She owns a small variety store in their community where she sells soft drinks, milk, breads and rice. She is earning PHP 3,000 every month which is usually used for daily expenses.

She is requesting a loan amount of PHP 6,000 to buy butter, candies, salt, soy sauce and vinegar as additional goods for her store. She hopes this will help her business to progress in terms of earning a higher profit for the education of her three children.

loans.use: to buy butter, candies, salt, soy sauce and vinegar as additional goods for her store.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda spends most of her time in raising pigs. She had been married for almost eight years but not yet been blessed with a child. The couple are praying to have a child too. Through hog raising, Rosalinda was able to earn a profit of PHP 1,000 for each hog she was able to sell to the butchers who came to their village. She used it to pay monthly electric bills and for daily meals. The other part of the income was used as revolving capital for the maintenance of her hogs.

She is now asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy a new piglet to raise and to use for their maintainance in hog feed, medicines and vitamins. Through the help of this loan she will be able to strengthen her business and acquire more profit from it.

In the future, Rosalinda would like to achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to buy a new piglet to raise and to use for their maintainance in hog feed, medicines and vitamins.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima is married, has four children and owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped-in water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. For the last four years, she has earned a living by providing tailoring and dressmaking services to neighbors and passersby. Her biggest challenge is the seasonality of her business, but she dreams of establishing a dressmaking school in the future. She is applying for a loan for KSHS 10,000 to buy more of the cloth and materials she needs to make items to sell. She decided to join Yehu to a way to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed to provide tailoring services.

loans.name: Alegría Concepción

texts.es:
En  la ciudadela 30 de Septiembre del cantón Rocafuerte (Portoviejo) se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Plazoleta Eloy Alfaro. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar vive la señora Alegría, tiene 62 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad e independientes. El esposo se dedica a la agricultura. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 13 ciclos y le gusta por la ayuda que le brinda la institución.

Ella realiza el crédito para ayudar a su esposo el cual se dedica a la agricultura, tiene cultivos de ciclo corto como son el maíz, pimiento y tomates, él trabaja de seis a siete horas en el cuidado y riego de los cultivos mientras que ella se dedica al hogar y a la  cría de pollos y gallinas criollas,  a ella esto no le quita mayor tiempo y se entretiene con sus animalitos. Los cultivos cuando están de cosecha los llevan a entregar al mercado mayorista en Portoviejo.

Este crédito es para comprar abonos, fertilizantes así como también alimento para los pollos. 

Su sueño es tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Plazoleta Eloy Alfaro” meets every 15 days in the September 30th neighborhood of the canton of Rocafuerte (Portoviejo). This place is known for its delicious sweets that are prepared by the locals and known throughout the entire country.

Sra. Alegría lives in this place. She is 62 years old, married, and has four children who are grown and independent. Her husband is a farmer. Alegría has been with the Communal Bank for 13 loan cycles and enjoys the assistance she has received from the organization.

She is requesting a loan to help her husband with his farming activities. He grows short-cycle crops such as corn, peppers, and tomatoes. Her husband works six to seven hours caring for and irrigating his crops while she takes care of the household and raises native chickens. Her animals keep her entertained and do not require a great amount of time. When her husband’s crops are harvested, they will be taken to the wholesale market in Portoviejo.

This loan will be used to buy compost, fertilizers, and also feed for her chickens. Her dream is to have good health.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizers, and poultry feed.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is from the village of Rang-ay, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 48 years old.  Nora sells fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for 15 years and earns approximately PHP 700 a day from these activities.

Nora is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000, which will be used to purchase different kinds of fish such as milk fish and tilapia to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: buy fish to sell

loans.name: Makimbilio Group

texts.fr: Apendeki est conseillère dans le groupe de crédit MAKIMBILIO, cliente au 6eme cycle de crédit , âgée de 60 ans , mariée , mère de cinq enfants dont 2 vont a l’école et 3 sont déjà mariée. Elle vend la bière et les sucrées à son domicile au quartier mikeno, avenue du 20 mai. Avec le crédit de l’IMF HEKIMA, elle compte accroitre son chiffre d’affaires en achetant 30 caisses de bière primus ,4 caisse de biere Mutzing et 15 caisses de sucrées. Elle remercie l’IMF HEKIMA pour les crédits qu’elle reçoit sans garantie matérielle car grâce a ces crédits, elle a déjà acheté une parcelle et elle compte la construire.
texts.en: Apendeki is the advisor of the MAKIMBILIO community bank.  She is taking part in her sixth loan cycle.  Apendeki is 60 years old, married, and has five children.  Two of her children attend school and three are already married.  She sells beer and soda from her home in Mikeno neighborhood, Avenue du 20 mai.  Apendeki plans to use her loan from the MFI HEKIMA to increase her business by purchasing 30 crates of Primus beer, 4 crates of Mutzing beer and 15 crates of soda.  She thanks HEKIMA for the loans that she receives without the need for collateral because, thanks to these loans, she has already bought a plot of land on which she plans to build.

loans.use: to buy 34 crates of beer and 15 cases of soda

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
Este grupo surgió por contacto de una de las integrantes con la Fundación, ella motivó a sus amigas y vecinas para que a través del grupo puedan crecer y desarrollarse. Actualmente el comité se encuentra en el decimo tercer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación. Todas ellas trabajan de forma coordinada y ayudándose las unas con las otras.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Zulma, tiene 4 hijos y está casada con el Sr. Lucio quien trabaja como chofer. Ella tiene una despensita bien surtida a la cual siempre van sus vecinos. Gracias a su negocio es que ella logra ayudar a su marido con los gastos en la casa, ya que compartiendo las deudas se aligera un poco la carga.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carne, bebidas, panificados, embutidos y demás artículos de primera necesidad que demanden los clientes.
texts.en:
This group came about from one of the members contacting the foundation. She encouraged her friends and neighbors to get involved so that they could grow and develop as a group. Currently, the committee is in its thirteenth cycle of the foundation's program for women entrepreneurs. They all work in a coordinated way and help one another. 
One of the group members is Zulma, who has 4 children and is married to Lucio, who works as a driver. She has a small, well-stocked store that her neighbors always use. Thanks to this business, she has been able to help her husband with the household expenses, and sharing their obligations lightens the load a little. 
She is requesting a loan to buy meat, drinks, baked goods, sausages, and other stable goods that her clients want.

loans.use: To buy meat, drinks, baked goods, sausages and other items.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en: Jovelyn is 27 years old and lives in Lupagan,Clarin,Misamis Occidental. She is married with 2 children. Jovelyn has a motorcycle transport business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase a motorcycle. Jovelyn has been a member of PMPC for a year. In the future, Jovelyn hopes to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Baasanjav

texts.en: Baasanjav is 59 years old and lives with her husband in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in the Hovsgol province of Mongolia. Her five kids are all employed and independent. She started her business in 1990 by selling garments from cart. Now she rents a counter in a market. Now that her kids are all employed and independent, she wants to expand her business by renting another counter in the market. However, she does not have enough in stock to supply the whole counter. Therefore, she is requesting 800,000 MNT to buy supplies. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "It has been a wonderful journey to raise children. Now it's time to concentrate on my business."

loans.use: To buy supplies for her garment business.

loans.name: Gnetaga Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe GNETAGA sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 35  ans, et  en moyenne  3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles monogamiques à MAMASSONI, un des quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
AWA, en écharpe noire fait le commerce de savons, il ya environ  3. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  une dizaine de cartons de savons et ½ sac de savons traditionnels. Elle s’approvisionne chez les grossistes au grand marché de Sikasso ville. Elle les revend en détail au marché et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 17.750FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The four members of the GNETAGA group are married women with an average age of 35 and an average of three children. They live in monogamist families in Mamassoni, a suburb of Sikasso. 

They are on their 13th loan with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to meet the needs of their clients.

Awa, pictured in the black scarf, has had a soap business for 3 years. With her loan, she plans to buy about ten boxes of soap and 1/2 bag of traditional soap. She buys from wholesalers at a large market in Sikasso. She resells them at the market and to family - to a clientele of both men and women. 

She plans to make an average monthly profit of 17,750 FCFA which will partly pay for the loan and its interest and the other part for savings. She hopes to grow her business in order to better satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy soap.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 2 children. 

Richard has provided motorcycle transport or "habal-habal" services for 10 years. He has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy tools and pay for gasoline for the business. Richard is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and gasoline for his transport service.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 35 years old, married to Maurine, and they have three dependents. He has done brick-making as a business for the last three years, earning a monthly income of Kes 10,000.

He is requesting his first loan with KADET Ltd of Kes 20,000 which he plans to use in making bricks. With the anticipated profit from the business he will repay the loan. 

His hopes and dreams are to expand his business and include making ballast.

loans.use: To make more bricks.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman, 46 years old, is a  widow who is raising five sons and daughters by herself. To be able to support her family and improve their financial situation, Iman started buying and selling blankets at her house. 

Today Iman has applied for a loan in order to buy more products so she can increase her income and be able to support her children in their education.

loans.use: to buy more blankets and other products

loans.name: Mwiri School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Alex. He is the Head Teacher of Mwiri Primary School, a mixed school in the Peri-urban area of Kakira in Jinja district with 400 students. Mwiri Primary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining an Ultra water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase an Ultra water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Mwiri Primary School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Alex ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Dolphine

texts.en:
Dolphine is a proud and traditional smallholder farming woman.
She is based in the remote village of Wiyeta, Kitale. She has been practicing mixed farming for the past six years and has never looked back. For a living, Dolphine sells milk and food products from her farm into the local market. Although Dolphine has been making profits through farming, she has always wanted to do poultry farming. 

The main challenge she has encountered is a lack of funds to get her business off the ground. Dolphine is seeking a loan to buy quality breeds of poultry. Poultry farming is a very profitable business venture in Kitale and is a business that can be done on a part-time basis to earn extra income. Dolphine does not worry too much about competition because the market for poultry products is good - chicken is a popular meal for many people and this can be seen if you visit any fast food joint in her village. 

With this loan, Dolphine is confident that her income will increase and this will allow a permanent change in her life. She plans to buy different breeds of broilers and layers and will be selling eggs and meat to the local market and other major markets in Kenya. She also plans to start breeding, which will help increase the number of poultry on her farm. Dolphine will also benefit from using the poultry manure, which is an excellent source of nutrients for her farm. Through this loan, she will assure her large family a secure future and improved living conditions.

Her positive attitude and her desire to make progress demonstrate in this smallholder woman farmer an immense urge to improve herself and, of course, a favorable answer to her request. Be inspired loan to her today to keep her big smile during this festive season!

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Para pagar gastos médicos de su madre por un accidente de transito de tal manera se pueda restablecer a su vida normal

loans.name: Kossi Mathieu

texts.en:
A master arc welder and licensed electrician, Mr. Kossi Mathieu G., born in 1965 in Dalavé, is married and has four children. After studying in Ghana, where he reached the Senior Second School level, he returned to Togo and continued till the end of the secondary general studies cycle, finishing with the BEPC (conferred after four years of secondary education). Forced to abandon his studies due to lack of support, he then learned about ironwork, electricity, and arc welding. His own personal effort led him to open his workshop, which he manages rigorously. Based on the quality of his services, his work is increasingly sought after, but his means are too limited to respond promptly to his customers’ requests. He therefore asked for a loan of $850 which he managed well and repaid without incident, reinforcing his credibility and increasing his clientele. Today he faces a constantly increasing demand which he is unable to satisfy due to a lack of machines and other materials. The small size of his workshop is also a handicap for the growth of his business.

Thus, to enlarge his business and provide quality service to his clientele and attract more regular customers, Mr. Kossi Mathieu G. is asking for a loan of $2000 to buy a machine and to rent a more spacious location for his workshop. This will surely increase his business and also his income, improving the working conditions of his five (05) apprentices and the well-being of his family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Maître Soudeur à l’arc et Electricien confirmé, Monsieur G. Kossi Mathieu, né en 1965 à Dalavé, est marié et père de quatre enfants. Après ses études au Ghana de niveau Senior Second School, il est revenu au Togo où il a poursuivi ses études jusqu’à terminer le second cycle de l’enseignement général, sanctionné par le BEPC. Obligé d’abandonner ses études par manque de support, il s’est formé alors en ferronnerie, électricité et en soudure à l’arc. Par ses efforts personnels, il ouvrit son atelier qu’il gère avec rigueur. De par la qualité de ses prestations, il est de plus en sollicité mais ses moyens se trouvent très limités pour répondre promptement aux exigences de sa clientèle. Il sollicita alors un crédit de $850 qu’il avait su bien gérer et rembourser sans incident. Ce qui a renforcé sa crédibilité et augmenté sa clientèle. Il fait face aujourd’hui à une demande sans cesse croissante qu’il n’arrive pas à satisfaire par manque de machines et autres matériels de travail. L’étroitesse de l’atelier est un handicap aussi pour le développement de ses activités.

Ainsi, pour accroître ses activités et rendre un service de qualité à sa clientèle pour les fidéliser, Monsieur G. Kossi Mathieu sollicite un crédit de $2000 pour acheter une machine et louer un emplacement plus espacé pour son atelier. Ce qui augmentera à coup sûr ses affaires et de facto ses revenus pour améliorer les conditions de travail de ses cinq (05) apprentis et le mieux-être de sa famille.

loans.use: To purchase a machine and to rent a more spacious location for his workshop

loans.name: Wiwi

texts.en: W. is 26 years old and married with 1 child aged 7. She sells kerosene and sometimes sells rice, though in a small scale (13kg per day). Her husband, Kholidin, is a fisherman who goes to the sea once a week depending on the weather. She really hopes to have a $50 loan to buy more kerosene. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Selling kerosene and rice

loans.name: Martha Enriqueta

texts.en:
Martha is married, is 55 years old, and has two children who are studying. Her husband is a seasonal worker in the United States. In order to bring in some extra money to help take care of and educate her children, Martha decided to begin her own business selling cosmetics and shoes two years ago. Things have gone well for her and she wants to increase the types of products she offers to include the sale embroidered table cloths and flower and fruit arrangements, which she makes herself.

Martha’s dream is to establish her business in a well-appointed shop. She wants to make her business grow. In order to buy more merchandise and the materials she needs to make her products, she is requesting a loan of $650.00, which she will pay back over a period of 6 to 12 months. The well being of this family is in your hands. Have no more doubts, decide to help Martha.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Martha es casada, tiene 55 años de edad y dos hijos que están estudiando. Su esposo trabaja en Estados Unidos de manera temporal, para obtener un ingreso extra para el sustento y educación de sus hijos Martha decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de cosméticos y zapatos desde hace dos años, le ha ido bien y quiere incrementar los productos que ofrece incorporando la venta de manteles bordados y arreglos florales y frutales, que ella misma elabora.

La ilusión de Martha es establecer su negocio en un local bien acondicionado. Ahora quiere hacer crecer su negocio, para comprar más mercancía y los materiales que necesita para elaborar sus productos solicita un préstamo por $ 650 dólares, mismos que regresará en un plazo de 6 a 12 meses. En tus manos esta el bienestar de esta familia, no lo dudes más y decídete a apoyar a Martha.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena B. B., 43, weaves traditional Mayan women's clothing, including shawls, huipiles, and head dressings which are quite unique in this region. The huipiles are special women's tops that can take up two months to make, depending on the details and the design. Her customers are the women of the town who are in need of a new huipil and will pay up to US$275 for her weavings. She has taught all her daughters this traditional Mayan art that has been created in the same way for 400 years.

Magdalena lost her husband four months ago after a four-year battle with tuberculosis. She now is the sole support of her 6 children and she somehow manages to send all her children to school, except for the youngest who will attend next year. Magdalena struggles with some stomach problems; the kids are generally healthy, but have not come to terms with the loss of their dad. In order to purify their drinking water they boil it. They do not have electricity and she cooks by wood. She speaks Ixil, the Mayan language spoken in Nebaj. Unlike many people, she does own enough land to grow corn to feed her family.

With this loan she will buy more yarn to weave and some stock for the small store she is developing. Her ultimate goal is to weave enough so she can purchase enough product to fully stock her little store.

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows.

loans.use: Purchase yarn for weaving

loans.name: Ruth Nelly

texts.es:
Ruth is part of the communal bank Mujeres Trabajadoras (working women), of Alfonso Ugarte in the district of Calleria, department of Ucayali. She is 42 years old and the mother of 2 children. Her husband, for health reasons, does not have secure work, so Ruth looked for a business opportunity that allowed income. With her first loan by Manuela Ramos, she decided to sell chickens.

She counts on the help of her husband. Managing the business together, they get up at 3am, and finish selling at 10am, tired but content. With the loan from Manuela Ramos of $966, she will buy more chickens, and with the balance she will build a shed to raise the 500 chickens.

Despite the difficulties with her husband's health, Ruth feels very content to work together with him, as well to have their own income to cover the needs of the house.

La señora Ruth pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Trabajadoras, del Jr. Alfonso Ugarte, Distrito de Calleria, del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 42 años y es madre de 2 hijos. Su esposo, por motivos de salud, no tiene trabajo seguro, por ello Ruth busca oportunidad de un negocio que le permita tener ingresos, es así que la invitan a Manuela Ramos y con su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 decide vender pollos. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, atienden este negocio juntos, se levantan a las 3 am. y terminan a vender a las 10 am., cansados pero ala vez contentos. Con el préstamo recientemente otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/. 3,000 (US$ 966.00 aprox.). comprará más pollos (1 ciento de pollos), con la diferencia armará un galpón para criar 500 pollos en su casa. Ruth a pesar de las dificultadas con la salud de su esposo, se siente muy contenta de trabajar junto con él, además de tener ingresos propios para cubrir las necesidades de la casa.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Buy chickens wholesale, and install a shed to raise the chickens.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Mrs. O. E. Charity is 25 years old and is married with one child.  She lives in Benin City, Nigeria where she sells fish to people living in her community.  She has been in this business since 1999 and is currently a LAPO member.  She is requesting a loan of $325 to enable her to buy more fish to sell.  She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Ambica

texts.en:
Mrs. Ambica B. and her husband Suresh B. are both tailors in the village of Bhakapati, Lalitpur (Nepal). Tailoring is their traditional work. They learned tailoring from their parents. They make custom-fitted ladies' dresses like the Kurta Sulwar which is very popular with Nepali women.

Mrs. B. is currently asking for her second loan to buy materials such as cloth for her tailoring business. Mr. and Mrs. B. are satisfied with their income. They send their children to boarding school. They have two sons and both are studying in primary school.

loans.use: To buy materials for her work as a tailor

loans.name: Dim

texts.en: Mrs. Dim N., 43, works on her rice paddy growing crops and different kinds of vegetables, making on average around $6 each day in revenue. Her husband is a fisherman. One of her children works at a garment factory, another one is a student, and the rest are too young to attend school. Mrs. Dim N. will use this loan to purchase a hand-tractor to help plow the farm soil.

loans.use: To purchase a hand-tractor to help plow the farm soil.

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es:
Rosa C. P. since she was a very young lady she has been working as a house cleaner in her own neighbourhood, the region of El Sauce in Leon. She is mother to three school-aged children and she, together with her husband, work very hard to improve the financial situation they live in.

Her greatest desire is to remodel their home because it is currently in a state of disrepair and with the fast-approaching winter season, the heavy rains would prove to be catastrophic and in that they would lose all their material possessions. To prevent this situation she has managed to secure loans with Ceprodel that she has invested solely on the pruchase of building materials to start their home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rosa C. P. desde muy jovencita se ha dedicado al trabajo de empleada domestica en su local de habitación en el municipio de El Sauce en Leon. Es madre de tres hijos en edad escolar y junto con su esposo se esfuerzan grandemente por mejorar la situación económica en la que viven.

Su mayor anhelo es la inversión en la construcción de su vivienda debido a que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado y además al acercarse el invierno con las fuertes lluvias provocarían una catástrofe y pérdida de daños materiales. Para evitar esta situación ha logrado obtener créditos en Ceprodel habiéndolos invertido exclusivamente en la compra de parte de los materiales para iniciar la construcción de su vivienda.

loans.use: To purchase building materials and labour for her improvements to her home.

loans.name: Saumu's Mapatano Group

texts.en:
Saumu is a 30 year old single woman. She takes care of 2 children, ages 13 and 12. Saumu is a cosmetics seller, a business she started in 2007. Every day she works from 9 A.M to 10 P.M. at her business where she earns a monthly profit of about $380.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members who have businesses selling cloth and food.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Madame Ablavi A. was born April 27, 1976 in Lomé. She is married and the mother of two children. Since the age of 9, she has accompanied her mother to market to sell traditional style skirts. Starting in 1985, she took a liking to the craft and began to sell clothes on her own. Currently, she sells traditional style skirts and cooking utensils and sells them in the market Adidogomé as well as throughout the neighborhoods, on average a 12 kilometer stroll everyday. Her first loan is for 350,000 FCFA , which will allow her to purchase 15 more traditional style skirts of decent quality.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Madame A. Ablavi est née le 27 avril 1976 à Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants. Depuis l’âge de 9 ans elle accompagne sa mère au marché pour vendre les pagnes. C’est depuis cette année (1985) qu’elle a pris goût du commerce et a commencé par vendre pour son propre compte. Actuellement elle vend des pagnes et des ustensiles de cuisines dans le marché d’Adidogomé les jours de marchés et se promène les autres jours dans le quartier et parcours en moyenne 12 km par jour. Le premier crédit qu’elle sollicite d’une valeur de 350.000 FCFA lui permettra d’acheter 15 pièces de pagnes de qualité intermédiaire.

loans.use: To purchase 15 traditional style cloths.

loans.name: Afia

texts.en: Afia N. is sixty-one years old and a mother of five children.  Her husband died several years ago and through her business she has managed to support her five children through their schooling.  Afia is a trader who trades in clothes, women's slippers and dressing bags. She belongs to the community group called Quality Trust Group. Members guarantee loans for one another as social collateral.  Afia is convinced that her business can grow better with increased capital and therefore wants a loan of $425 to buy more stock, make a bigger income, and purchase a decent shelter for her business.

loans.use: To buy more pieces of garment clothes, slippers and dressing bags

loans.name: Marjona

texts.en:
Marjona H. is 22 years old. She is an energetic girl. Thanks to her energy and high spirit, she has been able to support her parents for 5 years. Marjona specializes in sewing modern national dresses. She wants to make herself more popular in the city and expand her business.

Today. Marjona is planning to expand her business and to purchase modern summer fabrics in order to meet the requirements of her customers. She is requesting 1200 Somoni ($350 USD) for 6 months. The loan will be spent on purchasing new modern fabrics for sewing modern-style national dresses. Marjona is counting on your help and would like to thank everyone for supporting her.

loans.use: To buy new, modern summer fabrics

loans.name: Renee

texts.es:
Renee is 41 years of age and is the mother of five children who are still in elementary school, one suffers from epilepsy. For Renee, her children are her daily motivation to work and to succeed in everything. She would like to make her business something bigger so that she can feel calm and secure. Currently, Señora Renee sells sweets and soft drinks, something that allows her to afford her household expenses and her children's studies. But, for the future, she would like for her business to grow more. Renee would like to continue with her sweets shop and to become a soft drink distributor, something that she sells now by the unit. It is for this reason that she needs a loan that will allow her to meet her goals. She trusts that you will be the tool for this and, for that, you will always be in her grateful heart.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Renee tiene 41 años de edad, es mamá de 5 hijos que aún están en el colegio, uno de ellos sufre de epilepsia, para Reene sus hijos son su motivación diaria para trabajar y prosperar en todo, ella desea convertir su negocio en algo más grande y así sentirse tranquila y segura. En la actualidad la señora Renee se dedica la venta de golosinas y bebidas gaseosas, lo cual le permite sustentar los gastos de su casa y los estudios de sus hijos, pero para el futuro ella quiere que su negocio crezca mucho más. Renee quiere implementar su tienda de golosinas e incluso ser distribuidora de bebidas gaseosas, que ahora vende por unidad. Por ello es que Renee requiere de un préstamo que le permitirá cumplir con sus objetivos. Confía en que ustedes serán la herramienta para ello y con lo que siempre estarán en su corazón agradecido.

loans.use: Continue her Business with Greater Merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase housewares to resell in her community.

loans.name: Sopey Saliou Touré Group

texts.fr: La communauté rurale de ndoulo est situé dans l'écovillage Keur Goumak (http://www.sem-fund.org/keurgumaggfr.php). Comme le village a souffert de longues années de sécheresse et désertifictation, les femmes se sont constituées en groupement pour s'activer dans les travaux de petit commerce. L'activité repose sur la capacité du Groupement à acheter des denrées de première nécessité (des sacs de mil, tablettes de Maggi, des sachets de lait en poudre, bidons d’huile, des cartons de savons, des sacs de sucre, des sacs de riz, des paquets de biscuits) au moment où les prix sont très bas sur le marché et de les stocker. Se faisant, elles vont satisfaire la demande en organisant la redistribution  « vente »  continue pendant toute l’année au niveau des marchés hebdomadaires, des communautés rurales voisines,  tout en  évitant les ruptures de stock de ces produits.
texts.en:
The rural community of Ndoulo is located in the Keur Goumak ecovillage (http://www.sem-fund.org/keurgumaggfr.php). Since the village has suffered from many years of drought and desertification, the women grouped themselves together to start small businesses. The group's business consists of buying essential food products (bags of millet, Maggi cubes, dried milk sachets, cans of oil, cartons of soap, bags of sugar and rice, and boxes of biscuits) when the market prices are very low, and storing them. Once this is done, they will be able to meet the demands by organizing a continued redistribution “sale” year round at weekly markets and neighbouring rural communities, while avoiding stock shortages of these products.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of consumer products

loans.name: Assomiddin

texts.ru: Назиров Ассомидин житель города Яван. Женат и имеет четверых детей. Единственным источником заработка в его семье является его дело. Он работает таксистом . Зарабатывает не плохо , но он  улучшить качество обслуживания путем ремонта своего автомобиля. Для этого он планирует получить кредит и сделать запланированное. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 3 месяцев.
texts.en:
Assomidden N. is a citizen of the city of Yavan. He is married and has 4 children. The only source of income for his family is from his business being a taxi driver. His income is not poor, but her will increase the quality of his service if he repairs his automobile. For this to occur he plans on receiving a loan to do the planned repairs. He plans to repay the loan within 3 months.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Renovation of Automobile

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana sells foodstuffs like gari, yams, and fresh peppers out of her house. She has been in this business for a long time. Christiana travels to Abuja (a journey of 8-9 hours) to buy foodstuffs in bulk to sell. She travels twice a month. Christiana is 45 years old and married with 4 children. Christiana is a LAPO client. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to buy more foodstuffs to sell. She is grateful to Kiva lenders and LAPO MICROFINANCE for their financial support.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Felizarda Virgínia

texts.pt:
Felizarda T. e natural de Maputo, tem 36 anos de idade, e casada maritalmente, e mãe de 04 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 16 a 06 anos, o mais velho tem 16 anos e frequenta a 7ª classe, o segundo tem 12 anos e frequenta a 5ª classe, o terceiro tem 08 anos e frequenta a 4ª classe e o ultimo com 06 anos frequenta a 2ª classe. Basicamente sustenta os seus filhos e o seu marido.

Felizarda estudou ate 6ª classe interrompeu os estudos por falta de condições para continuar, o seu trabalho e de venda de frangos o qual faz pessoalmente com ajuda dos seus filhos. Aprendeu a fazer o negocio a 07 anos atrás com a sua mãe que também e comerciante na mesma área, tem como rendimento 3000,00 e consegue poupar 1500,00 ate ao final do mês.

Felizarda pede empréstimo na HLUVUKU e no KIVAS pela primeira vez, conheceu a HLUVUKU através a partir da dona Elisa que já e nossa cliente.Com o empréstimo pretende aumentar a quantidade de frangos para dar resposta a demanda e consequentemente aumentar os seus rendimentos.

Felizarda tem como desafios expandir o seu negócio colocando o seu produto em mais pontos estratégicos, e futuramente realizar o sonho de ter uma mercearia.
texts.en:
Felizarda T. is from Maputo, 36 years old, married and the mother of 4 children between the ages of 6 and 16. The oldest is 16 years old and is in the 7th grade, the second oldest is 12 and is in 5th grade, the third is 8 and in 4th grade and the youngest is 6 and in 2nd grade. She supports her children and her husband.

Felizarda was in school until the 6th grade when she interrupted her studies as she didn’t have the means to continue. Her work is to sell chickens, which she does herself with the help of her children. She learnt her trade 7 years ago from her mother who was also a trader in the same area. She has a monthly income of 3000,00 MZN and manager to save 1500,00 MZN.

This is Felizarda’s first loan from HLUVUKU and Kiva and she learnt about HLUVUKU from Dona Elisa who is already our client. With this loan, she intends to increase the number of chickens so she can meet demand and consequently increase her revenue.

Felizarda’s challenges are to expand her business, placing her product in more strategic locations and in the future to achieve her dream of owning a grocery store.


Translated from Portuguese by Ines Teles, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing more chickens to be sold

loans.name: Dilshad Akhtar M.yaseen Group

texts.en:
Dilshad Akhtar is a 40-year-old married woman who lives in Vehari, Pakistan. She is not educated, but she believes that education is essential to every walk of life. Her husband, M., sells a Punjabi food called "dahi bhala." He has 22 years of experience in this business. 

Dilshad baji has two children, one son and one daughter. Her son supports his father in his food business. Her daughter is in 2nd standard (4th grade). She and her husband work hard for their children, because their daughter wants to be a doctor. 

Dilshad baji is a seamstress who sews clothes. She has 15 years of experience in this business. She successfully repaid the first loan that she took from Asasah, a microfinance institute in Pakistan. Now she is applying for a new loan to buy spices and vegetables to make more dahi bhala to sell. 

Dilshad baji is the leader of a five-member loan group in her locality. Najma baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for her sewing business. Haleema baji wants a loan to buy tools for her motor workshop. Sonia baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics and creams for her parlor. Rashida baji wants a loan to buy tools to repair watches. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: "Baji," which means "older sister" is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy spices and vegetables for a food business

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 34 años, convive con su pareja más de 10 años, de los cuales tienen 3 hijos, ahora viven con un de ellos mientras que los otros 2 sus hijos estudian en otra ciudad, por el momento viven en la casa de su madre, no cuentan con una casa propia. Desde hace 10 años ha trabajado en la venta de golosinas, todo este tiempo esta actividad le ha sido rentable, lo que le ha permitido educar a sus hijos y cubrir los gastos de su hogar. Por el momento el negocio está a cargo de su hija mayor Nayeli, su esposo trabaja en el transporte de pasajeros con su motocarro y Carmen hace dos años se ha decidido salir al parque de la ciudad con la venta de chupetes de hielo y helados, vende desde las 10.00am hasta 6 a 7:00pm dependiendo si hace calor se queda hasta más tarde, adicionalmente ofrece bolsitas de popcorn. Desde muy niña se ha dedicado al comercio, sus padres eran negociantes ambulantes, desde entonces para ella el trabajo en la calle es lo más gratificante. Las ganancias que obtiene, aparte de sustentar su hogar son para pagar los estudios de su hijo en un instituto en otra ciudad, la habitación que alquila y su alimentación diaria. Por el momento Carmen esta muy acongojada por la enfermedad de su padre, ella trata de dar todas las medicinas que necesita para que se recupere, y su felicidad se completa. En el ciclo pasado era secretaria en su banco comunal, este es su segundo crédito con MFP y sigue con el mismo compromiso de pagar sus cuotas en las fechas fijadas. La suma que solicita es para la compra de golosinas, 500 soles le ha prestado a su esposo para que pueda comprar llantas nuevas para el motocarro, y finalmente con el resto del dinero comprará yogurt para la preparación de sus chupetes y los helados.
texts.en:
Carmen is 34 years old. She has lived with her partner for more than 10 years. They have 3 children, now they live with only one of them while the other two children study in another city. For the moment, they live in the house of her mother, they don’t have a house of their own. For the past 10 years she has worked selling sweets. All this time this activity has been profitable, and has permitted her to educate her children and cover the expenses of the household. At this time the business is for her eldest daughter Nayeli. Her husband works transporting passengers in his motorcar, and it has been two years since Carmen decided to go to the park in the city to sell popsicles and ice-cream. She sells from 10am until 6 or 7 at night, if it is hot she will remain later, and also offer bags of popcorn. Since she was very young she has worked as a businesswoman. Her parents sold in an open air market, and since then, for her the work in the streets has been the most gratifying. The income that she gets, apart from sustaining the household, has paid for the studies of her son in an institution in another city, the housing he rents, and his daily sustenance. At the moment Carmen is very aggrieved by the illness of her father. She tries to give him all the medicine he needs so he can recover, and her happiness would be complete. In the past Circle she was the secretary of her community bank. This is her second loan with MFP and she continues with the same amount to repay her instalments on fixed dates. The sum that she is asking for is to buy sweets, 500 soles that she will loan to her husband so he will be able to buy new wheels for his motorcar, and finally with the rest of the money she will buy yogurt to make her popsicles and ice-cream.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

loans.name: Salohiddin

texts.ru:
Умарову Салохиддину 39 лет. Он женат и имеет 2 детей. У него собственная мельница, где он производит муки. Он часто закупает пшеницу для производства муки. А потом перепродает. Этим он занимается 3 года. А также фермеры привозят свой урожай пшеницы. Он за услуги мельницы берет с фермеров определенную сумму денег.  
Салохиддин хочет участвовать в программу Кива и получить займ в сумме 2000 сомони сроком на 6 месяцев, для покупки муки.
texts.en:
Salohiddin U., 39, is married and has 2 children. Salohiddin owns a flour mill. He purchases some of the grain he grinds and local farmers bring the rest. Salohiddin has been in business for three years. He will use this loan to purchase grain for his mill.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase grain for flour production

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is a cereals seller in the Mwanjelwa neighborhood of Mbeya. She belongs to Ilolo group loan. Every day she works at her business for nine hours.

She is requesting her first loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Tanzania, so that she can buy more cereals for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Eliza is 40 years old, married, and has seven children.

loans.use: To buy more cereals for her business

loans.name: Junia

texts.en:
Junia P. is currently in the business of selling green vegetables, onions, and tomatoes, and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Junia is 32 years old and is married; her husband is a soldier. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. These programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Expand the business by building a shop

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Agée de  35 ans, madame A. abla est une femme qui a toujours eu une attention particulière sur les besoins de son foyer. Mère de trois enfants, son mari n’a pas une activité permanente si bien qu’elle assure la grande partie des charges du foyer. Elle est une simple couturière, ce qui ne lui permet pas de satisfaire ses enfants donc elle s’est lancée dans le commerce de pétrole lampant. N’ayant pas les moyens de financement, elle sollicite un crédit comme fonds de commerce
texts.en:
Ms. A. Abla, age 35, is a woman who has always paid particular attention to the needs of her family. She is a mother of three children, and her husband doesn't have continuous work, such that she ensure that the bulk of household expenses are covered. She is a simple seamstress, which doesn't allow her to support her children. So she got started in the commerce of lamp fuel. Lacking financial means, she's requesting a loan as working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell lamp fuel

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence sells frozen foods and ice cubes. She has been in this business for the past three years. Florence hopes for the loan of N100,000 to purchase more frozen foods to sell. Florence is 38 years old and married with five children. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Isomiddin

texts.ru: Хайдаров  Исомиддин - мужчина 43-х лет, женат,  имеет 5-х  детей. Чтобы  прокормить  свою  семью  он  решил  заняться  откормом  скота.  Он  имеет  большой  опыт  в  сфере  животноводства,  так  как    с  юных  лет  помогал  отцу  пасти  скот.  Исомиддину  помогают  его  сыновья.  Он  закупает  бычков  на  Спитаменском  скотном  рынке  и,  откормив  в  течении  5-6  месяцев,  перепродаёт  их  за  хорошую  цену.  Кроме  того  он  работает  колхозником  в  дехканском  хозяйстве.
texts.en:
Isomiddin H. is a 43 year old man, he is married and has five children. He decided to start feeding cattle to be able to feed his family. He has good experience in animal husbandry because he has been helping his father to shepherd the cattle when he was young. Isomiddin's sons help him. He buys calves on the Spitamen cattle market and after feeding them for five or six months he resells them at a profitable price. Besides that he works as a farmer in the collective farm.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort S. is 39 years old; she is married and a mother with five children. Currently all her children are in school. She lives at Suhum in the eastern region of Ghana. She is a petty trader who sells assorted products like cooking utensils and plastic bowls, lunch boxes, etc. She mostly sells through hawking, that is, house-to-house selling. She has been selling goods for eight year now.

Comfort has attracted lots of customers who purchase from her. She treks to Accra to purchase her stock of goods. Recently she has been facing challenges in her business as a result of inadequate funds to buy stock. She requests a loan to buy more of the products like cooking utensils and others which are frequently demanded by her numerous customers. With the loan she believes she will be more resourced to make lots of profits to build a store to reduce the frequent walking through the streets to sell. She would be grateful for your assistance. Comfort belongs to a village bank called ‘Onoa Do’.

loans.use: to increase her stock of inventory

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe F. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 25 years old. Ma. Fe is single and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Ma. Fe runs a family member's business operating a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of vegetables in the local community. Ma. Fe has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Ma. Fe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Fe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Ma. Fe is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell in the shop as well as tuition fees. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Ma. Fe from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables to sell, and tuition fees.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna is 34 years old; she is married and the mother of four children who are currently in school. She is very humble and committed to her work and the family needs, because she believes the children are her future hope.

Susanna sells smoked cow meat in bulk at the community market where she lives. She has gotten stocks of cow meat from the northern region of Ghana for five years now. Sometimes she spends weeks in the northern region so that she can buy more meat to supply to her customers. This, she said, prevents her from frequent traveling. She requests the loan to buy more smoked meat to upgrade her inventory. And she would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy bulk supply of smoked meat.

loans.name: Fatou Gakou

texts.fr: Fatou Gakou S. est une veuve de 69 ans avec 6 enfants dont elle a la charge. Elle fait du commerce de mangues sur étal. Ce prêt sollicité lui permettra de renforcer son activité et mieux subvenir aux besoins de scolarité et de santé de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fatou Gakou S. is a 69 year old widow with 6 children for whom she is responsible. She sells mangoes at a stand. The requested loan will allow her to strengthen her business and to better provide for her family's schooling and health needs.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and resale of mangoes

loans.name: Blue Group

texts.en:
Jamila D., age 34, is single with three children ages 14, 12 and 3years.  She has a table top (fruits and vegetable) and grocery (cold drinks)business, which she started 3 years ago.  She works daily from 7am until 11pm.     She is able to earn a monthly profit of around $188.
 
This will be Jamila’s 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to increase stock on the table top and started selling cold drinks and has paid back the loan successfully. She hopes for a new loan to still increase on both businesses.
	
Jamila will share this loan with her loan group Blue, which totals 17 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Jamila is  second from right at the back in white..

loans.use: To increase on business

loans.name: Bénète Plus Group

texts.fr:
Kakala N. 42 ans, est présidente d’une banque communautaire dénommée « Bénète Plus » qui est composée de 28 membres qui se sont solidairement constitués et se sont engagés à obtenir des prêts auprès de l’IMF HOPE RDC.
Kakala vend des produits vivriers tels que des céréales et autres produits dans la partie montagneuse située à l’ouest de Kinshasa. Elle est entrée dans le monde de micro entreprise depuis 2005. Elle a déjà reçu 4 fois les crédits de l’IMF HOPE qu’elle a remboursé totalement et à temps. Elle compte avec le prochain prêt de Kiva à travers l’IMF HOPE RDC, acheter la semoule de maїs qu’elle revendra pour faire prospérer son affaire qui lui génère aujourd’hui un bénéfice de $40 par semaine. Son ambition est d’ouvrir un grand dépôt des céréales qui sont beaucoup recherchés dans son milieu. Kakala est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont leurs âges varient entre 9 et 19 ans. Tous vont à l’école.

loans.use: acheter la semoule de maїs à revendre pour faire prospérer son activité

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita B. is from the village of P-1, Brgy. 25, Pandan Gingoog City. She is 34-years-old. Lolita, (seen on the right), is married and has three school-age children. To make a living, Lolita owns and operates a business venture together with Heidi Joy Abao, (left), as her business partner in the food sector making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling specialty food products in the local community.  Lolita is just starting this business.

In 2009, Lolita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

location.town: Barangay 25, Pandan, Gingoog City, Mis. Or.

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es:
En el Mercado Central de León, la señora Rosa C. se destaca por vender sus productos comestibles como atoles elaborados por ella misma y ofrecidos ambulantemente en las calles del mercado.

La razón por la que ha acudido a Ceprodel es para solicitar un crédito para la compra de la materia prima como lo es el pan, la leche y los dulces. Con este crédito se beneficiará grandemente porque invertirá en el negocio y así venderá los atoles en su localidad.

loans.use: Compra de materia prima

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
“If there’s a will, there’s a way." This is Elizabeth’s guiding principle in life. She knows that survival is hard unless a person makes an effort. Elizabeth is 30 years old and she is married to Michael, a fisherman in their village. They have no children yet but they see that as a positive reason to get prepared for their future. They believe that someday their children will have a good future with the help of their business, which is their main focus right now.

Elizabeth has been selling fruits and vegetables for a year now. She hopes that her business will continuously grow, so she is asking for additional capital to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of PHP4,000 so she can purchase more goods to offer to her customers. She hopes that her business will grow with the help of the loan that she is requesting.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: El Gran Paititi Group

texts.es: El Grupo “El gran Paititi II” esta representado por la señora Ninoska y conformado por 15 miembros los cuales se dedican a diferentes actividades de índole comercial y de servicios como la venta de abarrotes en pulperías o en tiendas de barrio, venta de cosméticos y perfumes, masitas, ropa y comidas. Dentro del ámbito comercial las socias cuentan con una gran competencia pero saben como salir adelante para forjar un mejor futuro para sus familias. El destino del financiamiento es específicamente para incrementar su mercadería y para agrandar sus fuentes de trabajo. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia los integrantes del grupo ya tenían experiencia en otras instituciones similares a la Fundación Agrocapital, pero están agradecidos por el gran apoyo económico y la confianza otorgada por nuestra institución ya que de ello depende el futuro de sus familias.
texts.en:
The Group “El gran Paititi II” is represented by Mrs. Ninoska and made up of 15 members, all of whom are involved in various commercial activities and services, such as selling groceries in a grocery or neighborhood store, cosmetics and perfume sales, dough making, sales of clothing, and food. There is a lot of competition in commerce but the members know how to forge ahead in order to create a better future for their families. This loan will be used specifically to increase their various merchandise and their incomes. As far as their credit history goes, the members of this group all have experience with lending institutions similar to Fundacíon Agrocapital, however, they are still grateful for the great economic support and confidence our institution can provide for them, as the future of their families depends on it.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.en:
Mrs. Enriqueta V. is a resident of Barangay DTM, Regidor St. Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She and her husband have three children and, in order to give their children a better future, they help each other to finance the children's schooling. They endure hardships and difficulties to earn income for their daily needs and for their children's tuition fees and allowances.
Enriqueta's husband is a jeepney driver while Enriqueta makes handicrafts for Christmas. She makes her products to order. In addition to her handicraft business, she also sells peanut butter. Her average monthly income is 6,000 PHP, which is used to meet their daily needs and finance their children's schooling.
Enriqueta wants to improve her business so she can earn more income. Since her capital is insufficient, she wants to borrow 7,000 PHP from KIVA lenders. She hopes that this will be a great help to her in improving her small business.

loans.use: As additional capital to improve her handicrafts business

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita S. is from the village of Gango, Ozamiz City. She is 65 years old, married, and has four adult children. Rosita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store business, selling a variety of products to local community members. She has been engaged in this business for five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Rosita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Rosita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products for her retail store. This loan will be her fourth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
