Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more products for sale

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita A. is from the village of Cabaruan. She is 41 years old. Pacita is married. To make a living, Pacita owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Pacita has been engaged in her business for several years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Pacita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pacita is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Pacita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Lors

texts.en:
Lors N. is a 54-year-old farmer who lives in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is married to Mr. Choeun, age 56, who works with her in the farming business. This couple currently owns a cultivating machine that they use for their farming. They also use their machine to plow a nearby farmer’s land for profit.

When the dry season comes, the environment begins drying everywhere. This condition may affect Lors N. in her ability to grow her crops due to the lack of a watering system. She needs a loan to purchase a pump and a machine to irrigate her crops.

loans.use: To purchase a pump and a machine for irrigation

loans.name: Julie's Group

texts.en: Julie A. is from the village of Rang-ay, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 42 years old. Julie is the group leader of a 10-member group loan offered by ASKI, a Kiva partner. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Julie is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Julie operates a store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Julie has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2010, Julie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julie is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the first loan taken out by Julie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Lily's Group

texts.en:
Lily J. is from the village of Brgy. Sta. Lucia, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. Lily is the group leader of an eight-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Lily J..

Lily is 53 years old and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Lily owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Lily has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $88 a month from these activities.

In 2007, Lily joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Lily has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. That loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lily is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be her 6th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Peng

texts.en:
Peng Y., age 30, is married and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has two children.

Y. is a cleaner at a local university, earning an income of approximately US$2 per day. By doing so, she is able to cover her family expenses, especially the children’s education. She has been with this business since 2008. Her husband is a security guard, earning an income of US$2 per day.

Their standard of living has been improved since Y.’s husband is with this business, so she wants to have a loan to expand his business. Y. is requesting a loan of US$650 to buy groceries for sale to start a new business. This is her first loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner.

loans.use: To buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Aviones Group

texts.es: El grupo “Aviones” esta representado por la señora Iveth Ximena y conformado por 12 miembros las cuales todas son mujeres trabajadoras, unidas y muy dinámicas, además D. trabajar arduamente para mantener a sus familias. La señora Iveth Ximena se dedica a la venta D. ropa para caballeros, tiene dos niños y es casada, su esposo trabaja como electricista a domicilio por lo que habeces tiene trabjo y otras veces no mucho, por lo que la señora Iveth Ximena es la que sustenta su hogar la mayoría D. las veces, el destino del financiamiento es para la compra D. mercadería para que su esposo pueda abrir una caseta en otro lugar la cual atienda solo fines D. semana para generar mayores ganancias para el sustento y la educación D. sus hijos. Los demás socios se dedican a diferentes actividades como la costura D. ropa deportiva, venta D. artículos D. limpieza, venta D. comida, venta D. juguetes, venta D. plásticos venta D. ropa. Las señoras confían en sus habilidades para poder ofrecer una buena competividad en el mercado en el cuál se están desempeñando. El crédito obtenido es para el aumento D. capital, para la compra D. mercadería, insumos y herramientas que ayuden a mejorar sus ingresos. El banco comunal esta trabajando ya en su cuarto ciclo demostrando responsabilidad, honestidad y ganas D. salir adelante para el bienestar D. sus familias.
texts.en:
The group “Aviones” (Airplanes) is led by Sra. Iveth Ximena and consists of 12 members who are all working women who are united and dynamic. They work extremely hard to support their families. Sra. Iveth Ximena sells clothing for men. She is married and has two children. Her husband works from home as an electrician. Sometimes he has work and other times he does not have as much. For this reason, Sra. Iveth Ximena is responsible for supporting their household most of the time. Her loan will be used for her husband so that he can open a booth at another location that he will manage only on the weekends. This will enable him to generate more income to support and educate their children.

The other members are engaged in different activities such as manufacturing sportswear, selling cleaning supplies, selling food, selling toys, selling plastics, and selling clothes. The women are confident in their abilities to proviD. good competition in the market where they operate. This loan will increase their operating capital so that they can buy merchandise, supplies, and equipment that will help them improve their earnings. The Communal Bank is already working on its fourth loan cycle and has demonstrated responsibility, honesty, and the desire to succeed for the welfare of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Jesus Andres

texts.es: El señor Jesús Andrés Meja es casado con la señora Laura y son una familia joven y unida, el labora para una empresa nacional de ferrocarriles, y están tramitando este crédito para la colocación de un piso en la parte posterior de su casa además de instalar el portón de su hogar ya que en su colonia se han presentado actos de vandalismo. Así ellos sentirán mejor seguridad para su familia y hogar.
texts.en:
Jesús Andrés Meja and his wife Laura are a young and united family. He works for a national train company. They are seeking this loan to build a floor on the rear portion of their house. They will also build a gate on their home, as there have been some acts of vandalism in their neighborhood. In this way, they will feel more secure in their home and family.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a concrete floor and a gate

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap T. (in the photo), age 55, and her husband, Mr. Sophanny Chan, age 50, have been married since 1979 and have seven children: two sons and five daughters. Two of them are married and live outside the family home, two attend school, one weaves silk at home and the other two work in a garment factory. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sopheap is a silk weaver. Besides her weaving business, she also runs a grocery store in the village. Her husband drives a motor taxi. She is asking for a loan of $800 to purchase silk materials for her and her daughter’s weaving business. She will also use part of her loan to buy grocery items for inventory.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business and grocery items for resale

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 48 años, es casado y tiene dos hijos. Reside en la localidad de Pichari, específicamente en la selva cuzqueña, donde tienen su casa propia.

Él se caracteriza por ser una persona con muchos proyectos en mente, pero sabe que debe ir paso a paso para llegar a su objetivo. Es por ello que empezó en cultivar la hoja de coca, ya que es un producto que no tiene temporada y a medida que sus ventas incrementaron incursionó en la producción de cacao.
Manuel piensa que le falta mucho por recorrer, es por ello que se levanta muy temprano para ir a su chacra y sacarle todo el provecho a sus tierras. Generalmente recibe la ayuda de su familia para que le faciliten la extracción de sus productos y su horario de trabajo es desde las 6:00 AM hasta las 6:00 PM. Para el futuro quiere empezar a criar gallinas y cerdos, con el propósito de incrementar sus ganancias.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a cumplir con sus obligaciones de pago durante las fechas pactadas. Además hace hincapié al buen manejo organizacional de su banco comunal. El dinero solicitado le servirá para comprar abono, con la finalidad de hacer más fértil su chacra y mejorar sus plantaciones.
texts.en:
Manuel is 48 years old, married, and has two children. He lives in the town of Pichari, specifically in the Cuscan jungle, where he has his own home.

Manuel is known as someone who has many projects planned, but he knows he must go step by step in order to accomplish each goal. For this reason, he began growing coca leaves since this crop can be grown anytime during the year. As his sales increased, he later ventured into growing cacao.

Manuel feels he has a long way to go, so he gets up early every morning to head toward his farm so that he can take full advantage of his land. He generally has the help of his family with harvesting his crops. His work schedule is from 6am to 6pm. In the future, he wants to begin raising chickens and pigs in order to boost his earnings.

This is his third loan with MFP. Manuel commits to meeting his payment obligations by the established deadlines. His Communal Bank emphasizes good organizational management. The money he requested will be used to purchase compost to make his land more fertile and improve his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost

loans.name: Shahnaz Akhtar's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz Akhtar, a resident of Borewala (famous for its shrines), Pakistan, is the wife of M. M. and the mother of six children: three sons and three daughters. She owns a small house of two rooms and has been living in it with her family for over thirty-years. 

A very caring lady, Shahnaz stays at home, manages the domestic chores and cooks food for her family. Her husband operates an elastic making business. He makes elastic by machine, by filling the threads in the machine. He supplies the elastics in different shops for the market and also sells by going into different areas of the community on his four-wheeled cart. Shahnaz helps him by selling the elastics to neighbors.  

Shahnaz has successfully completed three loans to Asasah and now is applying for the fourth time to invest the capital in her husband’s business. With the funds from the loan, he can purchase the threads in bulk and sell elastics to more customers and generate a good profit from it.

loans.use: To purchase threads in bulk for making elastics.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan R. is a 44-year old married woman who lives in Barangay Prosperidad, San Carlos City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by selling fruits and vegetables and by making bags. Her husband, Igmedio, who is 48 years old, helps his wife in running the businesses. They have one child who is 12 years old and currently goes to school. Susan joined NWTF-Project Dungganon (NWTF-PD) in 1998 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by selling fruits and vegetables and by making bags. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 10,000 from her business activities. Susan is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 49,500 was used to fund operations of her fruits and vegetables business as well as her bag-making business and it had a positive impact on both the businesses and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing Php 55,000 for her 18th loan which she intends to use as additional working capital. Susan is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her businesses

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi K. sells secondhand clothes and cloth at Abura.  Esi has a junior high education.  She is married and has three children. Her husband is a mason. She is responsible for helping her husband take care of the family. Her loan will enable her buy large quantities of secondhand clothes to sell. She is confident she will use the new profits from her business to save to acquire a shop for her business.

loans.use: To buy large qunatities of secondhand clothes

loans.name: Memuna

texts.en:
Madam Memuna is a simple and active business woman.  She is 39 years old and was born in Kabala, north of Sierra Leone. Her business is located in her home, where she has done her slippers and cosmetic business for the past 15 years. Memuna has a good loan repayment history. Memuna is single and has 3 dependents. She has basic business skills and she works very hard to ensure that her business is profitable. She opens her business to customers at 7:00am and closes at 6:30pm daily.
Her elder sister assisted her with the initial business capital. She started her business with 500,000 Leones. Memuna needs a loan of 3,000,000 Leones for a period of 6 months to help her buy more stock. She intends using the proceeds of her loan to educate her dependents and to provide other basic support to them.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Varnette Venture #2 Group

texts.en:
Bendu B.  is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Varnette Venture #2. She is 36 years old, married and has three children who range from 4 to 18 years old. Bendu  is holding the sign in the photo. She is a college student and also cares for two siblings.

For 4 years, she has been selling water and soft drinks in Redlight Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more sacks of water and more crates of soft drink.

She describes herself as a good mother. Her goal is to improve her business and continue to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of water and more crates of soft drink

loans.name: Dominga Clementina

texts.es:
Dominga es una mujer Comerciante de venta de ropa y zapato que ha crecido gracias al empeño que ha tenido, y el apoyo de la institución, estableció su negocio hace siete años, con poco dinero que su esposo dio. Ahora lleva seis ciclos en Afodenic en donde sus ventas aumentaron a través del financiamiento.
Su mercadería la compra a proveedores en donde compra a buen precio, también por muchos años ha trabajado en la costura y es una entrada de ingreso que tiene.
Su esposo también es pequeño comerciante en venta de granos básicos, con sus créditos anteriores ha invertido en la compra de ropa. Ahora lo que desea hacer es un anexo  a su casa.
Lo que comprara materiales de construcción como: bloques, arena, cemento, hierro ya que piedra ya las tiene comprada. 
Lo que esta contenta por que sus objetivos se ha hecho posible, gracias al financiamiento a plazos de la institución.
texts.en:
Dominga is a clothing and shoe merchant who has grown thanks to the effort she’s put into her work and help from the institution. She established her business 7 years ago with a little money her husband gave her. Now she has been in 6 cycles with Afodenic and the loans have helped her sales grow. She buys her merchandise at good prices from supplies. She has also worked as a seamstress for many years and this is an extra source of income for her. Her husband is also a small merchant. He sells basic grains. She has used prior loans to buy clothing but what she needs now is to build an addition onto her house. She will buy building materials and supplies like: concrete blocks, sand, cement and iron rods since she already has purchased the gravel. She is happy because she has reached her goals thanks to the loans and repayment terms of the institution.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies to build an annex onto her house.  She will buy items like: concrete blocks, sand, cement and iron rods to start the project.

loans.name: Dorothy Luafa

texts.en:
Dorothy Luafa M., a 22-year-old married mother of two children aged one and five years, owns a business planting and harvesting taro for sale. Dorothy Luafa, who has many years of experience in this business, is now requesting a loan of WST$1000 to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2010, Rosalia joined SPBD, and this is her first loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Dorothy's only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD: In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's lending philosophy is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD. http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Cairoding

texts.en:
Cairoding R. is from the village of Barinaut, Iligan City. He is 18 years old. Cairoding is single. To make a living, Cairoding owns & operates a business providing motorcycle services to local community members. Cairoding has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Cairoding joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cairoding has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Cairoding is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase equipment to improve the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Cairoding from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase equipment to improve his business

location.town: Barina-ut, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Ligia

texts.es:
Ligia M. T. es una mujer muy  independiente y tiene como meta establecer su propio negocio para  ayudar a su familia, y generar empleo,ya que hay escazes de empleo en la comunidad.
Ella vive en la communidad Canalete de Alajuela, conocida por su maravillosa vista a l cerro Miravalles y especialmete  por sus mujeres emprendadoras.

 Dona Lidia quiere comprar dos vacas y materiales para producir y vender la leche. Su prestamos anteriores le ayudaron  a ampliar su  ventas y su  confianza en si misma y en su trabajo.

Dona Lidia desea un credito de ¢600 000 (seiscientos mil colones)  para conseguir su metas y mejora  su estilo de  vida y la de su familia. Ella sabe bien el valor del trabajo y tiene trayectoria demonstrado con su creditos y trabajo hasta la fecha.
texts.en:
Ligia M. T. is a very independent woman and her goal is to set up her own business to support her family and generate employment. There is a lack of work in the community. She lives in the community of Canalete de Alajuela and it is known for the beautiful view of the Miravalles mountain and for the hard working women in the population. Lidia would like to purchase two cows and equipment to product and sell milk, Her previous loans have helped her increase her sales and this has improved her self-confidence as well as her business. Lidia requires a loan of 600 000 (six hundred thousand) colones to help her reach her goals and to improve the quality of life of herself and for her family. She recognizes very well the value of work and she has demonstrated this with her loans and work to date.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase milk cows.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena A. has no educational background. She is divorced and takes care of four children. She sells provisions and roasted plantains at Abura. She has been roasting plantains for sale for some time now. She takes care of her family with the income she makes from her sales. She will use the loan to purchase more plantains to roast for sale.

loans.use: purchase more plantains to roast for sale

loans.name: Dudu

texts.en: Dudu Begernin is currently in the business of selling beans, rice, maize flour, etc., and is requesting a loan to stock more maize flour to sell. Dudu is 40 years old and married with a husband who works in business. She has four children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

loans.use: Stock more maize flour to sell

loans.name: Said

texts.en: Said Kivuona is a 25-year-old milk supplier in Likoni, Mombasa. He is married to Mesaid Juma and together they are blessed with two children. Kivuona has been in this business for the last year and his income has been great. He is now requesting his second loan from KADET LTD to purchase more milk to stock. He will use the anticipated profit to reinvest in the business. He hopes to grow his business, be successful in life and be in good financial position for a better living standard for his family.

loans.use: to purchase more milk to stock

loans.name: Agapita

texts.en:
Agapita L.  is from the village of Lower Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 55 years old.

Agapita is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Agapita owns & operates in Agricultural sector running in ricefield.The main source of income for the business comes from their rice field. Agapita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

 In 2009, Agapita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Agapita is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and fertilizer for their farm. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Agapita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for rice field

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia S. lives in the Makerere Zone C neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has three children, two of whom are in school.  She also takes care of her brother.  Sylvia has a retail shop.  She has been in this business for four years, and she works seven days a week. 

Sylvia has requested for a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more merchandise such as bags of sugar, cartons of salt, and boxes of soap.The main business challenges for Sylvia include seasonality and transportation.  Her goals for her business are to own a wholesale shop and also to build rentals. 

Sylvia lives in a home, which she owns; she has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding her family.

loans.use: To buy boxes of soap, bags of sugar, and cartons of salt

loans.name: Dhoren

texts.en:
Dhoren F. is from the town of Banga. She is 25 years old. Dhoren is married and has a 6-year-old child. To make a living, Dhoren owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Dhoren also makes puto (rice cakes) and other delicacies, which she sells around her neighborhood.

Dhoren joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dhoren has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Dhoren is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
L. señora María, tiene 59 años D. edad, es viuda hace 08 años y tiene 01 hija llamada Jhosy Mayra D. 22 años. Juntos residen en  una casa alquilada en el distrito D. Quimbiri, que pertenece al departamento convención Cusco Perú. María, es una señora emprendedora, que trata D. sobre salir adelante con los pequeños negocios que tiene. Sus ingresos económicos lo genera su pequeña bodega y su fuente D. soda.
Maria cuenta con detalle como se inicio en el negocio, menciona que sufrió por el fallecimiento D. su pareja porque era su felicidad y el sostén D. su familia. Con el transcurso del tiempo Trató D. superarse y seguir adelante, con los ahorros que tenía aperturò una tienda D. abarrotes, que le genera buenas ganancias y gracias a ello  pudo abrir  una fuente D. soda. Hoy trabaja con el  apoyo D. su hija y juntas tratan D. superarse, en el futuro  ansía ampliar su negocio y comprarse un lote D. terreno donD.  puedan vivir con tranquilidad y no estar pendiente en las fechas D. pago del alquiler D.  cuarto. Este es su noveno crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus concernientes pagos, además esta satisfecha con su banco comunal y es una socia  muy querida. Con el crédito solicitado, comprará lo necesario para implementar su tienda.
texts.en:
María is 59 years old.  She has been a widow for 8 years and has one daughter called Jhosy Mayra who is 22 years old.  She lives together with her daughter in a rented house in Quimbiri district, in Convención department, Cusco, Peru.

María is an enterprising lady who tries to get ahead through her small businesses.  She makes her income through a small grocery store and soda fountain.  Maria tells us in detail how she started her business.  She mentions that she suffered a lot when her partner died because he was the joy and support of their family.  Over time, she tried to improve herself and get ahead.  She used her savings to open a grocery store which makes good profits and, thanks to these profits, she was able to open a soda fountain.  She currently works with her daughter's help and they both try to improve themselves together.

In the future, Maria would like to expand her business and buy a plot of land where they can live peacefully and not constantly be waiting for the dates when they have to pay the rent on their room.

This is Maria's ninth loan with MFP and she pledges to continue making her repayments on time.  She is very satisfied with her community bank and she is a very well-liked member.  She will use her loan to buy what she needs to stock her store.

loans.use: To buy products to stock her store

loans.name: Together As One Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Together As One” group. They are small businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Fatmata B.. Fatmata is forty years old.  She was born in one of the villages that make up Sanda, in northern Sierra Leone.   Currently, she resides in Makeni with her husband and children. Her husband is a soldier.  Two of her children are attending primary school, the others (eight of them) no longer attend school. 

For the past five years, Fatmata has been selling beans, cooked cassava roots, sardines, powdered milk, cigarettes, mints, matches, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above mentioned items at wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy beans, cassava roots, sardines, powdered milk, cigarettes, mints, matches, etc.

loans.name: Hamidou

texts.fr:
Natif de Mopti, Monsieur Hamidou T. a 41 ans mari d’une épouse et père de 4 enfants, il loge  dans le quartier Darsalam II de la ville de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso). 
Dû à des raisons familiales, Hamidou n’a pas eu la chance d’étudier.  Pour cela cet aventurier  Dogon a commencé ses activités par le gardiennage et  avec son salaire, il a pris l’initiative de s’insérer dans les activités génératrices de revenus, aujourd’hui il est vendeur de boissons dans un centre culturel de Koutiala depuis 3 ans.  L’ activité qu’il mène est très rentable, car il vend beaucoup  de casiers de boissons par jour.  
Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, Mr T. a cherché une collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis 2 ans.  Il est à son troisième prêt individuel car les deux précédents ont été bien payés. 
Hamidou compte acheter,  30 casiers de boissons  avec son montant financé, il vend au centre culturel de Koutiala à une clientèle  composée de femmes et d’ hommes  au comptant. Avec le renforcement de son fonds de commerce, il compte sur un bénéfice de 75.000FCFA par mois qu’il utilisera pour le remboursement des intérêts de Soro Yiriwaso, prendre les charges totales de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
A native of Mopti, Mr. Hamidou T. is 41 years old, has one wife and is the father of four children.  He lives in the Darsalam II district of the city of Koutiala (in the region of Sikasso).  
Because of family circumstances, Hamidou did not get the chance to study.  That is why this adventurous member of the Dogon tribe began work as a caretaker and, with his earnings, took the initiative to enter into money-making ventures.  He has been selling beverages at a cultural center in Koutiala for three years.  The work he does is very profitable because he sells many cases of drinks per day. 
In order to increase his working capital, Mr. T. has partnered with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso for two years.  He is on his third individual loan, having properly repaid the first two. 
Hamidou plans to buy 30 cases of drinks with his loan.  He sells them for cash at the cultural center in Koutiala to a clientele of men and women. With this increase in funds he plans to earn a monthly profit of 75,000 FCFA which he will use to pay interest on the Soro Yiriwaso loan, take over all family responsibilities, and invest the rest in his business.

loans.use: to buy drinks

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is from the village of Farmington, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 54 years old. Lilia is married and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Lilia owns & operates a business venture which is fish selling business.Lilia has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Lilia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilia is requesting a loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her fish selling business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Lilia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To expand his business and buy some essential materials for his general store

loans.name: Maria Orbelina

texts.es:
Doña María, de 70 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, vive junto a una hija de 36 años de edad, se dedican a la venta de comida, pupusas y refrescos, este negocio fue fundado hace 12 años. Juntas trabajan todos los días de la semana, de 5:00am a 3:00pm, la ventaja es que no existen negocios similares en la zona. 
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar: arroz, frijoles, aceite, entre otros, estos productos son para la venta de comida ya que son parte del menú que ofrece a los clientes; este préstamo le ayudara a mantener el negocio y seguir obteniendo ganancias las cuales serán utilizados para cubrir sus gastos cotidianos.
Ella aspira mantenerse en el negocio, brindar un buen servicio a la clientela  y aumentar su aporte para solventar los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
70 year-old María lives in San Miguel together with her 36 year-old daughter.  Their business is selling meals, pupusas and soft drinks.  They started the business 12 years ago.  María and her daughter work together every day of the week, from 5.00am to 3.00pm.  Their advantage is that there are no similar businesses in the area.

María is currently requesting a loan to buy rice, beans, oil, etc.  She needs these products for her meals business since they are part of the menu that she offers her customers.  This loan will help her to keep her business running and continue making profits which she will use to cover her daily expenses.

María's goals are to keep going in her business, to provide a good service to her customers and to increase her contribution in covering her family expenses.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans and oil

loans.name: Misuless

texts.en: Misuless is a thirty-four-year-old married woman with seven children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been dealing in firewood for the last three years, which she started with money saved from farming. Her hardship is transport problems because of poor roads. Her vision is to have a wholesale business, plus educating her children. Misuless needs the loan to buy more firewood for resale.

loans.use: to buy more firewood for resale

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a 42-year-old divorced mother of two. Originally from Russia, Anna moved to Israel in the mid 90s. She opened her manicure-pedicure business in 2008 and has succeeded in earning a decent income for her family. She works out of a hair salon in Tel Aviv. 

Anna decided to expand her business into cosmetics, providing make-up artistry and cosmetic sales. After completing studies in cosmetics, Anna began her expansion with success.

Anna needs this loan to purchase modern cosmetic equipment and professional make-up supplies.

Anna wants to continue providing quality services and expanding her client base. Her dream is to ensure a strong a bright future for her children.

loans.use: to purchase modern cosmetic equipment and professional make-up supplies.

loans.name: Roel

texts.en:
Roel Barios, age 30, has been operating a rice farming business for 30 years. This business earns 10,000 PHP per month. He is married and lives with his family in Bunawan, Agusan del Sur. 

This loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs. 

In the future, Roel hopes to improve hid business and to earn a bigger income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal to resell

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en: Gabriel is a member of Faulu Kenya under the Gakuya group.  He has benefited from Faulu Kenya through the group because he is able to access business loans and because the members of the group guarantee each other's loans.  He has managed to improve his business, where he sells items like caps, balls, diaries and notebooks.  He needs 40,000 KES to buy seat covers, caps and mats.  Gabriel hopes to own a permanent business premises in the future.

loans.use: to buy seat covers, caps and mats.

loans.name: Teva

texts.es: Teva tiene 44 años, tiene 4 hijos de su primer esposo que falleció, ahora vive con su nueva paraje en su casa propia. Por más de 10 años siembra pastizales, que es sirve de forraje para sus animales, entre ellos vacas y toros que tiene en su establo. Asimismo cultiva papa y quinua, productos que tiene mucha demanda en el mercado  y por ello lo vende al por mayor. La mayor parte de su tiempo lo invierte en la ganadería  para alimentar a sus vacas de las cuales vende la leche que extrae y los toros una vez robustecido y son exhibidos en la feria ganadera de su localidad. Ante esto es que puede vivir y ofrecer bienestar a sus hijos, y por tal se siente orgullosa  ya que en todos estos años ella sola ha sostenido su hogar desde que su esposo falleció. En la actualidad concentrará sus esfuerzos en la compra de más animales para aumentar su capital de trabajo. Es su segundo crédito con MFP, de la cual se siente muy complacida de renovar  un crédito más que le permite mejorar. Por ello pide la colaboración de cada uno de ustedes para cumplir con su propósito. Con este dinero comprará un ternero y así aumentar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Teva is 44 years old.  She has four children from her first husband who passed away.  She now lives with her new partner in her own home.

For more than 10 years, Teva has been growing pasture which serves as fodder for her animals which include cows and bulls that she keeps in her cow shed.  She also grows potatoes and quinoa: products which are in great demand in the market.  For this reason, she sells these products wholesale.

Teva invests most of her time in raising her cattle.  She feeds her cows and sells their milk.  Once her bulls have grown strong, she shows them at the cattle market in her town.  She does all this so that she can support her family and provide for her children's well-being.  She feels proud because during  the years since her husband passed away, she has supported her household single-handedly.

Teva will currently concentrate her efforts on buying more animals to increase her working capital.  This is her second loan from MFP and she feels very pleased to be renewing her loan as it will allow her to improve her business.  She is requesting the cooperation of each and every one of you in achieving her goal.  Teva will use this money to buy a calf and thereby increase her working capital.

loans.use: to buy a calf

loans.name: Edwin Ernesto

texts.es:
Edwin, es empleado, vive con su esposa y tienen dos hijos, él trabaja como empleado en el taller general de caja, desde hace 6 años.
Él solicita un préstamo para comprarse un juego de herramientas, su compra seria el estuche completo de todas las herramientas como llaves, desarmadores, y más que son parte del estuche, la inversión le ayudara a tener sus propias herramientas para realizar el trabajo, ya que actualmente utiliza unas que son prestadas.
Su objetivo es realizar el trabajo de una forma eficiente, cancelar oportunamente este préstamo y velar por las necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
Edwin is employed, and lives with  his wife and their two children.  He has worked as an employee of an auto repair shop for 6 years.  He requests a loan to buy a set of tools; with this purchase he will have a complete toolkit including wrenches, screwdrivers and other tools.  This investment will allow him to have his own tools to do his work, since he currently works with borrowed tools.

His goals are to do his work more efficiently, pay off this loan on a timely manner, and look after the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy a set of tools to use in the workshop (including wrenches and screwdrivers)

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Monica owns a posho mill machine used for grinding maize and millet into flour. Her potential customers are the neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the machine breaking down and the unavailability of parts. Monica dreams of expanding her business in the future. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. 

With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase fuel for her posho mill machine.

loans.use: To purchase fuel for her posho mill machine.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita, a 70-year-old married mother of nine, lives in the Philippines where she has had a coffee shop that sells and serves breads and a variety of beverages for 10 years. A member of HSPFI, Rosita is requesting a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more coffee and breads, and in the future hopes to improve her enterprise.

loans.use: to buy coffee and breads for her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts for motorcycles

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 31 years old, married and has two children.

Haydar has been the owner of a men's clothing shop since 2005. He has a good experience in this field and has a good reputation, and he has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His shop is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.


He is requesting a $2400 loan to make an outdoor ceiling and a sliding door. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: To make an outdoor ceiling and a sliding door.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy clothes for selling.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
Jaime is 51, married, and has two adult children. He is a hard working father who owns and manages a rice farm business in their village, and usually earns a profit of only P23,000 in every harvest season. He aims to increase his yields and income for he wants to save for future emergencies, and put up a grocery store in the future for his wife to manage. 

Due to financial difficulty, he is asking for an additional capital of P20,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and other expenses incurred in planting rice. He mentioned that through this loan, he will be able to expand his plantation and manage it well. He hopes that through patience and hard work, he will increase his yields and make his business grow.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and other expenses incurred in planting rice

loans.name: Mishelle

texts.en:
Mishelle is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Mishelle has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Mishelle has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Mishelle hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Avelia

texts.en:
Avelia is 42, married and has three school-age children. She owns and manages an eatery and board and lodging business in their community. Due to the high costs of school fees and commodities, they need to increase their income to satisfy their necessities and finance the education of their children. 

She aims to improve their house and lodging business to satisfy their customers' needs, but due to inadequate capital, she has to ask for a loan of PHP 45,000 to buy paint, nails and furniture to repair and improve their house and lodging business. She believes that through this loan, they will improve the business and gain more customers.

loans.use: to buy paint, nails, and furniture to repair and improve their house and lodging business.

loans.name: 03.3.04 Quảng Hưng Tp Thanh Hoá Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Gấm, age 33, has a food stall business, selling candy and cake. She is the group leader of the 4 Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoá city, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province. She and her husband have two children. She has been engaged in her business for five years. Her primary business challenge is lack of sufficient capital.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more candy and cake to offer for sale. This is her first loan with the Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
 
With her business profits, Mrs. Gấm hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and eventually to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase candy and cake to offer for sale

loans.name: Anastasi

texts.en:
Anastasi is a 38-year-old lady who is married to Elias, a 43-year-old man. They are blessed with six children namely: Gaudesiana, 16, studying at the 2nd grade of Senior High School; Cristianis, 14, studying at the 3rd grade of Junior High School; Ludgardis, 10, Maria, 8; and Sisco, 7, all of them are attending Primary School, and Secilia, 2.

Anastasi operates a kiosk business which sells daily needs such fresh vegetables, kerosene, detergents, eggs, bread, coffee, sugar, tea, gasoline etc. Anastasi is grateful that the business benefits her family. She is able to pay the children's education fees through her business income.

Anastasi plans to sell instant cold beverages and soft drinks as demanded by the customers. She thinks that this is a good business and profitable as they are living in a tropical region. Unfortunately, she does not have money to buy a refrigerator. Therefore, Anastasi is requesting a loan of IDR 5,000,000 from TLM; she would like to purchase a refrigerator and to add more stock before Christmas. She really hopes that TLM will approve her loan application.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator and to add more stock.

loans.name: 06.08.01 Đông Vệ Thanh Hoa Group

texts.en:
Thủy, 47, is married with two children. She has a stall selling votive objects, a business she has been involved in for more than ten years. She is now requesting a loan to purchase more votive objects to resell.

Thủy is the group leader of the 06.08.01 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of six members. She lives with her two dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a semi-urban town in the Thanh Hoa province. In 2010, Thủy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business and she has successfully repaid one loan.

The main hardship Thủy faces in her business is the lack of capital. In the future, she hopes to maintain her business, to buy a motorbike, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase votive objects to resell.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario had been a farmer for almost 20 years. He plants and cultivates rice as the primary source of his income. He usually earns about 20,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) each harvest season, during the months of April and November. He has five children that attend school so he needs to increase his earnings. He wants to finance their education so that they can earn a degree, unlike him that only finished his secondary education.

He is now asking for a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy five bags of UREA (fertilizers) to be used for farming.

He hopes to increase his yield for a higher income and to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy five bags of UREA (fertilizers) to be used for farming.

loans.name: Teng

texts.en: Mrs. Teng is a 41-year-old married woman who has five single children. She lives in Kampong Speu province, Cambodia. She has spent most of her life cultivating rice crops alongside her husband for their livelihood. In the photo, she is shown standing at the side of her thatched house that is built for temporary living. Teng intends to rebuild it again and add zinc roofing. She has saved some money to start to rebuild her shelter, and now she would like to apply for a loan from HKL and Kiva to supplement her capital to get it done. She hopes her family will get a comfortable living from her new house. She is thankful to all lenders.

loans.use: to supplement her capital to start to rebuild her shelter.

loans.name: Aïssata

texts.fr:
Madame Aïssata a environ 46 ans et est mère de six. Elle vit avec son époux et leurs enfants dans une famille nucléaire à Hamdallaye extension, un des  quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali)..
Madame Aïssata après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès,  s’est initiée à cette activité d’achat et de vente des savons de beauté et divers articles depuis plus de vingt ans. Elle mène son activité de façon ambulante avec une clientèle essentiellement composée de femmes dans la ville de Sikasso . Maintenant, elle veut profiter de ce prêt de Soro Yiriwaso pour devenir une grande commerçante au niveau du marché.
Elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel, le prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé.    
Avec ce deuxième prêt, elle compte acheter 10 cartons de savons de beauté, 6 cartons de jus de fruit de qualités différents. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako.
Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000 FCFA. Ces bénéfices réalisés lui permettront de résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Aïssata is about 46 years old and a mother of six.  She lives with only her husband and their children in Hamdallaye Extension, one of the neighborhoods at the outskirts of the city of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
Over 20 years ago, after running several businesses unsuccessfully, Aïssata launched this business buying and selling beauty soaps and other various items.  She is a travelling vendor and her customer base consists of women in the city of Sikasso.  Now she wants to take advantage of this current loan from Soro Yiriwaso to become a large-scale saleswoman with a stall in the market.
She is on her second individual loan; the previous loan was fully paid back.
With this second loan she plans on buying 10 boxes of beauty soaps and 6 boxes of fruit juice of many different varieties.  She gets her supplies in Bamako.
She plans to use this loan to generate a monthly profit of 150,000 CFA francs.  These profits will allow her to pay off most of her own expenses, contribute to the family expenses, pay the interest on her loan and invest the remaining funds into her business.

loans.use: to purchase beauty soaps and fruit juice

loans.name: Kaneez's Group

texts.en:
Kaneez is an expert in embroidery and sewing. She loves her work and works full-time in order to financially support her family. Her customers are very happy with the quality of her work and give her regular orders every time. She has given birth to four sons and three daughters. Two of the children study while three work in the hosiery business. Her elder daughter stays at home and helps Kaneez with household tasks. Her eldest son is a driver by profession and provides transport services to his passengers.
Kaneez's husband is a scrap dealer and supplies scrap to different factories and other dealers in the city. Kaneez has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s scrap business. With the loan investment, he will buy scrap in bulk to be able to fulfill the needs of his customers and increase his income. He is very experienced in his business and has been operating it for many years. Kaneez is hopeful that his business will become a more profitable one after investment.
In the photo, the lady holding the book (called an Asasah Passbook) is Kaneez.

loans.use: to buy scrap in bulk for scrap selling business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 37 years old, married to John and they have four children.  She has been in the curio business selling soapstone carvings from Kisii for the last eight years from which she earns a monthly income of KES 11,000.

She is applying for his second loan of KES 25,000, which she will use to buy more soap stone carvings for sale.  She paid her previous loan back well and in good time. She was introduced to KADET Ltd by a credit officer.

Her hopes are to educate her children and open another curio shop.

loans.use: to buy more soapstone carvings from Kisii for sale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married 62-year-old woman with 4 children aged between 22 and 6 years. 

Grace has a clothing business where she buys and sells clothing. She has operated her business for the past 34 years.

Grace will use her loan to purchase more stock for her business. She plans to use the profits to pay for her children's school fees.

This is her sixth loan with VisionFund Kenya. In the future Grace hopes to have a stable income and to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to purchase clothing stock for resale.

loans.name: Mislene

texts.fr: Mislene est commerçante. Elle revend des spaghettis et des vermicelles. Cela fait trois ans qu’elle fait ce petit commerce. Grace à cela, elle gagne un peu d’argent pour faire vivre sa famille et envoyer ses deux enfants à l’école. Elle cherche un prêt pour augmenter son stock.

loans.use: augmenter son stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her clothing shop.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos and his wife Ingrid have a small farm in Santa Lucia province in Ecuador. Carlos has been living on this land for about 30 years, since it was given to him by his father. Because he only has an elementary education, Carlos wants to provide something more for his 4 year-old son. He relies on the income for his rice farming to feed his family and pay for all the household expenses. He has also been raising cattle for several years as a secondary source of income.

The Santa Lucia Communal Bank

Carlos is part of the newest Communal Banks in the recently developed Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the Centro Agricola de Santa Lucia Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in Santa Lucia. Their association works cooperatively to help in the commercialization of the product after it has grown. They will use the micro-loans to prepare their lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others' guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Primero de Agosto Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many micro-finance programs, but Mifex believes that is imperative for the communities we works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Below is more information about Santa Lucia compiled by Luis Crespo and Robert Edgar of the Mifex team when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program. Special thanks to Mario Balazantegui who provided expert insight and contributed to the development of the alliances with the local organizations.

Economy of Santa Lucia

Santa Lucia County has a population of about 33,000 people. The sector is fit for rice cultivating because it is not in the lowlands and therefore it is not at risk of flooding. There is also great access to water because of the Daule River, which is accessible to many of the farmers in the area. About 70% of the farmers have basic infrastructure for watering their crops.

Rice production is the main economic activity of the area as about 80% of the people are rice farmers. Almost everyone is either directly or indirectly involved with rice production, as they produce, commercialize or participate in activities that add value to the product. Within the county, there is a small town also named Santa Lucia. The town is filled with many small businesses and it serves as the social and commercial hub of the area.

Rice Farming in Santa Lucia

Most of the people in the Santa Lucia area are small farmers. They produce about 100 sacks of rice per hectare of land. In order to farm they first must prepare the lands by removing weeds and plowing. The farmers then fill an area with water to form what is known as a paddy field, because rice is a very water intensive crop. The rice seeds are either dispersed freely (the process is known as boleo in Spanish) or hand sowed. Once the rice has grown, most farmers rent machinery that helps them gather their production. A risk factor does exist in rice farming because of drought, but in Santa Lucia this is somewhat mitigated by the access to water form the nearby river.

Access to Credit

The biggest struggle in the area has been the lack of credit. Because people do not count on formal financial services, they have turned to loan sharks for financing. They have been affected by expensive lines of credit that exceed 100% interest a year and can be as expensive as 240%. Intermediaries also exploit the farmers because of their outstanding debt. Farmers also lack skills and knowledge to commercialize their products and pay fair prices for their crops.

Loan Use

The loans in this sector will be used to to buy soil, seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. They will also be used to prepare the land prior to farming, to plant the seeds and purchase other materials. The loan repayment schedule is also different from the typical micro-entrepreneur. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

loans.use: Plant rice on his farm

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia is 54. She is the only wife to Mr. Nche Thomas and has seven children. Her greatest challenge in life was when she was paralyzed for one entire year. She is still recovering. With the profit from her business, she will be able to purchase medication to speed up her recovery and improve her health. Patricia has benefited from GHAPE loans in the past and has paid them back. She feels paying another will not be difficult. She wants this loan to expand her provision store, to farm cassava, to pig farm, and to expand the business with her daughter. She feels she will be successful because the business has a good location and her daughter will help out when Patricia is not available.

loans.use: Buying and selling of food stuffs

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a widowed mother of six and belongs to a self-help women's group in Kisumu, Kenya, called 'Ongeza Maarifa,' which is a  Swahili  phrase meaning "increase your wisdom." 
They make a variety of products and are particularly involved in a project
 termed 'jiko kisasa' (earthen oven/cooker). This cooker was recently introduced, 
and due to the high demand, the group is targeting to buy a kiln with higher capacity 
than the one currently in use.
They also need to purchase a vehicle which would enable them a
 quicker and more efficient means of transporting their goods. She hopes that this loan will not only enable her to develop her business but also, with time, be able to send her children to the university.

loans.use: To fund her business for expansion

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy materials for his furniture making business

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly lives with her husband and children in their house in La Paz, the capital of Bolivia. She sells shoes - women´s shoes, kids´, sneakers, among others. She has a store in the zone "El Alto" and sells there on teh market days every Thursday and Friday. Other days of the week Nelly sells her shoes according to orders she receives.

Nelly has been a Kiva client once before. She timely paid off her loan and made good use of the money. The current loan will be used to buy more shoes and thus continue increasing her stock.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva volunteer.

Nelly vive en casa propia en la calle Bolívar de la zona de tembladerani de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposo e hijos; ella se dedica a la venta de calzados de damas, niños, tenis, etc. Tiene un puesto fijo en la ciudad de El Alto y allí vende únicamente los días jueves y domingos que son días de feria; los demás días acomoda el producto de acuerdo a pedido. Nelly ya fue cliente de Kiva y el crédito anterior ya fue cancelado e hizo una muy buena utilización del dinero. El crédito que solicita ahora es para compra de más mercadería y así seguir aumentando su capital. Su antecedente Histórico es bueno y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Purchase shoes, thus continuing to increase her stock

loans.name: Houn

texts.en:
Mrs. Houn D. (shown in the photo with her daughter) and her husband, Mr. Bunthoeun Moeun, have been married since 1986. They have three children, two sons and one daughter. Houn’s two sons are studying in the local school, and her daughter has been weaving silk (see photo) at home since 2005. Their family lives along the Mekong River about twenty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh. Houn and her husband have been farming since 1986. They have been planting jicamas, yams, and sweet potatoes at a farm not far from their house.

Houn is requesting her second loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $300. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials and sewing thread, and to pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom for her daughter’s weaving.

loans.use: To buy silk materials for weaving and to pay for loom preparation

loans.name: Salma's Kitokiondo Group

texts.en:
Salma is 42 years old. She is married and has 2 children, ages 5 and 3. She and her husband also take care of four other children. Salma owns a beauty parlor which she opened six years ago. The parlor provides services for both men and women and is open from 8am to 8pm daily. In a month, the parlor brings Salma a profit of about $180.

In the past, Salma successfully took out a loan to increase the products available in her parlor. She now hopes for a new loan for the same purpose. She will share this loan with her loan subgroup.

loans.use: to expand her parlor's services

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina B. is a seamstress and has worked in the area of dressmaking, clothing making and repair for many years. She works hard to support her two children ages 21 and 13, especially since she is the sole provider after she separated from her husband a few years ago.

She saved enough money from her seamstress work and has since opened a small convenience store in the neighborhood. It brings in more income than her sewing work did since it is the only convenience store in the neighborhood she lives in.

Lina knows that she must continue amplifying the sales of her shop in order to pay for her children’s education. She wants them to have the ability to choose whatever profession they want to go into, and to make enough money to have good lives. She is asking for a loan to buy various goods for her convenience store including rice, pasta, milk, coffee, and sugar.

loans.use: To buy merchandise like sugar, rice, pasta, milk and coffee.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence I. is married with 9 children and lives in Benin City. She is 57 years old and sells provisions and foodstuffs. She started her business in 2003. She needs the loan amount of $875 to buy provisions and foodstuffs for sale.

loans.use: To buy provisions and foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Unidas Venceremos Group

texts.en:
Clara lives with her two children (ages: 20 and 18) in the small town of Samana. This will be her 5th loan with Esperanza, and with this money she has opened her own store selling clothes and jewelry. She wants to use this next loan to buy more chains, earrings, rings, pants, shirts, and blouses in order to continue expanding her small shop. Clara told us that her favorite foods are rice and beans and her favorite pastime is playing dominos with her friends. Her goal for the future is to continue saving money through Esperanza’s voluntary savings program.

On behalf of these 5 entrepreneurs and Esperanza, we would like to thank you for your encouragement and support! We can watch together as this loan changes these entrepreneurs over the next six months. God Bless!

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her store

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama S. is twenty-eight years old, and is married with three children. Two of her children are in school and the other has not started school yet. Ama is very supportive of husband, who provides for the family’s basic needs. She is a member of the community group called Quality Trust Group. Members guarantee one another's loans as social collateral.  Ama owns and operates a grocery shop in her local community and sells standard items like soap, evaporated milk, rice, canned foods and drinks. She now wants a loan of $175 to buy more bags of rice, cartons of milk, canned foods and drinks to increase her stock of goods to sell.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, cartons of milk, canned foods and drinks etc.

loans.name: Abdumerot

texts.en:
Abdumerot A. is 29 years old. He lives in the Utkansoi region of Tajikistan. He is married and has 3 children. He has a good reputation as a very hard working, loving family man. Mr. A. is a school teacher, but most of the family’s income comes from their livestock business. Mr. A. has 20 years’ experience with livestock. He raises and sells the animals and also sells their milk and meat.

Mr. A. is applying to KIVA for a business development loan of $625 US for 6 months to buy some rams.

loans.use: To buy some rams

loans.name: Sam-Ol

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam-Ol C., 28, and her husband, Mr. Kruy Bun, 39, who live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 2000 and have two little daughters.

Since she was thirteen years old, Mrs. Sam-Ol C. has been a silk weaver, a skill she learned from her mother. She taught her husband to be a silk weaver in 2001. They sell their finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh.

Sam-Ol is requesting a loan of US$ 700 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Sek

texts.en: Mrs. Sek Y. is a farmer in Angk Tapok Village in the Kampong Speu Province. She is a 30-year-old widow with a child who is employed in a garment factory. Although both family members have income, they want to improve their living conditions. She is requesting a loan to add to her savings to build a new house.

loans.use: To build a new house in the village.

loans.name: Fagarou Group

texts.fr: Le Groupement  FAGAROU situé dans l'écovillage(http://www.sem-fund.org/keurgumaggfr.php) est un groupe de petits vendeurs au détail très dynamique qui tournent dans la périphérie des grands marchés hebdomadaires.  Avec le contexte économique très marqué par une année hivernale dont les prévisions sont en baisse en terme production agricole ; un système de vente de proximité dans le milieu rural et péri-urbain peut rapporter beaucoup de bénéfices. Avec ce prêt, ils pourront acheter et  vendre et des produits comme l'arachide, le riz et le mil suivant les opportunités des marchés de la région du centre. Ce qui leur permettra non seulement de satisfaire la demande, mais aussi de renforcer leur stock, diversifier leurs produits, générer des revenus pour les membres en vue d'une garantie d'une activité durable.
texts.en:
The FAGAROU group, located in an ecovillage (http://www.sem-fund.org/keurgumaggfr.php), is a group of very dynamic small-retail salespeople who work on the periphery of large weekly markets. With an economic situation affected by a winter year whose forecasts are poor in terms of agricultural production; a system of sale in proximity to rural and peri-urban environments can bring back many benefits. With this loan, they will be able to buy and sell products such as peanuts, rice and millet and take advantage of the central region's markets. This will not only enable them to satisfy the demand, but also to build their stock, diversify their products, and generate income for the group's members with a goal of securing a long-term business.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of foodstuffs

loans.name: Yeat

texts.en:
Yeat V., 36, and her husband, Mao Kun, 37, live in a small village across from the Mekong River, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1993 and have six children. All of their children study in a local school. Their oldest daughter assists her mother weave silk when she is not in school.

Yeat has been a silk weaver for four years, and has been a rice farmer since she was young. She sells her finished products to a middle man in the village, who then takes the items to sell in Phnom Penh. Mao is a wooden house builder and a rice farmer as well. 

Yeat is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase more silk materials and materials to grow more rice.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving and for growing rice.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To restock a small grocery store and move the business forward.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
La señora Flor pertenece al Banco Comunal “LA MUJER RIOJANA,” vive en la región San Martín, provincia y distrito de Rioja, es Técnica en Enfermería de profesión, pero no la ejerce porque le gusta el negocio. Se dedica a la venta de ropa, sabanas y a la crianza y venta de cerdos. Tiene un criadero en el sector democracia. 

Con este crédito de S/.3,000, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, sabanas y edredones, así como polvillo, maíz soya, porcina en sacos, ya que este alimento es necesario para la crianza de cerdos, también quiere construir más galpones.
 
La señora Flor tiene 36 años de edad, vive con su hija y su esposo que es constructor y en sus momentos libres hace servicio de mototaxi. Más adelante desea construir su casa y aumentar sus galpones para criar cerdos.
texts.en:
Flor is a member of the Community Bank "La Mujer Riojana" (meaning The Riojan Woman", and she lives in the region of San Martin of the province and district of Rioja. She is a nursing technician by profession, but she doesn't practice anymore because she prefers business. She sells clothing and bed sheets and she also raises pigs. She has a stable in the Democracia sector.

With this loan of S/.3000, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase clothing for ladies, gentlemen and children, bed linen, and feed, such as Yellow Poui, soy beans, pig feed in sacks. This feed is needed to raise her pigs. She also wants to build more stables.

Flor is 36 years old, she lives with her daughter and husband. He is a laborer and in his spare time he is the driver of a motorcycle cab. In the future she would love to build her home and increase the numbers of stables to raise her pigs.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing for ladies, gentlemen and kids, bed linen, and pig feed.

loans.name: Inomjon

texts.en:
D. Inomjon has dedicated much effort to the business of agriculture for 18 years already.  He has 0.8 hectares of land where produces different kinds of vegetables.  He also has a lot of apricot trees on his land. 

He gets a rich harvest every year from his land.  From the savings of his land he could arrange the weddings of his two children.  He also plants different kinds of feeds for animals such as corn, hay, etc.  

Currently, Inomjon is asking for a loan of 4000 Somoni ($1200 USD) in order to purchase fuels and lubricants, mineral fertilizer and also saplings for expanding his fruit garden.  Inomjon is very confident that he will be awarded this loan and assures you that the money will be repaid in time with no violations. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. 

The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.
 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  

While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition.  Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need.  To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing fuels and lubricants, mineral fertilizer and saplings

loans.name: Yamm

texts.en: Mrs. Yamm K. is 29 years old and now lives in Svay Prey village in Kampong Cham province. She is a pig breeder.
