Since her pigs have grown larger and larger, she does not have enough money to feed them. In order to solve this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase pig food to support her business. Her husband, Mr. Bouy Nhor, is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which he cultivates rice. Mrs. Yamm K. is the mother of two children who are too young to work or study. Her husband and children are pictured with her.

loans.use: To purchase pig food

loans.name: Roziya

texts.en:
D. Roziya is 32 years old. She is married and the mother of two adorable children. Roziya has a grocery store which she attends to herself, aside from caring for her family and her home. She began her small business 6 years ago with financial support from her husband who currently earns money in Russia. The reason for starting the business was to increase her family’s income and the business has been gradually growing ever since. In order to improve her business she is requesting a loan to purchase more goods to increase the variety available to her customers. She promises to repay her loan within 9 months and thanks everybody who decided to support her.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New Western culture and Central Asian traditions. But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase a greater range of goods.

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.en:
Dilbar M. lives in the Istaravsha region of Tajikistan. It is the abuttal region so there are a lot of bazaars where people from all over the republic come to buy. Dilbar is married with three children. She is engaged in commercial services and trade, selling school accessories and educational books. She has been in the business for five years.

Dilbar applies to Kiva with the request of a business development loan of 1000 TJS for six months to expand her business. She thanks Kiva for its support and hopes for good future cooperation.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Lusia

texts.en:
Lusia has owned a small food vendor store in the Kihesa neighborhood of Iringa for 15 years. She belongs to Semtema South group loan. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $80. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food items in order to improve her business. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Lusia is 31 years old, divorced, and has two children aged 14 and 9. She also cares for one additional dependent.

loans.use: To buy more food items in order to improve her business

loans.name: Rehema H.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 35-year-old Rehema C. from Mbarali. She is single with two children, between the ages of 12 and 16. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because their parents died of HIV.

Rehema has been selling rice and mobile credit cards since 2000. She buys rice at wholesale prices from farmers and mobile credit cards at wholesale to sell at retail prices.

She works at her business for 9–12 hours per day, 7 days per week, and is assisted by one employee. Rehema currently earns about $460 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $1150 USD in order to purchase more rice in bulk. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and the range of her business. Rehema thanks you for your support!

About SELFINA SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more rice in bulk

loans.name: Phoeung

texts.en: C. is 29 years old and resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She lives with four members of her family: her husband and her three children. Her children attend school. She makes a daily income by distilling wine to sell. She uses the leftover wine to fatten the family's pigs that she also raises. Her husband assists her in the business. Mrs. C. will use the first cycle loan with Kiva to buy rice for distilling wine and to buy more piglets to raise.

loans.use: To buy rice and more piglets to raise.

loans.name: Yormuhammad

texts.ru: Тупалов Ермухаммад житель города Яван. Возраст 53 года, женат и имеет шестерых детей.Старшие сыновья находятся в России на заработках. Сам Ермухаммад всю жизнь работает в сельском хозяйстве. Засеевает землю злаковыми культурами и овощами. Так и сейчас работает на поле. Получаемый урожай использует для реализации , а некоторую часть оставляет в запасе для семьи. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы закупить семена и минеральные удобрения.
texts.en:
Yormuhammad T. lives in Yavan. He is 53 years olf and is married with 6 children. His elder sons are working in Russia. Yormuhammad has always worked in agriculture, cultivating grains and vegetables. He still works in the fielf. He sells most of the produce but he also keeps some for his family. Yormuhammad is planning to use the loan for the purchase of seeds and mineral fertilizers.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora Maria, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen del Rosario”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad D. Queñuani, distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia D. Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 52 años edad, D. estado civil casada, tiene  01 hijo (estudiante), ella  tiene estudios D. primaria incompleta (1er grado)y vive en el Barrio Porteño.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace casi 9 años.  Su primer préstamo fue D. 
S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, con el cual compró carne.  

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra D. carne D. ovino y  vacuno, que luego será vendido en el mercado D.  yunguyo.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando para poder solventar los gastos D. la casa.

A ella le gusta las reuniones, las charlas y los encuentros que organiza Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Ms. Maria L. is a member of the “Virgen del Rosario” Microfinance Institute, located in the Queñuani community, district of Yunguyo, province of Chucuito, Department of Puno. She is a 52-year-old married mother with one son who is currently in school. She did not complete elementary school (only the first graD.), and she lives in the Porteño neighborhood.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement for almost 9 years. Her first loan was for 300.00 PEN, which she used to purchase meat.

At this time, she needs a 3,000.00 PEN loan so that she can purchase meat (mutton and beef), which she will then sell at the Yunguyo Market.

She hopes to continue working so that she can cover the household expenses.

She likes the meetings and discussions that Manuela Ramos organizes.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase mutton and beef

loans.name: Ester

texts.en: Ester S. is from the village of Sinian, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old, married, and has three adult children. Ester owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over eighteen years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month. In 2007, Ester joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. Ester is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase seedlings and other crops

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose sells smoked fish and started her fish selling two years ago at the community market where she lives. She buys stocks of fish from Yeji in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. 

Rose prepares and serves her customers very tasty and good quality fish and because of that many customers buy from her stand. She buys stocks of fish from the fish mongers sometimes, when demand is high. She has a big customer base; customers travel from the other surrounding communities to buy her fish. She requests the loan to upgrade her stock of fish. 

Rose is 48 years old; she is single and a mother with two children. One is independent and the other is still schooling. It is the desire of her heart to give last born the best legacy which quality education for better future. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy more stock of smoked fish and dried fish

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela S. hails from the busy town of Morong, Rizal province in the Philippines. She is 82 years old but the energy for continuing a business is still bursting in her. She is widowed and left with three children. All of her children are of legal age.

In 1998, she decided to join ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines, full of hope to have access to capital for her business. Her previous loans were wisely spent in a farming business, in partnership with her son. The business has gone well and smoothly. It brings in enough profit for herself and her family.

Now on her twelfth loan, she is asking for 40,000 pesos as additional capital for their farm to pay for supplies like fertilizers, pesticides, herbicides, labor and other farm needs.

She is optimistic that, with the support of ASHI and Kiva, she can earn more income and have extra money to save for her future. She is especially concerned for her health, since she is getting older now, and she also wants to help her grandchildren with their school fees.

loans.use: To pay for farm supplies such as fertilizers, pesticides, herbicides and labor, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase the quantity of her footwear stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Achat de casiers de boissons

loans.name: Victorina

texts.en:
Victorina is a fish vendor in the wet market of Angadanan, Isabela. She is 32 years old and married to Dennis, a security guard. They have been blessed with four children: the eldest is now in grade six and the other three are not yet studying. They live in the village of Barangcuag, Angadanan, Isabela where most of the residents are engaged in farming.  
	
She is requesting a loan of PHP18,000 from KIVA lenders as additional business capital for her fish vending business. Aside from this, she also sells vegetables for additional income. Victorina is doing her best to become successful in the business. She hopes that her loan will be granted so she can use it to expand her farm and be a big help in sustaining her family's necessities.

loans.use: Additional Business Capital

loans.name: Maria Juana

texts.es:
la sra. Maria Juana R. se dedica a la venta de mercaderias varias y prodcutos por catalogo de la marca VOGUE y AVON, vive en la colonia predios del Recreo, tiene 9 años de vivir en esa zona, tiene muchos clientes fijos ya que este tipo de productos en su mayoria solo dura un mes de uso, y casi todos los meses sus mismos clientes estan comprandole varias cosas. ahorita necesita el credito para comprar bikinis, blummers, calcetines, calzoncillos, sostenes y calcetas.
Maria viaja a El Salvador una vez al mes para comprar su mercaderia, esto ya que es mucho mas barato y de una calidad aceptable para sus clientes, asi mismo los fines de semana ella se convierte en cocinera y hace nacatamales los cuales los vende desde los viernes en la tarde (4:00pm hasta las 10:00pm) y los sabados los vende desde las 8:00am hasta las 11:00am.
Maria tiene todas las ganas de salir adelante, nos comento que se siente muy feliz porque todo le esta saliendo bien y espera que se mejore mucho mas. es agradable platicar con Maria.
texts.en:
Señora María Juana R. sells various products from catalogs for the brands Vogue and Avon. She lives in the district Predios del Recreo, where she has lived for 9 years. She has many regular customers since the type of products she sells for the most part only last for one month of use. Almost every month the same customers return to buy various items from her. María now needs a loan in order to purchase bikinis, bloomers, socks, underwear, brassieres, and stockings for her to sell. María travels to El Salvador once a month to buy her merchandise, as the goods there are much cheaper and of a quality acceptable to her customers. In the same spirit of hard work, María turns herself into a chef on the weekends, making nacatamales, which she sells on Friday nights from 4-10pm, and on Saturday mornings from 8-11am. María is very motivated to succeed, and she tells us that she feels very happy because things have been going well for her, and she hopes that they will continue to improve even more. It is very pleasant to chat with María.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: compra de cremas, shampoos, acondicionadores, lapices labiales, productos por catalogo, jeans, camisetas, blusas, batidoras electricas, tintes para cabello

loans.name: Habi

texts.en:
M. is a 47 year old widower who lives with his three children, aged 19, 17, and 11, in the Bayan-Ulgii province of western Mongolia. He and his three children live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His oldest son attends university, and the younger two children attend a local secondary school.

M. operates a raw materials business in his town where he sells iron, copper, aluminum and sheep and goat skins. He and his late wife started the business in 1995, but since his wife’s death last year, he has been working alone. M. works very hard to be able to provide his children with food and clothing, but he also wants to save enough money for his children’s tuition fees. He is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug (~700 USD) loan so that he can purchase not only sheep and goat skins for resale, but also coal for the winter in order to heat his family’s ger.

loans.use: To purchase sheep and goat skins for resale

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
Rene de ocupación chofer asalariado de la línea de Trufis 88, es soltero y vive en anticrítico con su señora Madre ubicado en la Zona de Tacagua.
 
El crédito lo destinara en incrementar su Anticretico así seguir viviendo en la misma Zona.

Es el primer crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada  califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Rene.
texts.en:
Rene is a salaried taxi driver for Trufi Route 88. He is single and lives in a rental property with his elderly mother in the district of Tacagua.

His loan will be used to extend his rental contract so that he can continue living in the same area. This is Rene’s first loan with IMPRO. His evaluation indicated that he is qualified for approval of this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Extend the contract of his housing rental

loans.name: Mireille Clarisse

texts.fr: G. Mireille Clarisse est née le 01 Décembre 1983 et est mariée à OUSSOUKPEVI Rodrigue, un commerçant. Le couple a un seul enfant qui est scolarisé. La famille vit ensemble au quartier Sènadé à Cotonou depuis bientôt neuf ans. Mireille Clarisse vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Mireille Clarisse a été à l’école jusqu’au secondaire. C’est depuis quatre ans que Mireille Clarisse vend des produits divers (riz, conserves, pâtes alimentaires, cigarettes, bonbons, biscuits, lait, savons, etc) et également des cartes de recharges téléphoniques à son domicile. Mireille Clarisse s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Mireille Clarisse sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, afin d’augmenter davantage le stock de produits et de satisfaire plus sa clientèle.
texts.en:
G. Mireille Clarisse was born on December 1, 1983 and is married to OUSSOUKPEVI Rodrigue, a merchant.  The couple has just one child who is in school.  The family has been living together for nine years in the Sènadé district in Cotonou.  She works in aid of her husband to provide for the family. Mireille Clarisse has attended class through secondary school.  For four years in her home, she has been selling a variety of goods (rice, canned foods, pasta, cigarettes, candy, cookies, milk, soaps, etc.) and also mobile phone recharge cards. She stocks up at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. This is the first time she's requesting a loan from ALIDé, so as to increase her inventory some more and to satisfy her customers further.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice, boxes of milk and soaps, and pasta

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria A. is from the village of Santa Rosa. She is 53 years old. Candelaria is single. To make a living, Candelaria runs a general store where she sells a variety of different products to the local community. Candelaria has been engaged in her business for several  years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Candelaria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Candelaria has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. Candelaria is requesting a new loan of PHP 20000, which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Candelaria from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Koeun

texts.en: Mrs. Koeun E. lives in Tuol Kandal village in Takeo province. She is a seller. Her husband, Mr. En Satha Vong, is a farmer who owns 3-hectar field of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, he is a construction worker. In his plantation, he faces an obstacle because he does not have enough money to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and to pay for plowing on the rice farming. Thus, Mrs. Koeun E. decided to request for a loan for this purpose. She is 25 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the other is too young to work or study. Her husband is presented in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides, and to pay for plowing on the rice farming.

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en: Crispina O. is from the village of Panalsalan. She is 35 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Crispina owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2004, Crispina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Crispina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Pon

texts.en:
Mrs. Pon M. lives in Kandal Kaoh Touch village in the Kandal province. She is 48 years old and the mother of five children, two of whom are construction workers while the others are studying at local public schools.

She and her husband, Mr. Nhor Oran, are farmers who own 1.2 hectares of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. In farming, they face a problem because they do not have enough money to buy vegetable seed, fertilizers, and fuel to pump the water necessary to support the field and make their crops more productive. Therefore, Mrs. Pon M. has decided to apply for a loan for these purchases.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seed, fertilizers, and fuel for farming

loans.name: Luisa Amanda

texts.es: Doña Luisa es madre de familia de tres hermosos hijos, junto con su esposo han forjado un pequeño negocio la venta de productos plásticos el cual llevan varios años en ventas, compran en el mercado oriental por docenas a bajo precios y luego lo venden a un mejor precio. Poco a poco han ido haciendo las mejoras con los financiamientos que la institución ha dado y se siente contenta por estos beneficios, de mejorar su casa. Con su crédito anterior logro cerrar con maya su terreno para una mejor seguridad. Y con este préstamo desea poder construir un servicio higiénico ya que lo que tiene es una letrina ya muy vieja y por falta de dinero no había construido lo cual es de mucha necesidad para una mejor higiene de su familia. Comprara: bloques, cemento, arena, y un inodoro, tubo, pvc para hacer las conexiones del inodoro y comenzar hacer la obra. Esta contenta por este objetivo mas que hace para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Luisa is the mother of three beautiful children. Together with her husband, she has set up a small business selling plastic items. They have been in this line of work for several years. They buy at Oriental market by the dozen at low prices and then resell at a better price. Gradually, they have used loans from the institution to do home repairs. She is very happy with these improvements. She used her previous loan to fence in her property thus making it more secure. She will use this loan to build a bathroom because what she has now is a very old latrine and she didn't have funds before to do this. Having a proper toilet is vital for her family's hygiene. She will buy concrete blocks, cement, sand, a toilet and pvc tubing to connect it. She is happy with this goal because it will greatly benefit her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy concrete blocks, cement, sand, a toilet, pvc tubing to connect the toilet, and start the project.

loans.name: Gemalyn

texts.en:
Gemalyn D., 22 years old, has a fish-selling business. She has two children with the oldest being 2 years old. She desires to improve her livelihood so that she is able to save money to support the education of her children in the future. 

Gemalyn would like to ask for a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy an additional pump boat to be used in fishing.

loans.use: To buy an additional pumpboat

loans.name: Angel Segundo

texts.es:
Ángel Segundo Ramírez A. tiene 40 años, es casado, y  tiene cuatro hijos.  Vive en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia de Bolívar.

El socio es  miembro de la ventanilla rural Grupo Enmanuel es un recinto que se encuentra a cuarenta y cinco minutos del Cantón Guaranda capital de la Provincia de Bolívar.  Son 17 socios en total, es una comunidad Agrícola y Ganadera son indígenas hablan Quechua en su totalidad 
Ángel trabaja en la agricultura para incrementar la economía de la familia.  Los cultivos que más sobresalen son papas, arveja, maíz, además se dedica a la cría animales en la casa como gallinas, borregos y chanchos los productos vende en la casa y lo que siembra vende en el mercado mayorista de Guaranda.

La cultura principal es el carnaval que se celebra todos los años en febrero.  También, a Ángel le gusta caminar.

El socio solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para el trabajo del campo y sobre todo para fertilizantes y abonos.  Su meta es tener una buena actividad económica para la familia.  Los desafíos que enfrenta son los problemas climáticos y las enfermedades que afectan a los cultivos.
texts.en:
Ángel Segundo Ramírez A. is 40 years old, is married and has 4 children. He lives in the area of Guaranda in the province of Bolívar.

The member is part of a small rural Group Enmanuel; it is in an area some 45 minutes from, Cantón Guaranda, capital of the province of Bolívar. There are 17 members in total, it is in a farming and cattle community, they are indigenous and all speak Quechua. Ángel works in agriculture to increase the household earnings. The crops that he mostly grows are potatoes, green peas and corn. Moreover, he breeds animals in his home like chickens, lambs, and pigs. Some products he sells at home and what he grows he sells in to the wholesaler market of Guaranda.

The main culture is the carnival that is celebrated every year in February. Ángel also enjoys walking.

The member needs the loan to invest in his field work, mostly to buy fertilizers and manure. His goal is to have a good source of income for his family. The problems that he has to face are climate related and the diseases that hurt his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and manure.

loans.name: María Lilliam

texts.es:
La señora María Lilliam B. R., es trabajadora de la escuela Marcos Dessys de Chinandega es maestra de primaria y habita en el Reparto jirón, tiene  dos hijos los cuales dependen de ella y de su esposo.

La señora María Lilliam B. R. solicito el crédito para terminar de reparar su casa ya que tiene las puertas en espera y tiene su Baño
texts.en:
María Lilliam B. R. works at the Marcos Dessys de Chinandega School. She is a primary teacher and lives in the Reparto jirón. She and her husband look after their two children.

María Lilliam B. R. is asking for this loan to finish repair work on her house as they have doors on hold and need to work on the bathroom.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy doors and improve their bathroom

loans.name: Koffi Sénam

texts.fr: Ce monsieur a 34 ans, il vit dans le quartier d’agoé téléssou qui est un quartier périphérique de Lomé avec sa femme et son enfant. Il exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce en détail de produits d’entretien et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé,il fait son commerce de façon ambulante. sa clientèle est composée de toutes personnes. Il exerce ce commerce depuis 2005. Son stock est en baisse, il veut se réapprovisionne et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de divers produits d’entretien.
texts.en:
This gentleman is 34 years old and lives with his wife and child in the Agoé Téléssou neighborhood, which lies in the outskirts of Lomé. He has a revenue generating activity retailing cleaning products and gets his supplies at the large market in Lomé. He sells his products on a door-to-door basis. His customer base is made up of all sorts of people. He has been carrying out this activity since 2005. His stock is declining and he would like to get fresh supplies; he is therefore requesting a loan from WAGES for the purchase of various cleaning products.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cleaning products

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda tiene 34 años de edad, es soltera y madre de tres hijos. Vive en la localidad de Pichari, ubicada en la hermosa selva del Cuzco, donde tiene su casa propia.

Recuerda que en la época de los 80’, cuando el terrorismo causaba pánico en su comunidad, no tenían ni para comer. Ella pensaba que su vida iba ser llena de sufrimientos y cuando después se separó de su esposo todo le iba mal, pero recibió el apoyo de su familia en los momentos más difíciles. En el presente tiene dos negocios: una tienda de abarrotes y una de venta de repuestos para carros. En efecto, agradece eternamente a sus padres por el apoyo incondicional que lo dieron. Es por ello, que siempre se levanta muy temprano y atiende de las 5:30 AM hasta las 9:00 PM. Ahora que sus ventas están creciendo aspira a otras cosas, como implementar sus dos negocios, incrementar su clientela y mejorar sus ganancias.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a cumplir con sus respectivos pagos. Con el dinero solicitado piensa invertir en adquirir más productos de primera necesidad para su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 34 years old; she is single and a mother to three children. He lives in the Pichari neighborhood located in the beautiful Cuzco jungle where she has her own home.

She remembers the 80s, where terrorism caused panic in her community, they didn’t even have food to eat. Yolanda thought that her life was going to be filled with suffering and when she separated from her husband everything went wrong but she received the support of her family in the most difficult moments. At present, she has two businesses, a small grocery store and she also sells spare parts for cars. She is eternally grateful to her parents for the unconditional support that they gave her, it is because of them that she wakes up really early and works from 5:30 AM to 9:00 PM. Now her sales are growing and she aspires for new things like: working on her two businesses, increasing the number of customers and improving her earnings.

This is her first loan with MFP (Kiva’s field partner) and she is committed to meeting her respective payments. With the money, she will buy more basic household goods for her small grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase merchandize.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel es socia del Banco Comunal Kallpanchik palabra en quechua que significa Nuestra Fuerza. Maribel es casada, tiene 33 años y 5 hijos.
Maribel tiene una tienda en un local alquilado en donde vende discos, CD, actividad que realiza todos los días junto a su esposo. Además Maribel vende ropa.
Maribel necesita un préstamo de 900 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de discos. Maribel sueña con ampliar su negocio y dividirlo a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maribel is a member of the Kallpanchik (a word that means “Our Strength” in the Quechua language) communal bank. She is 33 years old, married and has five children. Maribel has a store in a rented location, where she sells records and CDs. She does this every day alongside her husband. She also sells clothing. Maribel needs a loan of 900 PEN ($325) which she will use to buy records. She hopes to be able to expand her business and divide it up among her children.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: CDs and Records

loans.name: Coumba

texts.fr: Madame Coumba D., née en 1966 est vendeuse de légumes depuis plus de 20 ans. C'était depuis qu'elle a rejoint le domicile conjugal sis à Notto, que Madame Coumba D. s'est lancée dans cette activité dominatrice dans la zone où la culture maraîchère  constitue le secteur le plus prisé. Cependant elle sollicitait un prêt de 50 000 FCFA pour renforcer son business. Ainsi avec cet investissement elle verra son travail se développé et pourra soutenir son mari et prendre en charge la scolarité de son enfant qui étudie actuellement dans la ville de Mboro située à plus de 50 Kms de Thiès.
texts.en:
Mrs. Columba D., born in 1966, has been selling vegetables for over 20 years. Ever since she came to live with her husband in Notto, she has been working in this line of business, very prominent in this region as vegetable gardening is one of the main activities here. And thus she is seeking a loan of 50,000 West African Franks to bolster her business. With this investment, her business would be strengthened and she could help her husband as well as take care of the school fees of her child, who know studies in the town of Mboro, 50 km [30 miles] from Thiès.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthening her business

loans.name: Lang

texts.en: Lang T. N. was born in 1962. She lives in Xuan Non village. She has two children: a daughter and a son. Her husband is a contractor. She grows rice and raises chicken.  She has a monthly income of about 4,000,000 VND. She has participated in SEDA since 2003 and repaid punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,066,000 VND to buy chicken feed.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married with two children. She sells clothing at the central market in Ivano-Frankivsk town. Ludmila started this business eight years ago. She used to work as a salesperson for her sister and then decided to start her own business. She enjoys selling clothing and has plans to develop her business further. Her goal is to start one more location at the same market. This business is the main source of income for Larisa's family.

Ludmila would like to borrow 6,500 UAH to increase her assortment. She hopes to receive additional income and finish remodeling in her house.

loans.use: To increase the assortment

loans.name: Julio Fernando

texts.es:
Julio Fernando V. S. tiene 67 años. Es divorciado vive con la mama y con la hija, Amada, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. 

Julio  es un socio de la ventanilla rural Rey de Reyes, que está ubicada a hora y media de Chillanes. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Julio  se dedica a la siembra de arroz maíz y cacao. Realiza sus compras cada mes en Bucay y las vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en semillas para sus cultivos de arroz, maíz y cacao. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener riego en sus cultivos sobre todo en la de cacao. Enfrenta desafíos son el clima.

Le gusta podar y curar las enfermedades de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Julio Fernando V. S. is 67 years old. He is divorced and lives with his mother and his daughter. He lives in the cantón of Chillanes in the Bolívar province. Julio is a member of the “Rey de Reyes” (King of Kings) communal bank, which is located an hour and a half from Chillanes. There are 23 members in total, most of whom are farmers. This is the first loan they will have borrowed from Cooperativa San José. Julio plants rice, corn, and cacao. He makes his purchases in Bucay every month and that is also where he sells his crops. He is requesting the loan to buy seed to plant his rice, corn, and cacao crops. He thinks the loan is an opportunity to get ahead. His dream is have irrigation for his crops, especially for his cacao; he faces challenges caused by the weather. He likes to prune his crops and treat their diseases.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase seeds for his rice, corn, and cacao crops

loans.name: Rosa Carmita

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa Carmita Fernández es socia del banco comunal Barrio Sucre, vive en la comunidad de Amarillo en la parroquia de Cumbe,  la mayor parte de su población se dedica a la cría de animales en especial ganado, obteniendo la leche para vender y para elaborar  quesos, también se dedican a la agricultura y mucha de su población joven ha migrado en busca de un mejor futuro para sus familias.

La Señora. Rosa Carmita tiene de 36 años, es casada  y tiene2 hijos de 16 y 3 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en el colegio, su esposo trabaja como albañil y gracias al trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.
 
Nuestra socia es comerciante de granos y verduras actividad que la realiza hace 24 años, labora en el mercado feria libre, cuenta con un puesto propio y trabaja todos los días.

Se encuentra en su tercer ciclo  realizando los créditos en la fundación, fue invitada por su hermana a formar parte de este gran grupo de mujeres luchadoras y emprendedoras, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de hortalizas y así seguir creciendo en su negocio, su meta es  comprar un vehiculo para trasladarse a su trabajo.
texts.en:
Rosa Carmita Fernández is a member of Barrio Sucre community bank. She lives in the community of Amarillo in the parrish of Cumbe. The majority of the population there raises livestock, farms, and makes cheese from cow's milk. Many people from the younger generations have left the area in search of a better future for their families. Rosa Carmita is 36 years old, married, and has 2 children, ages 16 and 3. Her older daughter is in secondary school and her husband works in construction. Thanks to the couple's hard work, the family has been able to build their own house. Our member sells grains and vegetables, an activity she has done for 24 years. She works everyday in her own stall in the open-air market. This is her 3rd loan cycle in the foundation. Rosa Carmita was invited by her sister to join a group of hardworking, entrepreneurial women. This loan will be invested in the purchase of vegetables so that her business can grow. Her goal is to eventually buy a car that she can use to get to work.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of vegetables

loans.name: Akenese

texts.en:
Akenese U. is 48 and married with six children.  She owns a business venture, selling ice-cakes (flavored ice in styrofoam cups).  Akenese has 3 years of experience in this business.  Akenese needs a loan of WST 2900 to buy sugar, styrofoam cups, and cordial (flavoring).  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US $250 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2007, Akenese joined SPBD.    This is her 4th loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Akenese's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD. 

http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to buy sugar, styrofoam cups, and cordial (flavoring)

loans.name: Channa

texts.en:
Mr. Channa H., 23, and his wife, Mrs. Sros Dam, 23, live in a small village along National Road Number Three about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2005 and have two children: one son and one daughter. His wife is a garment factory worker.
 
Channa has been producing jars for nine years. He produces jars at his home and transports them to sell in the nearby village and other provinces. He is applying for his first loan of $600 to buy a motorcycle to pull a trailer carrying jars for sale.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to pull a trailer carrying jars for sale

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata”; El banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Yuncaypata, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Basilia; ella tiene 43 años de edad y es casada  y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio de venta de productos secos como moraya, trigo, quinua y maíz, ella vende en el mercado de Huancaro desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m y también tiene un pequeño de terreno de cultivo, la socia quiere tener una tienda donde pueda vender los productos secos.  La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar producto secos al por mayor y también poder comprar semillas para su terreno de cultivo. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata communal bank. The bank is located in the community of Yuncaypata, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

Basilia is 43 years old, married, and has 4 children. She alternates her daily activities with her business selling dried products such as moraya (a freeze-dried potato product), wheat, quinoa and corn. She works selling in the Huancaro market from 6am to 5pm, and she also has a small piece of farmland. Basilia wants to have a store where she can sell her dried products. She is requesting the loan to buy dried products at wholesale and also to purchase seeds for her land.

Basilia is grateful for everyone who has made this dream possible and she promises to make her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase dried products at wholesale and also to purchase seeds for her land.

loans.name: Ana Mae

texts.en:
Ana Mae L. is from the village of Angga-an, Damulog, Bukidnon. She is 20 years old. Ana Mae is married and has one infant child. Ana Mae owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Ana Mae has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2010, Ana Mae joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Ana Mae is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ana Mae from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Augustus  Boisie

texts.en:
This is 48-year-old Augustus.  He is married and has no children.   He has three additional dependents, who live with him because one is in college and the other two are in secondary school and they need support from him. 

In the year 2000, Augustus began making soap from locally produced products. He began his business when he lost his job and believed doing the soap business could be a good source of income for him. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 826,400 SLL every month from this business. He needs a loan of 3,000,000 SLL.

 Augustus requires a loan in order to buy palm oil and caustic soda to produce more soap. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 157,016 SLL.He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more palm oil and caustic soda for soap production

loans.name: Chirine

texts.ar:
شيرين في عمر ال 25 سنة تعمل في مجال السكرتيريا وهي اكبر اخوتها غير متزوجة                                                 
 تحب عائلتها واخوتها كثيرا تساعد اثنان من اخوتها طموحة وتحب التجدد في العمل والانتاج                                     
تسعى الى تحسين وضها الاجتماعي وهي تطلب قرض من المجموعة بهدف  تعليم الأخ الاصغر منها                                       
وهو يحلم بأن يصبح طيار وايضا تعليم الاخت الاصغر ,                                                                    ودفع قسطها المدرسي شيرين تلقى دعم كبير من محيطها فهي محبوبة  من جميع افراد عائلتها ومحيطها العملي
texts.en: Chirine is a 25-year-old single woman who, in her work as a secretary, strives to always be dynamic and productive. She receives considerable support from her family members and co-workers, and in turn very much loves her family and siblings, of whom she is the eldest. In order to help two of her siblings achieve their dreams, Chirine is asking for a loan from Al-Majmoua to help with the tuition of her younger brother who aspires to become an aviator as well as of her younger sister.

loans.use: Education of younger brother and sister.

loans.name: Kirehe Kwetungura Group B-Kihihi

texts.en: K. Jackline, 28, has been in the retailing business for the last three years in Kirehe-Kihihi. In her shop she sells a variety of general merchandise retail items such as sugar, salt and beans. Her clientele base mostly consists of local people within her village. What spawned her interest in this business was the fact that there was growing demand in her area for retail shops that sold items at affordable prices. Prior to this, her inclination was more into farming. On a monthly basis, this business brings her 120,000 KES as profits. With this loan, Jackline, who is a married mother with three kids, says she is going to procure more retail commodities for resale at her shop. She belongs to Kirehe Kwetungura group-Kihihi.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Sadraddin

texts.ru:
Sadraddin M. 56 let. On jenat imeyet 3 detey , dva iz kotorix uchatsya v kolledje a odin v shkole. Sadraddin yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda i seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy kotoruyu on ochen lubit i delayet vse dlya nix.

On uje 1,5 qoda kak nachal zanimatsya skotovodstvom , Rasnshe on imel magazin no iz za toqo chto maqazin naxodilsya daleko ot yeqo doma i on pravodil tam mnoqo vremeni on reshil zanatsya skotovodstvom chtobi bit blije k svoyey semye. Eto uje vtoraya ssuda Sadraddina on v perviy raz bral 1000 $ i ochen blagodaren lenderam,seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya razvitiya svoyeqo biznessa u uvilicheniya kolichestvo molochnix produktov dlya prodaji sosedam i maqazinam. 

http://partners.kiva.org/lend/52380
texts.en:
Sadraddin M. is 56 years old. He is married and has three children, two of whom are in college and one is in high school. Sadraddin is an Internally Displaced Person, a refugree from the town of Fuzuli now living in the Fuzuli Region together with his family. He loves his family very much does everything for them.

For about 1.5 years he has been raising animals. In the past he used to run a store but, since the store was located far from his home and he spent a lot of time there, he decided to start raising animals in order to be closer to his family. This is Sadraddin’s second loan. The first time he borrowed $1000. He is very grateful to the lenders. At present he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy a cow for growing his business further and increasing the volume of milk products he can sell to his neighbors and to retail stores.

loans.use: Purchasing a cow

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius C., age 45, runs a sugarcane wholesale business at Shauri Moyo estate. His customers are small-scale buyers who sell in the streets and to traveling passengers. He is married to Peninah and together they have two children, Carol, age 17, and Peter, age 14. Julius was introduced to KADET by other KADET clients.

Julius has been running this business for a period of 5 years and his monthly profit is 18,000 Kenyan shillings. This loan of 70,000 Kenyan shillings is Julius’ fourth loan with KADET. He plans to buy two lorries of sugarcane for his wholesale business. If the loan boosts the business, Julius will add more stock and provide better living standards for his family. He will also pay school fees for his children.

Julius dreams of getting tenders from sugar mills. He describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: To buy two lorries of sugarcane for his wholesale business.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Solidaridad Cachimayo” cooperative bank, which is located in the Cachimayo district of the province of Chinceros.

Her name is Luz Marina, and she is 35 years old.  Luz Marina has a common law husband and two children.  She is requesting the loan for her and her husband´s carpentry business.  They make furniture, doors, and tables (along with anything else you can think of out of wood) to order and sell them from their home in Cachimayo.  She has been a client of Arariwa for 10 years. 

Luz Marina commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: To invest in a carpentry business

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: M. kODJO est née le 17 Aout 1977 à Tsevie. Il habite Akodessewa ou il exerce son activité. il est marraichage de profession et a débuté cette activité depuis 2000. Il s'approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et reevend les légumes sur le boulevard mobutu sesses seko. Il a quatre apprentis qui l'aident dans ses tâches. Pour aggrandir son activité, il sollicite un prêt au près de WAGES.
texts.en: Mr. Kodjo was born on August 17, 1977 in Tsevie. He lives and works in Akodessewa. He is a vegetable farmer he has been doing this work since 2000. he stocks up at the big market in Lomé and resells his vegetables at the Mobutu Sesses Seko boulevard. He has four apprentices who help him out. In order to expand his business, he is seeking a loan from WAGES.

loans.use: Pruchasing seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Christian

texts.es:
El Sr. Cristhian es de Carapeguá, tiene 30 años y actualmente  es soltero.
El Sr. Cristhian es carpintero, cuenta con local propio donde elabora los trabajos para sus clientes. Cabe destacar que es un profesional con una antigüedad de más de 10 años.
Aprendió a ser un profesional en dicho trabajo gracias a su padre, quien se desempeñaba como carpintero anteriormente. Hoy día dejó de trabajar por la elevada edad.
Solicita el préstamo para compra de activo fijo (herramientas).
texts.en: Cristhian is from Carapegua. He is 30 years old and he is single. Cristhian is a carpenter and he has his own shop from where to work on projects for his clients.  It should be noted that he is a professional with more than 10 years' experience. He learned his trade from his father who previously worked as a carpenter.  He doesn't work anymore given his advanced age. He requests a loan to purchase tools for his trade.

loans.use: To purchase tools.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie M. is from the village of Tupsan, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 42 years old. Rosalie is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalie owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods & toothpaste in the local community. Rosalie has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Rosalie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalie is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like snack foods & canned goods. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Rosalie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like snack foods & canned goods

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a single woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent bills.

She has operated a café business for the past seven years.   Local residents are the potential customers. Martha faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in her business. She hopes to expand her business and establish a restaurant business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase cutlery to improve her café. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase cutlery to improve her café.

loans.name: Emmah

texts.en:
Emmah is married and lives with her husband and five children; three are her own while two are adopted. They live in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees, food and rent bills. 

Emmah has operated a stationery and office supplies shop for the last seven years, selling in a shop to local residents. Emmah faces a challenge of competition from similar operators in her location. She dreams of expanding and establishing another shop in the future. Emmah plans to use this KES 50,000 loan to purchase a laser jet printer and stationery. Emmah decided to join Yehu because of the availability of sustainable financial services to esteemed customers.

loans.use: to purchase a laser jet printer and stationery

loans.name: Gulzar

texts.en:
Gulzar A. is a loving mother of four sons. She dedicated her life to her children and after they grew up, when the eldest son was 34, she decided to start her own business. Gulzar loved flowers from childhood and has a huge garden where she raises her flowers. She knows everything about flora, how to raise, how to water and other methods to keep her flowers blossoming. 

When she was left alone with her small pension, she started selling different flower roots to neighbors and relatives, and after time it became so popular that Gulzar started raising different sorts of flowers in her front room in separate pots. Now she is two years in this business and she is very happy that she can earn from what she enjoys.

Gulzar applied for a loan to purchase more seeds and flowerpots to raise her beautiful flowers, and she hopes she can increase her monthly turnover with this loan.

loans.use: purchase seeds and flowerpots

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol is married with four children, and works hard to support her family.

She has a tricycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from ready-to-wear clothing.  Mirasol is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase new tools and equipment for her tricycle transport business.

Mirasol has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: To purchase new tools and equipment

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul A. is 30 years old and married. His wife is a farmer and they have a son aged one, to whom they hope to give a good education up to university level.
Paul's business is located at the busy Juakali Market in Nairobi. He makes and sells items such as steel doors, metal boxes and cookers. He serves the local people. He has been in this business for five years now. Paul says that his business is profitable, but a major challenge is financial constraints. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He will use his loan of 30,000 KES to buy scrap metal to expand his business. He hopes to grow his business and eventually open another metal shop. He describes himself as aggressive and committed to his work.

loans.use: to purchase scrap metal.

loans.name: Willy

texts.es: El señor Willy es chofer independiente y trabaja con su minibús en transporte de pasajeros. El crédito lo requiere para comprar repuestos para su vehiculo y el cambio de llantas. Vive en casa de sus padres la misma esta ubicada en la zona de Mariscal Sucre en la ciudad de El Alto;  es casado y tiene tres hijos. Esta es la segunda vez que su préstamo es canalizado a través de Kiva.
texts.en: Willy is an independent driver and he works with a passenger mini-bus. He needs a loan to purchase spare parts for his vehicle and to purchase new tires. He lives in his parents' house and it is located in the region of Mariscal Sucre in the city of El Alto. He is married and he has 3 children. This is the second time he has accessed a loan through Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and new tires for his minibus.

loans.name: Begg Sa Yaay Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Begg Sa Yaay est créé le 12 mai 2010; il est composé de neuf femmes qui sont parentes et habitent le même quartier; leur principale activité est le petit commerce.



Madame Anta la responsable du groupe est âgée de 64 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de dix enfants en charge dont trois petits enfants. 

Elle possède une boutique où elle vend divers produits et du pain que lui fourni une boulangerie de la place; elle mène cette activité depuis 40 ans et fait aussi de l'embouche.Sur la photo elle est debout à droite habillée en boubou jaune bleu et couverte d'un châle noir.


Elle souhaite avec son prêt acheter de la marchandise et des moutons pour renforcer ses activités.



Avec ses bénéfices elle compte soutenir ses enfants pour leur réussite sociale.
texts.en: The solidarity group Begg Sa Yaay was created on May 12, 2010; it is comprised of nine women who are parents living in the same district. Their main occupation is small-scale commerce. Ms. Anta, the group's official, is 64 years old, married, and the mother of ten children to support. They include three grandchildren. She has a shop where she sells a variety of goods and bread, which is provided by a local bakery; she has been in this business for forty years. She also fattens livestock. Anta is the one standing in the photo at the right; she is dressed in a yellow and blue boubou and wrapped in a black shawl. Anta would like to use her loan to buy some merchandise and a few heads of sheep for bolstering her work. With the profits, she intends to support her children for their success in society.

loans.use: to buy various foods and some bread to be sold

loans.name: Clara Luz

texts.es:
La Señora. Clara es socia del banco comunal Nuevos Horizontes, vive por el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es reconocida por la belleza de sus paisajes, su centro colonial, su cultura, tradiciones, gastronomía y su gente.
 
La Señora. Clara tiene 69 años, es madre soltera  de 3 hijas que son mayores de edad y casadas, vive con una de sus hijas con quien comparte los gastos del hogar. También cuida de su pequeña nieta de 10 años quien es huérfana. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Doña Clara es comerciante ambulante y constantemente viaja a diferentes lugares para traer su mercadería, ella vende ropa, cobijas, sabanas, platos, tazas, cubiertos, etc. En este negocio lleva 30 años.

Lleva 12 años en el banco comunal  y está muy contenta de pertenecer a ella ya que los créditos le han beneficiado para crecer en su negocio, su nuevo crédito lo va  a invertir en la compra de ropa, cobijas, sabanas, platos, tazas, cubiertos, etc. para la venta.

Su meta es crecer más en su negocio.
texts.en:
Señora. Clara is a member of the communal bank, Nuevos Horizontes ("New Horizons").  She lives in the city center of Cuenca, a city known for its beautiful landscape, colonial city center, culture, tradition, gatronomy, and people.  She is 69 years old and a single mother of 3 daughters, all of whom are married.  She lives with one of her daughters with whom she shares the household costs.  She also cares for her granddaughter of 10 years old, who is an orphan.  She does not own her home, but rents it.

Señora Clara is a vendor and is constantly traveling to different places, carrying her merchandise with her to sell.  She sells clothes, covers, sheets, plates, mugs, utensils, etc.  She has been working in this line of business for over 30 years.

She has been a member of this communal bank for over 12 years.  She is very happy to be a part of it since the credits have benefited the growth of her business.  She plans to invest her new credit in the purchase of clothes, covers, sheets, plates, mugs, utensils, etc. that she could then sell.  Her goal is to grow her business.

loans.use: purchase clothes, covers, sheets, plates, mugs, utensils, etc.

loans.name: Mariana Mercedes

texts.es:
Mariana Mercedes tiene 39 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama VRC SAN FRANCISCO DE SIBIMBE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Sibimbe, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta  ventanilla tiene 20socio los cuales se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembran maíz y arroz.

Mariana se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es trabajar para tener dinero y dar todo lo que necesitan a los hijos.

Le gusta leer y limpiar la casa.
texts.en:
Mariana Mercedes is 39 years old and married. She lives with her husband and children in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

The Communal Bank “San Francisco de Sibimbe” is located in the neighborhood of Recinto Sibimbe in the canton of Ventanas. This Communal Bank has 20 members who engage in short-cycle farming. They grow corn and rice.

Mariana is a farmer who grows corn and rice. She buys her supplies in Ventanas each month and then sells her products at the fair in the same location.

Mariana is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, and compost. With the financial assistance provided through this loan, she will be able to acquire needed supplies. Her dream is to have money so that she can provide her children everything they need.

Mariana enjoys reading and cleaning house.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and compost.

loans.name: Inobat

texts.ru: Инобат проживает в городе Душанбе. Она разведена. У неё один маленький ребенок. Она имеет среднее образование. Более двух лет Инобат арендует салон и занимается услугой парикмахера. Кредит берет для покупки настенного зеркала и кресло для салона красоты.
texts.en: Inobat lives in Dushanbe.  She is divorced and has one small child.  She has a secondary education.  For more than two years, Inobat has rented a salon and worked as a beautician.  She is taking out a loan to buy a wall mirror and a chair to decorate the salon.

loans.use: to buy a wall mirror and a chair

loans.name: Shida

texts.en:
Shida is a married man with five children, three boys and two girls. He lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food, clothing and school fees.

For the past two years, he has operated a café business, selling cooked food such as beans, rice and chapati (flat bread) to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of competition from other café operators in the future.

With the KES 20,000 loan, he wants to purchase furniture for his café business, chairs and tables. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase chairs and tables for his café

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy manure for his maize and chilies crops.

loans.name: Agness

texts.en:
Agness is 35 years old and married with six children. Two of the children are in school. She has a business selling mandasi (a donut-like pastry) in Jigomoni Branch in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for five years.

Agness requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She says that she will use the extra income from this losan to buy grinding machines in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil and ngano flour to make mandazi to sell

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is 34 years old and married with five children between the ages of four and fourteen years.  She has been running her grocery store for the last seven months and has been making a monthly profit of KES 6,000.  

She has been loaned KES 10,000, which she plans to use to purchase kale, onions, potatoes, tomatoes, vegetables, and fruits to add to her stock.

With the anticipated profit, she plans to become a fruit vendor in Lukenya.  In the near future, she hopes to start supplying fruits and vegetables beyond Lukenya and its surrounding area.

loans.use: To purchase kale, onions, potatoes, tomatoes, vegetables, and fruits to add to her stock.

loans.name: Guerlita

texts.en:
Guerlita is 60 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family by running a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP through Kiva partner, NWTF, to buy more items to sell in her store.
Guerlita has borrowed and paid back 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 18 years and also earns an income from trisikad transport and raising carabao.
Guerlita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Mayemi

texts.es: Mayemi tiene 21 años, esta casada con Donato de 25 años, con quien tiene 1 hijo. Juntos habitan en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad de Nueva Fortaleza, Pichari. Ella se destaca por ser una gran mujer emprendedora, que se dedica al trabajo en la agricultura cultivando cacao y café que son productos que están teniendo una buena demanda en el mercado nacional e internacional. Esto es debido a la dedicación y la constante aplicacion de fertilizantes, que han hecho que su producto sea de calidad. Siendo al final llevados a los centros acopiadores del distrito de Pichari, obteniendo ganancias considerables. En esta labor es su esposo quien más la apoya, y en ocasiones sus peones, sin embargo le falta capital para contratar personal que lo apoyen en la cosecha, por lo que al final sus frutos se quedan sin ser cosechados. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, por el que ella se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,000 soles que solicita, contratar personal para que extraiga la maleza de entre sus plantas.
texts.en:
Mayemi is 21 years old and married to Donato who is 25.  They have one child.  The family live together in their own home which is located in Nueva Fortaleza community, in Pichari.  Mayemi stands out as being a great, entrepreneurial woman who works in agriculture, growing cacao and coffee, which are products that are in good demand on both the national and international market.  This is due to her dedication and the constant application of fertilizers which have made her products good-quality ones.  When she finally takes them to the storage warehouses in Pichari district, she makes considerable profits.  Her husband is the one who supports her the most in this work and she has occasional support from her laborers.  However, she lacks capital with which to hire workers to support her in her harvesting which means that her fruit do not get harvested.

This will be Mayemi's first loan from MFP and she pledges to make her repayments on time.  She will use the 1,000 soles that she has requested to hire workers to get rid of the weeds that grow between her plants.

loans.use: to hire laborers

loans.name: Sinon

texts.en:
Sinon, pictured with her loom, is a silk weaver and her husband, Phan, is a motor taxi driver. They have been married since 1980 and have six children: two sons and four daughters. Four of their children are married and live in separate homes and the other two attend school. The family lives in a village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  

Sinon is requesting another 300 USD loan to buy silk material. She hopes to continue her tradional weaving business.

loans.use: to buy silk for her weaving business

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 42 years old. She is married with one child.

Imelda  has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 15,000 Philippines pesos to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Imelda  has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Imelda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional snacks and other items for the store.

loans.name: Duterimbere/kzr Group

texts.fr:
Zachée fait partie du groupe Duterimbere/Kzr. Le nom du groupe signifie « avançons en avant». Il a 38 ans et il est marié avec 5 enfants de 3 à 12 ans, dont 3 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est  6 ans de primaire.

Zachée est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser des semences de la race améliore du riz. Dans les prochaines années, Zachée voudrait agrandir la surface de culture du riz. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et soigne ses enfants.
texts.en:
Zachée is part of the group Duterimbere/Kzr. The name means something like "forging ahead with progress". He is 38 years old, married and has 5 children between the ages of 3 and 12, 3 are in school. He finished 6 years of elementary school.

He is a rice farmer. This is his first round of financing with ACB. He is going to use the loan to purchase chemical fertilizers for his rice crops.

His strategy for business growth is to use the best type of rice seeds. In the next few years, he would like to increase his arable land for growing rice. With his profits, he intends to educate and take care of his children.

loans.use: to purchase chemical fertilizer for his rice crops

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 52 years old and lives in Silang Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Narciso, a farmer, and a mother to their two children. Both are already working. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Nida makes a living by selling ornamental plants. She grows ornamental plants that are native to the Philippines like ylang-ylang, golden shower, dahlias and orchids. Her regular customers are local tourists, neighbours and the community. She’s been twenty-one years in this business. And she earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is applying for a loan of Php 17,000. She will be using the money to buy things needed for planting such as plastics, fertilizer, pots, seedlings, and wires. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Nida hopes her business will continue to succeed in the coming years and dreams of traveling abroad with her family .As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can draw strength and inspiration from the word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for gardening materials and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is 45 years old and married with two children. She is from Catadman, Ozamis City. 

To earn a living, Winnie owns and operates a business venture, making and selling banana cue (a banana sweet) in the local community. Winnie has been in her business for three years, and she earns 4,000 PHP a month. Winnie is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase more bananas to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

Winnie joined GDMPC in 2011 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. This will be the first loan taken out by Winnie from GDMPC.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with two children.

Carmencita has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, noodles, and spices. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and spices.

Carmencita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, snacks, and spices.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with one child. 

Jocelyn is providing motorcycle or habal-habal services. She hires someone to drive the bicycle & has an arrangement on how to divide the income. She has had this business for eight years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the service.

Jocelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools & gasoline

loans.name: Zil-E-Huma's Group

texts.en:
Zil-e-Huma is requesting a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband’s plastic bottle making business. 
With the loan investment, he will buy raw materials used in making plastic bottles in larger quantities. He supplies these bottles to different shops.
Zil-e-Huma is a seamstress and supports her husband financially by sewing clothes for her neighboring clients.
Zil-e-Huma is a very confident lady and has a lot of trust in her husband who has been operating his business for many years and has a good number of business contacts. Zil-e-Huma is very sure that he will get more success in his business after making this investment.
Note:"In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Zil-e-Huma."

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her business making and selling plastic bottles.

loans.name: Jennie

texts.en:
Jennie, a 20-year-old married mother of one, works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a sari-sari store in the Philippines for four years and also earns an income from retailing rice.

Having borrowed and repaid six previous loans from NWTF, Jennie is now requesting a new loan for PHP 20000 to purchase more store stock to sell. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more store stock to sell.

loans.name: Benkadi 5 Group

texts.fr:
Composé de femmes mariées, les 4 membres du groupe  BENKADI 5 de Donfana, vivent dans des familles traditionnelles  avec en moyenne 22 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes Donfana qui est un village du cercle de Kolondièba et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de mariage. Elles mènent toutes une activité hivernale à savoir la culture céréalière. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs productions, les membres du groupe  ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur  8 ème prêt.
Mariam, qui est la seule assise,  compte  utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des semences d’arachide, des engrais, des herbicides et payer le labour et sarclage pour son champ ayant une superficie de  hectare. Elle espère produire  tonne d’arachide et 1 tonne de riz et envisage réaliser 180.000FCFA de bénéfice avec cette production destinée à la vente aux revendeurs venant des grandes ville. Le bénéfice ainsi obtenu permettra de rembourser le prêt, constituer les trousseaux des jeunes filles pour leur mariage  et prendre en charge certains besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The group "BENKADI 5 de Donfana" is composed of married women living in traditional families and averaging 22  years of age and two children each. The women all live in Donfana, which is a village in the Cercle de Kolondièba. They know one another through ties of community, kinship, and marriage.
