They all have rainy season work, namely the growing of grains. With the goal of increasing their production, the group members joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their eighth loan.

Mariam, who is the one seated in the photo, intends to use her loan to buy peanut seeds, fertilizers, and herbicides and to cover the cost of plowing and weeding for her field, which has an area of 1 hectare. She hopes to produce a tonne of peanuts and a tonne of rice. 

She envisions making 180,000 francs CFA in profit from this produce, which is destined for sale to retailers from large cities.

The profits thus obtained will enable her to repay the loan, establish hope chests for the girls' weddings, and to meet certain household needs.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and herbicides and to cover the cost of plowing

loans.name: Carnette

texts.fr: Carnette est commerçante. Elle revend des articles de secondes mains de divers types. Elle revend des portefeuilles, des sacs à dos, des carnets de note, des stylos, etc. Elle demande un prêt pour augmenter son stock.

loans.use: augmenter son stock

loans.name: María Norma

texts.en:
In Escobedo, Neuvo Leon, lives Miss Maria and her family, husband and two children. Their house is very small and they face economic problems frequently, since her husband is a labourer and his work is occasional so his income is not secure. Following this difficult situation, Miss Maria thought to help her family live in better conditions and enjoy a better financial stability. And since then, almost three years, she started to make a sell food from her home.

The genuine duty to her family and the will to come out on top motivated Miss Maria to find a solution to their problems. But now she requires a loan to continue, for the amount of $250, the same will be repaid in a 3-6 month term. You can help ensure the well-being of this family, they need you. With your support they will be achieve a better life and conquer their adversities.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

En Escobedo, Nuevo León, viven Doña María y su familia, esposo y dos hijos. Su casa es muy pequeña y enfrentan frecuentemente problemas económicos, pues su marido es Albañil y su trabajo es eventual, por lo que los ingresos no seguros. Tras ésta difícil situación Doña María, pensó en ayudar a su familia a tener mejores condiciones de vida y una mayor estabilidad financiera, y entonces cuando, hace ya casi 3 años comenzó a elaborar y vender comidas en su propio domicilio.

El autentico compromiso con su familia y las ganas de salir adelante impulsaron a Doña María a encontrar una solución a sus problemas, pero ahora ella requiere de un préstamo para continuar, por la cantidad de 250 DLLS, mismo que será cubierto en un plazo de 3-6 meses. Tú puedes asegurar el bienestar de esta familia, ellos te necesitan, con tu apoyo lograran vivir mejor y vencer las adversidades.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Frasiah Njoki intends to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Roger

texts.en:
Rogers is the oldest of three brothers. He spent most of his life working and studying in Asunción. He worked with his uncle in an electric motor rewind repair shop where he learned the electro mechanic profession. After some time, he decided to return to his hometown and he set up a workshop in his house. He has already hired other two persons and they all repair electrical engines. Besides he collects copper wire and he sells them again, since according to him these sell at a considerable price on the market. He wants to use the loan to buy supplies for the repair of the engines that are the base of his small-scale enterprise. The profits will be use to support his family and to employ more people.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Roger es el mayor de cuatro hermanos. La mayor parte de su vida la pasó en Asunción, trabajando y estudiando. Trabajó con un tío suyo en un taller de rebobinados de motores eléctricos donde aprendió la profesión de electromecánico. Después de un tiempo decidió regresar a su ciudad natal y monto un taller en su casa en el cual ya emplea a otras dos personas. En su local tiene varios motores eléctricos que los repara por encargo. Aparte junta los hilos de cobre y los vuelve a vender, ya que según él estos se venden a un precio considerable en el mercado. El quiere destinar el crédito para la compra de insumos para la reparación de los motores que son la base de su pequeña empresa. La utilidad generada será utilizada para subsistencia de la familia y generar más recursos para emplear a más gente.

loans.use: Buy copper wire

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.en:
L. Madeleine is a 36-year-old woman. She is married and has 5 children. She has more than 16 years of work experience in selling food products. Her husband is a mechanic. She lives with her family in Yopougon (a northern suburb of Abidjan).

Madeleine is dynamic and wants to expand her activities and open a grocery store in Yopougon. She heard about AE&I in March, 2005 from her friend and joined the AE&I microcredit program then. She has been a good performer and has always reimbursed all her loans in good manner.

loans.use: Lou Madeleine will use the loan to purchase stock in bulk

loans.name: Bertha Alicia

texts.es:
Bertha is a widow, and has two children for whom she is the only source of economic sustenance, and because of the misfortune they have found themselves with the death of her husband, she had to see the necessity of doing somethins to maintain her children. So, two years ago she commenced with much energy to form a little grocery store and now her children help her in the business, which has helped them to be able to move forward. Bertha is applying fo a loan of US $650, which she offers to pay in six months, to be able to buy more merchandise and be able to move forward with her two children who currently help her in the business. She is infinitely grateful for your help in being able to continue forward with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Bertha es una persona viuda, y tiene dos hijos para los cuales ella es el único sostén económico, y a raíz de la desgracia que se les presento con el fallecimiento de su esposo tuvo que ver en la necesidad de hacer algo para mantener a sus hijos. Así, hace doce años comenzó con mucho esfuerzo a formar su negocio de tiendita de abarrotes y ahora sus hijos le apoyan en el negocio, el cual les a ayudado a poder salir adelante.

Bertha solicita un préstamo de USD $ 650, que ofrece pagar en 6 meses para poder comprar más mercancía y poder salir adelante con sus dos hijos que ahora le ayudan en el negocio, agradecen infinitamente tu ayuda para poder seguir adelante con su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise - Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve her classrooms

loans.name: Sojida

texts.ru:
Sojida K. is 27 years old, is single, has a secondary technical education and is a teacher by profession. She works as a teacher at school #18 in the Yavan region. She also has 4 years of experience in raising livestock.

Sojida plans to use her loan to purchase 3 pieces of livestock and feed for them. Every 40-45 days she plans to sell the livestock and to use the revenues to purchase new livestock and feed. Sojida plans to use leftover revenues to help her family as the family is large and not everyone has a source of income. Her brother helps her in her business. She plans to pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Каримова Соджида, возраст – 27 лет, образование среднее техническое, по специальности – педагог, не замужем. В настоящее время она работает преподователем в средней школе №18 Яванского района. Также имеет четырехлетний опыт в разведение крупного роагтого скота. Полученный кредит хочет использовать на приобретение 3 голов крупного рогатого скота и корма для них. Через каждые 40-45 дней планирует продавать его, а на вырученные деньги приобретать новый молодняк и корм для него. Оставшуюся прибыль она планирует использовать на оказание помощи своей семье, так как семья у них большая и не все имеют источники получения дохода. В этой деятельности ей помогает ее брат. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of 3 pieces of livestock

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
The business that Maria Teresa Garcia has is one of selling sandals and flip-flops in the local market located in the city of Leon, Nicaragua. She began her business 8 years ago with one thousand cordobas (currency name) she got through a loan several years ago. After purchasing her first batch of merchandise, she paid off her loan by herself and uses part of the money to buy food for her elderly mother.

She had a rough time at first since she would walk the streets of Leon with her heavy cart. She then realized she really needed the job because she is a single mother. She wishes to get a loan through Ceprodel who has been able to provide her with the necessary credit. She wishes to purchase her own stand at the central market and at the same time continue supporting her mother.

Translated by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio al que se dedica la señora Maria Teresa G. es a la venta de chinelas y sandalias en el mercado central de la ciudad de León en Nicaragua. Desde hace 8 años inició su negocio invirtiendo un capital de Un mil córdobas obtenidos por un préstamo a un prestamista. Luego que compra la primera mercadería, muy responsablemente busca la manera de pagar el préstamo y comenzar a trabajar por si sola para llevar el alimento a su mamá que es de edad avanzada.

Sus inicios con el negocio fue por mucho tiempo muy duro ya que se trasladaba ambulantemente por las calles de León con un pesado carretón y a la vez con un saco de chinelas siendo esta una faena diaria. Al estar consiente de la necesidad de trabajo y por ser una dama soltera decide solicitar prestamos en Ceprodel que hasta el momento le han beneficiado con la adquisición de un propio local en las afueras del mercado Central y a la vez le ha ayudado para llevar el alimento a su querida madre.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for her business (flip-flops and sandals)

loans.name: Roberta

texts.en:
Ramona R. de Mancuello is married and is the mother of five children. Four of her children are still students in the university and in grade school. Only her eldest is employed. She began her business selling things as a traveling vendor. When she saved enough money to invest, she opened a small grocery store out of her house. Now this is a way for her family to survive.

Ramona also has worked in the community fighting for the rights of her neighbors and friends. She has done some social work and helped insure the building of over 70 homes by the government. Today Ramona is asking for a loan to purchase the necessary goods for her store.

loans.use: To buy food merchandise to sell like rice, pasta, oil, milk, cookies, soda and sugar.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria A. is married with 7 children. She is 52 years old. She sells provisions and drinks. She is from Edo State, Nigeria, and has been in business since 2005. She needs the loan amount of $525 to buy more provisions for sale.

loans.use: To buy provisions for sale

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Mr. Alberto A. is dedicated to working in the tranport sector and has his own small truck that he uses to move cargo and passengers, according to the specific needs of his clients. For 6 years, he has worked in this sector, which has allowed him, over to time, to invest in the business in order to provide better conditions to the users of his transport services, either with him driving or using his truck to take products to the market.

Today, Mr. Alberto has the urgent need to buy parts for his truck, which is out of service, and therefore means, there is no income to maintain his family. For this reason, he is requesting assistance from Ceprodel to be able to benefit from a credit, that will allow him to buy parts and continue his business, and sustain his home and family.

loans.use: Purchase of truck parts

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio occupies a residence in which he works as a attendant with his wife and their 4 children (whose ages are 15, 12, 10 and 5 years). The house is located on Juan Vargas Street in the Pedro Domingo Murillo zone (City of El Alto).

His commercial activity is the making of wool sweaters for ladies. Said production is sold in the main fair of the city.

The loan will be invested in the purchase of wool in quantity to reduce his costs.

This is his first loan with IMPRO. The evaluation carried out qualifies IMPRO to offer him the loan.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Julio ocupa un domicilio en el que trabaja como cuidador junto a su esposa y sus 4 hijos (cuyas edades oscilan entre 15, 12, 10 y 5 años de edad). La casa esta ubicada en la Calle Juan Vargas de la zona Pedro Domingo Murillo (Ciudad de el Alto).

Su actividad comercial es la confección de chompas de lana para señoras, dicha producción es vendida en la feria principal de la ciudad..

El crédito será invertido en la compra de lana en cantidad para reducir sus costos.

Este es su primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: To purchase wool in quantity for his sweater production business in order to reduce costs.

loans.name: Đulsa

texts.en:
Đulsa is 58 years old. She is a widow living in the village of Čivčije.

She currently has a monthly pension of 500 KM (Bosnian Marks), and also works to support herself making needlepoint pictures. This is her first loan, which she is requesting in the amount of 600 KM ($475).

She will use this loan to buy supplies to use for making the pictures. She also needs money to buy frames for these pictures, which she then sells. Her wish is to expand her business through this loan.

loans.use: To buy tapestry for stitching.

loans.name: Marhamat

texts.ru:
Marhamat H. has been working with Microinvest for the past 5 years, and has had no problem repaying all of her previous loans. With her last loan Mahramat increased the variety of her goods and, therefore her profits. Mahramat would like to receive a new loan in order to purchase goods for sale next week.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Хакимова Мархамат уже 5 лет как кредитуется в Микроинвесте и без проблемно погашает свои предыдущие кредиты. На последний кредит Мархамат увеличила свой ассортимент товара, а следовательно и прибыль. Мархамат подала заявку на следующий займ чтоб в ближайшую неделю поехать за товаром.

loans.use: To purchase female head dresses for sale

loans.name: Pendo

texts.en:
Pendo is 43 years old and married. She owns a small shop that she has been running since in 1998. Every day, she works from 8 A.M. to 10 P.M. at her business where she can earn a monthly profit of about $175.

In the past, Pendo has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more inventory for her shop.

loans.use: To increase inventory in her shop

loans.name: Karina

texts.es: La señora Karina junto con su esposo el señor Cornelio tienen tres hijas y son pequeñas, están en edad de escuela, ellos están solicitando este préstamo para construir una barda en el frente de su casa y darle a su familia mas protección,  ya que la señora trabaja como supervisora en una maquiladora en el turno de noche y el trabaja en una fabrica en diferentes horarios, para salir adelante, y demostrando que nunca hay que darse por vencidos, “ella  al igual que su esposo le quieren brindar mas seguridad a sus hijas y saber que cuando ellos esten trabajando y su familia se quede en casa no corran ningún riesgo.”
texts.en:
Mrs. Karina, together with her husband, Mr. Cornelio, has three young daughters who are in school. Karina and Cornelio are requesting a loan in order to construct a fence in front of their home to give their family more protection since Karina works as a supervisor in a factory and at night her husband works various hours at a factory in order to move ahead. To show that she never gives up, "she, the same as her husband, wants to provide more security to her children and know that when they are working, and when her family is at home they are safe."


Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To construct a fence in front of their home.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua M. sells clothing at Kissi near Elmina. Ekua has received no formal education. She is divorced and has 7 children. Ekua started selling clothing in 2008. She is responsible for paying for thedependand's school fees and other utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy add to her capital to buy more clothing for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to help her husband to start putting up a house for the family.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Dora

texts.es: La señora Dora pertenece al Banco Comunal “San Fernando II”, ubicado en el Jr. Fitzcarrald Nº 314, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 47 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos, 2 mayores de edad y uno que aún depende de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja como profesor de la “UNU”. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de gaseosas. Tiene 5 años trabajando con el banco comunal.nnEn la actualidad se dedica a administrar un locutorio, a la venta de gaseosas y bebidas, a su hogar y tiene el apoyo total de su familia.n nCon este préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará tarjetas de 10, 15 y recargas virtuales, 2 cajas de galletas, 2 paquetes de sporade, etc.  nnDora manifiesta alegría por todas las cosas buenas que le ha pasado en la vida, agradece al Banco por la ayuda brindada. n
texts.en:
Dora belongs to the Communal Bank “San Fernando II,” located at Jr. Fitzcarrald Nº 314, Callería district, Coronel Portillo province, Ucayali province. She is 47 years old, mother to 3 children, 2 are adults and one still depends on her. She is married and her husband works as a professor in the “UNU.” With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos for S/.300 she decided to invest in the sales of soda pop. She has worked with the communal bank for 5 years. Today she is the manager of a phone café and sales of soda pop and beverages at her home and she has the support of her family. With this loan for S/.1,200, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy phone cards in denominations of 10 and 15 plus rechargeable cards, 2 cases of cookies, 2 packages of Sporade sports drink, etc. Dora states she is happy with everything that has happened in her life, and she thanks the Bank for the help it has provided her.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy telephone cards, cookies, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Loydith

texts.es:
La señora Loidith, socia del BC “Las Estrellas de Jorge Chávez II”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia y distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la venta de  chupetes, gelatinas, chicha de maíz y bebidas gasificadas. Su negocio está ubicado en su casa.

Con este préstamo S/.500, el cual será cancelado en 04 meses, comprará insumos para la preparación de sus chupetes como azúcar, bolsitas para chupetes, frutas para la elaboración de los chupetes, maíz y azúcar para la preparación de chicha y gaseosas de diferentes marcas tamaños y sabores y sus clientes encuentren lo que buscan.

Loidith tiene 40 años de edad, vive con sus 02 hijos que aún están a su cargo, y con su esposo que se dedica a trabajos eventuales. Su meta es arreglar su casa para dar comodidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Loydith is a member of the Community Bank “Las Estrellas de Jorge Chávez II”. She lives in the San Martín area, province and district of Tarapoto. She sells lollipops, jellies, sparkling sodas and corn-based drinks called ‘chicha’. Her business is located at her home. With this loan of $175 (500 PEN), which will be paid back in 4 months, she will purchase supplies to make lollipops and chicha, such as sugar, lollipop bags, fruit, and sodas of different brands, flavors and sizes so her customers can find what they need. Loydith is 40 years old. She lives with her 2 dependent children and her husband who has a temporary job. Her goal is to improve her home and make her customers more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sugar, lollipop bags, fruit, corn and sodas.

loans.name: Aziz Fatima Liaqat Ali Group

texts.en:
I am Aziz Fatima and I am 37-years old, married, and live in Pakpattan, Pakistan which is famous for its shrine. named Pakpattan, Pakistan. I completed my education till 5th standard, but couldn’t study further due to the poor financial condition of my household. I have 7children, 3 sons and 4 daughters. All of my children are getting an education in a local school in my neighborhood. My husband, L. A., has been in the clothes-selling business for 4 years. He needs to replenish his inventory so he can earn more income. I have repaid my two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now I am requesting a loan to buy clothes for my husband’s business. 

I am a group leader with 5 other members in my group: Irshad baji requests a loan to buy a sewing machine for her sewing business. Parveen baji requests a loan to buy plastic utensils to resell. Azra baji requests a loan to buy an instrument (keyboard) for her band. Parveen akhtar baji requests a loan to buy sugar to resell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Surng

texts.en: Mr. Surng C. is a 30-year-old widower and he lives in Trapaing Sla village in Kampong Cham Province. He is a construction worker. Aside from this career, he is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. He now wants to expand his rice revenue; thus, he decided to ask for a loan to purchase a 1-hectare field to cultivate rice. He hopes to increase his income and improve his living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To purchase a 1-hectare field to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Happy

texts.en: Happy sells pork in Santana market in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She has been in this business for a longtime. The demands for her pork are high and she hopes to expand this business. She needs a loan to purchase more pork to sell. Happy is 49 years old and married with 4 children. She is a LAPO client. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more pork to sell.

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Neema has been a fruit seller in the Mwanjelwa neighborhood of Mbeya for 4 years. She belongs to Benk group loan (Group code 2001).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $175. Every day she works at her business for 10 hours.  

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more fruit for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Neema is 38 years old, single, and has three children: ages 14, 9  and 6. She also cares for one additional dependent.

loans.use: To buy more fruit for her business.

loans.name: Oluwatoyin

texts.en:
Oluwatoyin is 33 years old and married with 3 children. She is business oriented. She sells block in her house and she is able to invest the profit back in to her business for the continuous growth of her business. Oluwatoyin has been in this business for the past 8 years and she has been borrowing from LAPO microfinance for the past 3 years.

Oluwatoyin wants to expand her business by selling jewelry and second-hand clothes. She will be able to achieve this with the Kiva loan of N100,000 that she is requesting. Oluwatoyin is very happy and grateful for the financial support given to her by LAPO Microfinance and Kiva lenders. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase jewelry and second-hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Askarali

texts.ru: Аскарали - молодой человек 27 лет. Женат. Имеет 3 детей. Занимается откормом и продажей крупно-рогатого и мелко рогатого скота. Жена - домохозяйка. Нянчит своих детей и делает работу по дому. Откармливает скот, который остается дома. Муж каждый день гонит скот на горы. Они пасутся горной травой, так как с наступлением весны, горы зеленеется и пастухи экономят на этом, не покупая сена для скота. Аскарали узнав о нашем кредитовании у односельчан, решил взять кредит для увеличения количества скота.
texts.en:
Askarali is a young man of 27. He is married and has three children. He raises and sells large and small-horned cattle. His wife is a housewife, who cares for their children and does tasks around the house, in addition to feeding the livestock that remains at the house. Every day her husband drives the cattle into the hills where they graze on the mountain grass. With the onset of spring, the hills are greening up and herders are able to save money because there is not need to buy hay for the livestock. Askarali learned of MicroInvest's credit program from a fellow villager, and decided to take out a loan to increase the size of his herd.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and selling cattle

loans.name: Sarin

texts.en:
Mr. Sarin M., 54, and his wife, Mrs. Sun Lach, 51, have been married for 20 years and have four daughters. Three of their daughters are married and live away from the family home, and the fourth daughter works in Phnom Penh as a cook. The family lives along national road No. 1 about 15 kilometers outside of Phnom Penh.

Sarin has made a living as a chef for the last 20 years, cooking special meals for weddings and other ceremonies. His wife has been a florist for the last 10 years. She buys flowers from nearby villagers for resale at a market in Phnom Penh. She earns a profit from $12.50 to $25.00 per week. Sarin has applied for his first loan of $600 to build a fence around of his house and to purchase more flowers for his wife to resell.

loans.use: To build a fence around his house and to more flowers to resell.

loans.name: Bojana

texts.en:
Bojana J. was born in 1988. She comes from Karanovac, Petrovo. She is not married and lives with her parents and brother in their family house. Bojana is employed in a big shopping center as a merchant.

Her family owns an orchard with different kinds of fruit such as plums, apples, pears and cherries. As they live together so they work and invest in the orchard together.

So, Bojana requested a loan of 1,500 KM, her first from WWI (Women for Women International). This loan will be used to buy needed equipment and supplies for her orchard. Also, they must provide minerals and use funds for the protection of the fruit. Bojana`s family business is still developing and they expect their first good crop next year.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for the orchard

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
This is Janet N.. She is a widow and is the mother of a child who is in the nursing training college. Janet is 47 years old. She sells foodstuffs like cassava, plantain, maize, beans, and gari in the local market of Suhum where she lives. Plantain and cassava are used for fufu, a porridge which is enjoyed by many Ghanaians. She is been selling for the past 20 years and has gained a great deal of selling experience, which makes her successful in winning customers.

Janet is an achiever and her focus is to save enough to strengthen her business now that she is not taking care of children. She wants to use the loan to buy an increased stock of cassava and plantain to serve her customers. She would be grateful for such assistance.

loans.use: To buy increased stock of foodstuffs like cassava, plantain, maize, beans, and gari

loans.name: Chinbaatar

texts.en: Chinbaatar D. lives with his wife in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. He drives a truck between Arhangai province and Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He transports cut wood that he purchases from local woodcutters and sells at a in the wholesale markets in Ulaanbaatar. When he drives back home, he purchases and transports food products for his wife's business. His wife sells food products in the local food market. Since the start, his business has done very well; his business capital has increased from 350,000 MNT to 1,100,000 MNT. He requests a loan to purchase cut wood and fuel for his transportation business.

loans.use: To purchase planks

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es: Vicenta C. M. reside en San Luis Talpa en el departamento de La Paz. Vicenta tiene 52 años de edad vive con su hija y su nietas. Vicenta y su hija se dedican al negocio con el cual han logrado salir adelante es una tortillería y panadería, las ventas de sus productos son diarias y sus compras de materia prima una vez a la semana, el crédito que Vicenta solicita es para compra de materia prima para a aumentar la producción en la panadería y tortillería, así les permitirá generar mayores ingresos económicos para la familia a través del aumento de sus ventas.
texts.en:
Vicenta C. M. lives in San Luis Talpa in the department of La Paz. She is 52 years old and lives with her daughter and granddaughters. Vicenta and her daughter have a tortilla shop and a bakery, with which they have been able to get ahead. They make sales from their products daily and they buy raw materials once per week. Vicenta is asking for a loan for the purchase of raw material to increase the production of the tortilla shop and bakery so that they will be able to generate greater economic incomes for the family through the increase of their sales.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw material

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa F. is from the village of Canicapan. She is 46 years old. Elsa is separated and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Elsa operates a food products business. Elsa has been engaged in her business for 5 years and earns approximately Php1,000.00 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Elsa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsa is requesting a loan amounting to 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be Elsa's first loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make food to sell

loans.name: Nancy Olinda

texts.es:
La señora Nancy  es socia del Banco Comunal “Señor de la Justicia”, ubicado en la cuidad de Puno, provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y es madre de 03 hijos, ella estudió educación superior (Trabajo Social).  Vive en el Barrio Independencia.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 8 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para su negocio de compra y venta de Ropa.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional de S/. 1300.00 nuevos soles, con este monto ella va adquirir arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche, gaseosas, etc. para su tienda de abarrotes, negocio que tiene actualmente.

Su deseo es Poner una bodega bien surtida por el centro de la cuidad.

A ella le gustan los bajos intereses y la confianza que Manuela Ramos deposita en las socias.
texts.en:
Sra. Nancy is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor de la Justicia” (Lord of Justice), which is located in the city of Puno, Puno Province, Department of Puno. She is 40 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children. Sra. Nancy has a degree in Social Work and lives in the neighborhood of Independencia. She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 8 years. Her first loan of 300 soles was used as capital for her business of buying and selling clothes. She is now requesting another loan in the amount of 1300 soles to purchase rice, sugar, oil, milk, sodas, and other items for her grocery store – the business she operates now. She hopes to open a well-stocked grocery store in the central part of town. Sra. Nancy enjoys the low interest rates and the confidence Manuela Ramos has in its members.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, oil, milk, sodas, etc.

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Maura es socia del Banco Comunal Amor y Verdad.
Maura es viuda, tiene 56 años y 6 hijos, Maura venD. queso D. manera ambulatoria D. casa en casa, además Maura tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, frutas, verduras.
Maura necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. quesos.
Los sueños D. Maura son que su hijo ultimo culmine sus estudios y su negocio mejore.

loans.use: Para la compra de quesos.

loans.name: Arcelie

texts.en:
Arcelie manages a general store business in Babanuang San Manuel, Isabela. She is already 46 years old and already married. She wanted to request for a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP7, 000 in order to develop her business. Aside from her general store she is also managing a beauty parlor business. She is blessed with two children: Mel Joseph and Cheny. 

She has been doing her best in the business for already 13 years. Her business income which is around PHP2, 000 a day is carefully budget to meet the needs of their family and for the maintenance of her business. is also saving some of her income for the tuition fees and allowances of her children. Arcelie dreams to have a better family living by patiently managing her beauty parlor and general store business.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
La señora María Isabel G. esta muy agradecida por su cooperación en el crédito anterior el cual le ayudo a que sus hijas terminaran un ciclo más escolar.
A está nueva mente solicitando un préstamo para pagar la inscripción y comprar el uniforme y libros de la universidad, porque en este momento no cuenta con el dinero y les están exigiendo en la escuela para que puedan seguir estudiando.
Doña María Isabel desea que sus hijas tengan una carrera profesional para el futuro de ellas mismos.
Cuando fuimos a visitar la vivienda de la señora María Isabel, se encontraba en su trabajo y quienes nos atendieron fueron sus hijos quienes aparecen en la foto.

loans.use: Gastos escolares

loans.name: Lilian Adhiambo

texts.en:
Lilian Adhiambo is a 33-year-old married lady and mother of three. She operates a small shop in which she sells general household consumables (mostly food). She has been in this business for the last four years. It has picked up momentum after suffering disruption caused by the post-election violence of early 2008.

This is her second loan from KADET Ltd. She intends to use the money to increase the stock of her shop and also purchase cereals, in an effort to diversify. 

She aspires to open other outlets in the neighborhood to increase her income and to see her children through school.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To increase stock of cereals and foodstuffs.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria tiene 52 años, es madre soltera, vive con su hijo de 21 años, quien es soltero y trabaja.
Desde hace 12 años se dedica a la compra de madera, la cual lleva a un aserradero donde las convierten en tablillas; posteriormente María las vende a cualquier proyecto de construcción o en un local que acondicionó al costado de su casa
Con esta actividad Maria ha solventado las necesidades y educación de su hijo, quien es su inspiración de seguir luchando. 
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es relacionarse con muchas personas y mantenerse activa, además le es rentable porque la madera en de gran demanda en la zona de selva donde ella vive.
 
Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, se siente a gusto trabajar con su banco comunal porque se distrae durante las reuniones de grupo y porque todos son responsables con sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más madera para incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Maria is a 52 year-old single mother. She lives with her son who is 21 years old, single and employed. For 12 years she has been buying wood, which are then sawed into timber (small boards). María sells the timber to construction projects or directly from her house. This business has allowed Maria to support her family expenses and her son’s education. Her son gives her inspiration to continue to work hard.
She enjoys her work because she interacts with a lot of people and keeps her active. It is also a profitable business because timber is in great demand where she lives.
This is her second loan with Microfinanza Prisma. She likes to work with her communal bank because she enjoys the group meetings and everyone is very responsible with their payments. She will use this loan to buy more wood to increase sales.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more wood.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 48-year-old man who lives in Saida, Southern Lebanon with his wife and their four children. Ahmad has been selling and producing home-made “mouneh,” which are agricultural products, since 1983. In Arabic, mouneh is food that is stored for later consumption, such as pickles, jams, tomato paste, and radishes. Ahmad requested this loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase some merchandise for his shop. This is his third cycle and he has always paid on time.

His previous loans helped him improve his work by diversifying his merchandise and expanding his stock. Ahmad is special in his work because he sells products of good quality. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Ahmad decided on doing this business because he likes working in this kind of field. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase some merchandise for his shop

loans.name: Norieta

texts.en:
Norieta M. is a 41-year-old married woman with four adult-age children from the village of Rizal. To earn a living, Norieta owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector; specifically, she operates a clothing business and a cosmetics sales business. Her primary income is generated by providing general clothing services to local community members. Norieta has been engaged in her business for over two years, and she typically earns approximately 3,500 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2009, Norieta joined ASKI to gain access to financial services. As a result, she was able to both improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Norieta is requesting a loan in the amount of 4,000 PHP ($100), which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This loan would be the first loan taken out by Norieta from ASKI. She plans to use any additional revenue generated by the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. Indeed, it has 25 branches, covering the Central and Northeastern areas of the country. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen/women, and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To improve and expand her business by purchasing additional fabrics and materials

loans.name: Akar

texts.en:
Akar M. is 37 years old and married. Her husband is a mechanic. She has four children in school. Akar is currently in the business of selling fresh vegetables at market. She is requesting a loan to stock bags of maize flour to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.
About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. These programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs, as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock bags of maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Hellen Atieno

texts.en:
Hellen Atieno O. is 33 years old, is married, and is blessed with three children. She lives in Rongo, Kenya where she also runs a clothing business.

Hellen Atieno started her business in 1999 as an expansion scheme of the tailoring business she had then. She gets her stock across the border from Uganda once a month and would like a loan of Kshs 30,000 to increase her stock.

Hellen Atieno’s main goal is give her family a good future.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 33 years old and has a farm in the Bureti district of the South Rift Valley in Kenya. Happily married, he has four children, aged four through ten. But he says that life has not been an easy ride with three of his children attending school. He opted to take out a loan from Juhudi Kilimo for Kes. 45,000 to add an extra dairy cow. This will improve his milk production and enable him to pay school fees and repay the loan.

David also grows tea in addition to the milk that he produces and sells to Kenya Cooperative Creameries. He's been farming for three years and, in the future, he'd like to build dairy units for four cows that can produce up to 60 litres a day. He says that the main challenges to his business are lack of capital and of knowledge of high-yield dairy farming, both of which he is now acquiring through Juhudi.

About Juhudi Kilimo

Juhudi Kilimo is a for-profit social enterprise focused on the economic development of Kenya, where agriculture and related activities employ about 75% of the workforce, often in smallholder farms. Through micro-leasing, Juhudi helps these smallholder farmers acquire productive, income-generating assets like dairy cows, chickens, and agricultural equipment. Farmers also receive agricultural training and business insurance as part of Juhudi’s innovative approach to creating sustainable growth and employment in these rural communities. Juhudi is changing the way farmers do business.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en:
Ilham N. has been able to support his family in an honorable way by selling different kinds of foodstuffs in his grocery store. He is married with four children.

In order to improve the quality and quantity of his products, he wants to buy more foodstuffs and for this purpose he needs a loan of 1,600 AZN. Ilham has put a lot of effort into developing his business; he would like to keep growing as a micro-entrepreneur, and with your help this could be possible.

Ilham and his family are sincerely grateful for your generosity and support.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Analito

texts.en:
Analito F. is from the village of Brgy. Lactawan, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 35 years old. Analito is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Analito owns and operates a business providing motorcycle transportation services. Analito has been engaged in his business for more than five years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Analito joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Analito has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase tires and other accessories. Analito is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Analito from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Glenda Maricela

texts.es:
En el barrio Sócrates Sandino Municipio de Somotillo 
La señora T. García realiza la venta de sus productos en el municipio de Somotillo ella distribuye ropa alos clientes que ella obtiene en los distintos barrios del municipio.
 Ella quiere el crédito para comprar la compra de tres bidones de pintura para pintar   su casa de habitación y así mejorar su condición de vida y de su familia.
Ella nos dice que los crédito que ha recibido con CEPRODEL la ha beneficiado ya que con ellos levanto su casa y hoy la esta acondicionando.
texts.en:
Mrs. T. García lives in the Sócrates Sandino neighborhood in the Somotillo municipality. She sells her products in the Somotillo municipality. She distributes clothes to the customers that she gets in the different neighborhoods of the municipality. She needs the loan to buy three drums of paint to paint her house. This will improve her family’s living conditions. She tells us that the loans she has received from Ceprodel have helped her raise her house, and she is fixing it up now.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy paint to paint her house in order to improve living conditions for her and her family

loans.name: Ukotzijal Chotacaj Group

texts.es: Doña Juana Vicenta Hernández de 40 años de edad, casada, de oficios Estudiante, ella vende “Ropa Típica para Mujeres” responsable, honesta, respetuosa, viendo la necesidad de obtener un pequeño capital y unas vecinas que se conocen hace mucho tiempo, el cual las actividades de ellas son diversas, deciden organizar un pequeño grupo para poder  acercarse a las oficinas de ASDIR a solicitar un préstamo grupal, el mismo será utilizado como capital de trabajo. Donde ellas podrán mejorar la demanda de clientela, condiciones de vida como la de su familia. El grupo es conformado por  Diez mujeres, denominado “UKOTZIJAL CHOTACAJ”, que traduciéndolo significa  “Flor de Chotacaj”. La residencia del grupo se encuentra en Cantón Chotacaj, del municipio y departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala.
texts.en:
Doña Juana Vicenta Hernández, age 40, is married and has studied crafts. She sells traditional clothing for women and is responsible, honest and courteous. Seeing the need to obtain a bit of capital, she and a few neighbors who have known each other for a long time decided to organize a small group in order to get it. They have applied for a group loan from ASDIR which will be used as working capital. They hope that they will be able to improve the demand from customers and their families’ living conditions.

The group is made up of ten women and called “UKOTZIJAL CHOTACAJ”, which translates as “Chotacaj Flower”. The group is located in Chotacaj Canton in the municipality and department of Totonicapán, Guatemala.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Moustafa

texts.en:
Moustafa is a 52-year-old married man living with his wife and their four children in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon. He has had a men's clothing shop since 1993 and has many years of experience in this occupation. He has been very reliable with his repayments to Al Majmoua and has repaid his entire loan on time. 

Therefore, for the third time, Moustafa is asking for a new loan to purchase more merchandise for his business, specifically to increase his selection of new collections and to offer a bigger choice of clothes to his clients for the summer season. He's confident that the loan will allow him to increase his business productivity.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Deysi Mercedes

texts.es: Deysi Mercedes H. S. 28 años de edad es una joven muy trabajadora y emprendedora, la cual posee su propio negocio el cual es una venta de productos de primera necesidad tales como: leche, granos básicos, aceite, así mismo comercializa verduras y frutas, el negocio esta ubicado en el mercado de San Juan Opico, el cual esta ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Ella reside en  Santa Tecla, ciudad en la que vive junto a su esposo quien se dedica a trabajar y su único hijo de 6 años de edad, el cual es la mayor razón de Deysi  para trabajar y esforzarse día con día. El negocio es muy grande por lo que posee muchos clientes quienes comprar en grandes cantidades sus productos, por lo que ella desea aumentar su inventario, razón por la que solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar productos de primera necesidad todas por mayor y de esta manera abastecer a todos sus clientes y de paso obtener algunos nuevos. Esto llena de mucha ilusión a Deysi ya que ella es una persona que día con día trabaja mucho para mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Deysi Mercedes H. S. is 28 years old. She is a hard-working and entrepreneurial young woman who has her own business, which is a store that sells basic products such as milk, grains, and oil, and she also sells fruits and vegetables. Her business is located in the market of San Juan Opico, which is located in the La Libertad district. She lives in Santa Tecla with her husband, who works, and her only son, who is 6 years old and is the main reason why Deysi works and exerts herself day after day. Her business is quite large, so she has many customers who buy her products in large quantities. For this reason, she wants to increase her inventory, and that is why she is applying for a loan, which she can use to buy basic products, all wholesale, and in this way provide for all her customers and at the same time obtain some new ones. This idea fills Deysi with great expectations, since she is a person who works hard day after day to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic products wholesale

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es:
Soledad tiene 40 años, está casada con Senobio de 48 años, con quien tiene cinco hijos, juntos viven en una casa alquilada ubicada en la ciudad de Santa Ana. Hace mas de 10 años se dedica al cultivo de plátanos y café, asimismo  compra y vende plátanos en un lugar disponible dentro de su domicilio; mientras que su esposo trabaja como operario en los fundos de la zona, ganando S/. 20.0 soles diario. Lo que más le gusta de su negocio es tener tiempo suficiente para recolectar leña y preparar los alimentos de sus hijos, pues le gusta que ellos estén bien atendidos y sobre todo que aprendan de este oficio y más adelante puedan ayudar a crecer sus ventas.
De las ganancias que perciben esta pareja, podrán construir su casa e instalar una bodega en donde pueda vender bananas. Para soledad esta actividad le será de importancia para que pueda ofrecer a sus hijos una adecuada calidad de vida. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP y como ya conoce la metodología de trabajo de su grupo comunal, se siente muy a gusto laborar con los integrantes, quienes siempre están pendientes del progreso de cada uno de ellos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de plátanos para dinamizar su negocio.
texts.en:
Soledad is 40 years old and is married to 48 year old Senobio. They have five children and live in a rented home located in the city of Santa Ana. For the past ten years, Soledad has been raising bananas and coffee. She also buys and sells bananas from her home, while her husband works as on an estate, earning only 20 PEN a day. What she likes the most about her business is that it gives her enough time to gather firewood to be able to cook for her children. She wants them to be well cared for and to later learn this trade and help to grow the business. With the income this couple is expecting, they will be able to build a home of their own and open a store where they can sell bananas. For Soledad, this is important because it will allow her to give a better quality of life to her children. This will be her fifth loan through MFP and since she is already familiar with how the communal group works, she feels comfortable working alongside its members, who always look out for each other. She will use the money from this loan to buy more bananas, in order to be able to diversify her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bananas

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: El Sr. T. O. Alejandro de 26 años de edad, vive con su conyugue y sus 2 pequeños hijos. Viven en casa propia, la cual se encuentra ubicada en el Caserío Santa Matilde. Trabaja como obrero de campo en la Empresa Robsons S.A.C. Su conyugue es obrera eventual. El Sr. es una persona muy emprendedora, que gracias a su empeño logro salir adelante y pudo construir parte de su vivienda. El Sr. T. requiere el crédito para poder terminar de construir su casa. Su sueño, según nos comenta es terminar de construir dicha vivienda, para poder tener una mejor calidad de vida. El Sr T. esta muy agradecido por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este  financiamiento.
texts.en:
Sr. Alejandro T. O. is 26 years old, married, and has two small children. He and his family live in their own house located in the village of Santa Matilde. Alejandro is employed as a field worker for the Robsons Company, SAC. His wife is a seasonal worker. Sr. Alejandro is an enterprising person who, through his determination, has been able to move forward and proceed with the construction of part of his home.

Sr. T. needs a loan to complete the construction of his house. He says that his dream is to finish building his home so that he can have a better quality of life. Sr. T. is extremely grateful for the support that has been provided through this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish the construction of his house

loans.name: Myagmarsuren

texts.en:
Myagmarsuren D. is 35 years old and lives with her two children in Uvurhangai province in central Mongolia. She and her family live in a house which is owned by her mother. The family's living conditions are good and she is able to operate a business trading goods at a local market.  


Myagmarsuren sells a variety of clothes and garments. She purchases most of her goods from Ereen, a city on the Chinese border, once or twice a month, depending on sales. She transports them back to the market to sell. Myagmarsuren started her business in 1997 and quickly established herself in the local business community. She hopes to soon expand her business and increase her earnings. 


Myagmarsuren is a gentle, hardworking and neat woman. She says, “I am trying my best to have my own house, enlarge my business in the future. I wish I would have a small clothes store in my town.” 


 She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothes and warm garments to sell and to decorate and repair the house in which she is currently living.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella O. is currently in the business of selling and brewing a local alcoholic beverage at home, and is requesting a loan to stock brewing materials, like tins and yeast, so she can brew more to sell.  Stella is 29 years old and is married to a husband who is a teacher. She has two children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bar and stock crates of beer to sell.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase brewing materials

loans.name: Mapendo Plus Group

texts.en:
Claude Niangala, 49, is the manager of the Community Bank named “Mapendo Plus.” It is composed of 18 members united in solidarity to receive Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Claude has been part of the micro-enterprise world since 1995, having already received and repaid seven MFI HOPE DRC loans. A beverage-seller in the south-west part of Kinshasa, Claude will use the new loan he is requesting to buy more crates of drinks to retail, with the goal of increasing his profits. His business generates a profit of $60 per week, and his ambition is to become a beverage provider in his area and open a drugstore. Claude is married and the father of four children whose ages range from 8 and 15. All of them attend school.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beverages to resell at a profit

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn E. is from the city of Prenza Tangub City. She is 42 years old. Evelyn is widowed and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products like shampoo, soap, and milk in the local community. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Evelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Evelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Restock her business

loans.name: Baktygul's Group

texts.en: Baktygul A. is leader of this group. She is 51 years old and is a widow. Baktygul sells clothes and her elder sons help her with her business. She started selling clothes seven years ago when she rented a small shop with the help of a loan of 10,000 TJS from Kiva partner, Mol Bulak Finance. Now, she earns 12,000 TJS. With the help of a loan, Baktygul was able to purchase a truck and furniture for her house. Also, she was able to increase her turnover. However, she wishes to increase her business further and this is why she applied for a loan. With the loan Baktygul wants to purchase school uniforms and start a wholesale trade. In the future, she plans to reinvest all her profits in her business. About the other group members: Gulmira T. is treasurer of the group. She is 37, married, and has two children: her son is 16 and her daughter is 13 and both of them go to school. Her husband is an electrician while Gulmira is a nurse at the local hospital. She is applying for a loan in order to purchase furniture for her house. In the future, she is planning to build a house and bathhouse. Kanymbiubiu N. is fifty and a widow with four children: her sons are twenty-five, twenty two and sixteen and her daughter is twenty years old. Her youngest son works in clothing manufacture and her elder daughter is a waitress. Kanymbiubiu sells fish. Before that she was selling meat but three years ago she switched to selling fish. She started selling fish with an initial investment of 360 soms and now she earns 3,000 soms. She has a significant number of patrons and she is able to form very friendly relationships with them. Recently, one of her children was married and Kanymbiubiu therefore spent the most part of her money. Now, she needs some money to continue her business and so she is applying for a loan in order to increase her turnover. In the near future, she is planning to reinvest most part of her profits in her business and also raise her children. Kulnara D. is forty-five and married. She has three children: her sons are nineteen and eighteen years old and her daughter is four years old. Her youngest daughter goes to kindergarten and her elder son is a mason in a boiler room while her second son works for a private entrepreneur who produces confectionery. Kulnara is a worker in a factory that produces alcoholic drinks. She is applying for a loan in order to purchase an automobile for her family. In the future, she plans to open a store focused on selling convenience goods. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase school uniforms to sell and start a wholesale trade

loans.name: María Leticia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

La señora Marie tiene 47 años, está casada hace 20 años y tiene 7 hijos,  4 de ellos aun viven con ella. Los mayores viven en Manta y los que viven con ella están estudiando en el colegio.
 
Ella y su esposo se dedican al comercio, venden recipientes y otros productos de plástico, trabajan desde las seis de la mañana hasta las 16 h00, salen a ofrecer sus productos en los campos ya que por allá estos productos son muy vendidos. Estos productos los compran en Picoaza en un lugar que le dejan a precio de mayorista para que ellos tengan ganancias, dice que siempre ha trabajado junto con su esposo.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar más mercadería. Está en el Banco Comunal hace cinco ciclos y le ha gustado por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos y por las reuniones informativas.
 
Su sueño es comprar un carro para vender sus productos con más comodidad.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliadora Community Bank meets in the parrish of Sequita, which is in the prosperous area of Montecristi, and full of hard working people who are proud of their roots. La Sequita is a parrish of honest people who only know how to work and take care of their families. María is 47 years old, has been married for 20 years, and has seven children. Four of her children are in school and live with her. The older ones live in Manta. She and her husband work in trade selling containers and other plastic products. They work from 6:00am until 4:00pm. They go out to the country to sell their products, because they are very popular there. They buy their products in Picoaza from a wholesaler, so that they make profits. María has always worked with her husband. She is going to use this loan to purchase more merchandise. They have been in the community bank for five cycles, and they like how easy it is to get loans, and for the informative meetings. Her dream is to purchase a car to sell their products more easily.

Translated from Spanish by Eileen Gessner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase different types of containers, glasses, etc.

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es: La señora María Auxiliadora R. A. tiene la edad de 32 años casada con dos hijos menores de edad, su esposo administra una pequeña venta de productos para el hogar, personal y abarrotes, que ayudan a solventar los gastos en los que la familia incurre mensualmente, ella así mismo apoyos a su marido en el negocio familiar, ellos batallan con una enfermedad especial que tiene su hijo menor y es por el que solicitan un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción que favorezcan a desarrollo y salud, con  el crédito construirán un muro en la sala de su hogar y la instalación de un puerta de madera que salvaguarde la seguridad de los suyos y la tranquilidad de los padres de beneficiar las vidas de sus pequeños, habitando en un espacio digno de morar.
texts.en: María Auxiliadora R. A. is 32 years old, married, and has two young children.  Her husband manages a small business selling home and personal products, as well as groceries in order to pay for the expenses that the family incurs on a monthly basis.  She helps her husband with the family business as well.  They are fighting a special sickness that their youngest son has and for this reason, they are requesting a loan so that they can purchase construction materials that benefit his development and health.  With the loan, they will build a wall in the living room and install a wooden door to provide security for their children and tranquility for themselves as parents of young children, giving them a decent place to live.

loans.use: To build a wall

loans.name: Samuel Waweru

texts.en:
Samuel has practiced farming in Njabini town for the last five years.  He is 31 years old, married to Virginia Njeri and they have two children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his 3rd loan.  He repaid his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy manure, fertilizer and potato seedlings.

In future, Samuel hopes to farm in greenhouses and also practice dairy farming.

loans.use: To buy manure, fertilizer and potato seedlings

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac O. is 29 years old, from Obunga in Kisumu city. He is married to Maureen, and they have three children: five-year-old Evans, three-year-old David and two-week-old Raphael.

Isaac is a carpenter by profession and has been in this business for the past five years. He is currently applying for his second loan from Kadet Ltd, to enable him get some timber and nails to add to his carpentry shop. He earns an income of 8,000 KES.

His main desire is to have a big carpentry shop and be able to cater to his family's needs and improve their living standards.

loans.use: To buy nails and timber

loans.name: Meas

texts.en: Meas S. is 28 years old and is the mother of four children, all of whom are single and live at home. Meas S. has one small shop in the busy market, and she sells a few goods such as snack products, plastic products, and groceries items. She earns an income of approximately $5.35 per day to help support her family’s daily expenses. Her husband is a police officer and has a regular monthly salary. Meas S. has been living with her mother since before she married, and now she wishes to live in her own house with her husband and children. Because she does not have enough money saved, she is asking for a loan in order to buy a small piece of land on which she may build her new house.

loans.use: To buy a small piece of land for a family home.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more vegetables

loans.name: Sabougnouma  (La Bonne Cause) Group

texts.fr:
Sabougnouma est un regroupement de six femmes, toutes mariées, du quartier Hamdallaye de Koutiala qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles ayant en moyenne 38 ans et 4 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, le  bois de chauffe, les habillements,  les fruits et légumes, les céréales, du poisson, le savon, etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a 2 ans. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de groupe et tous les prêts précédents  ont été bien remboursés. 
Tata Dembélé  est un membre du groupe Sabougnouma qui vend du riz, des poissons fumés et des fruits et légumes.  
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des fruits et légumes à Koutiala, du riz et des poissons fumés à Yangasso. Elle vend du poisson et du riz en détail et au comptant au grand marché de Koutiala à une clientèle diverse et variée. Quant aux fruits et légumes (carottes, bananes et mangues etc), ils sont vendus au marché de  Yangasso.
Tandis que Les membres du groupe Sabougnouma espèrent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 110 000FCFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Tata Dembélé compte réaliser 130 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille. 
Elles souhaitent renforcer leur partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne manquent plus.
texts.en:
Sabougnouma is a group of six women, all married and from the Hamdallaye area of Koutiala, who live in traditional extended households and are, on average, 38 years old with 4 children.
This group of women runs businesses selling various items such as firewood, clothing, fruits and vegetables, cereals, fish, soap, etc.
To increase the size of their businesses, the members decided to join the credit program of Soro Yiriwaso (one of Kiva's field partners) two years ago. They are on their third group loan, and both the previous loans were repaid properly.
Tata Dembélé is a member of the Sabougnouma group and sells rice, smoked fish, fruits, and vegetables.
She intends to use this loan to buy fruits and vegetables in Koutiala and rice and smoked fish in Yangasso. She sells the fish and rice at retail and in cash at the grand market in Koutiala to a diverse and varied clientele. As for the fruits and vegetables (carrots, bananas, mangoes, etc.), they are sold at the Yangasso market.
While the members of the Sabougnouma group each hope to realize a monthly profit of 110,000 FCFA throughout the loan cycle, Tata Dembélé intends to realize a profit of 130,000 FCFA.
In addition to repaying the loan, these women will use a portion of their income to meet their current family needs.
They hope to strengthen their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso in order to ensure that their stocks are never lacking.

loans.use: To buy food products

loans.name: Judith Fabiola

texts.es: La Señora Judith vive en la zona de villa Armonía, ella vive en la casa de su esposo el no se encuentra en el país el se separo de doña Judith el año pasado  y se fue a radicar a la Argentina, pero les dejo la casa a sus dos pequeñas hijas de 8 y 9 años las cuales están a cargo de doña Judith ella trabaja vendiendo cosméticos (Productos de belleza, lociones, cremas, perfumes y otros); doña Judith se esfuerza mucho por lo que le dieron el puesto de líder de una prestigiosa empresa de Cosméticos, ahora ella se encarga de manejar grupos grandes,  desde hace un año y dos meses con esfuerzo sigue sacando adelante a sus dos pequeñas hijas, doña Judith además vende los productos en la feria 16 de julio, ella quiere el crédito para poder comprar mas mercadería  para estas fechas de fin de año, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Judith lives in Villa Armonía neighborhood in her husband's house.  Her husband isn't in the country.  He separated from Judith last year and went to settle in Argentina.  However, he left the house to their two young daughters aged 8 and 9 who are in Judith's care.

Judith's business is selling cosmetics (beauty products, lotions, creams, perfume, etc.)  She works hard and, because of her hard work, she was awarded a team leader position in a prestigious cosmetics company.  She is now in charge of managing large groups.  She has been doing this for one year and two months.  Through a lot of hard work she continues to get her two young daughters ahead in life.  Judith also sells products in the '16 de Julio' market.  She would like this loan to buy more merchandise for this end-of-year season.  She is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered her.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics for the end-of-year season

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” MUJERES UNIDAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Isabel; ella tiene 50 años de edad, casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia tiene su carro una combi el cual presta servicio público por el centro de la ciudad, quien maneja su carro es su esposo siendo su horario desde las 06:00 am hasta las 10:00pm todos los días, la socia a la vez viaja a Machupicchu llevando diferente tipo de víveres a sus clientes para que ellos puedan abastecer sus tiendas y así vender sus productos, la socia es una persona bien optimista y con muchas ganas de salir adelante por sus hijos.  

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de llantas para su combi y para comprar algunos víveres como arroz, azúcar, leche, agua, gaseosas, golosinas entre otros más para distribuirlo a sus clientes en Machupicchu.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Isabel is a member of the 'Mujeres Unidas' (United Women) community bank which is located in Cusco district, province and department.

Isabel is 50 years old, married, and has 3 children.  She owns a minivan which is used to provide a public service in the city center.  It is Isabel's husband who drives the vehicle.  He works from 6.00am to 10.00pm every day.  Isabel also travels to Machpicchu, delivering food products to her customers so that they can stock their stores and sell the products.  Isabel is a very optimistic person who has a great desire to get ahead in life for her children's sake.

Isabel is requesting this loan to buy tires for her minivan and to buy some food products such as rice, sugar, milk, water, soda, candy, etc. to distribute to her customers in Machupicchu.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy tires for her minivan and to buy some food products such as rice, sugar, milk, water, soda, candies, etc. to distribute to her customers in Machupicchu.

loans.name: Nader

texts.en: Nader is a 34-year-old married man who lives with his wife and child in Berziet. In 2005, he opened his own supermarket and now is hoping that through this loan he will be able to get all the supplies he needs for his supermarket. He hopes that this will bring in more customers and increase his income.

loans.use: To get all the supplies he needs for his supermarket

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita L. is from the village of Villaluz, Benito Soliven, Isabela. She is 46 years old. Pacita is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Pacita owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Pacita has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Pacita joined Kiva's partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Pacita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to buy additional products to sell. Pacita is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will also be used to purchase more products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Pacita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional food products to sell
